Manager.description: When adding a new feed the text "Type in the URL of the Feed here" is at the same position as the "confirm" and "cancel" which looks somekind of strange... Here is a screenshot: It's probably a known issue but I thought it would be better to report it incase it isn't.
Manager.title: The "Add a new Feed" screen looks some kind of strange

Manager.description: I always have the problem that I can't find the podcast that I have already downloaded when I am offline. Therefore I asked myself if it would be possible to add an option which would automatically add every downloaded Podcast to the queue?
Manager.title: Suggestion: Automatically add downloaded items to queue

Manager.description: I am not able to listen to Podcasts in the ogg vorbis format, I can download them with AntennaPod and play them with my music player, but I can't directly play them with AntennaPod.
Manager.title: Playback Problems

Manager.description: I don't know if this is a bug or if this is planned but AntennaPod also displays me RSS Items which doesn't have a enclosure tag and because AntennaPod is a podcatcher I would prefer it if it would only display those items which actually have a enclosure tag.
Manager.title: Display only those feed items which have a enclosure tag

Manager.description: I am not so sure if this is a bug or if this is a feature but I think the back button in the top left corner should take me to the previous antennapod screen(even if this is some kind of a duplicated functionality because the android back button alreday does that kind of thing). For example if you select a podcast in the new screen and press the top left corner button it will take you to the screen which displays all podcasts of this specific podcast and not the previous screen(which was the new screen in this example).
Manager.title: The "back button" in the top left corner behaves some kind of strange

Manager.description: Could you add a .nomedia file to the directory where antennapod stores podcast images and podcasts by default? Because this will prevent the gallery from indexing podcast covers. Besides it will prevent music players from indexing podcasts, which is a usefull thing(at least I think so).
Manager.title: Feature request: .nomedia file

Manager.description: Is wiould be great if AntennaPod would be available in languages other than English. It could be done using https://www.transifex.com/ for example. I'd volunteer to translate it to Russian.
Manager.title: Feature request: Localization

Manager.description: I have Novo7 Paladin tablet: http://www.ainovo.com/novo7paladin-specs.html and I don't see AntennaPod in Google Play on this device. At the same time other podcast managers (podkicker, doggcatcher) are available. Also, I downloaded and installed apk on this device and it works perfectly. Is there something in android manifest which could be the reason for this?
Manager.title: Availability in Google Play

Manager.description: It would be great if AntennaPod could show pictures embedded in "enhanced podcast" m4a files like the iPhone does. Example feed: http://www.schoene-ecken.de/feed/podcast/
Manager.title: Support for embedded images in MP4 Enhanced Podcast files

Manager.description: Hey, I'd would be create if Settings could include an option to change the background color to black. Most if not all my apps have that. Thanks!
Manager.title: Dark Skin

Manager.description: Since android 2.3 there is this download manager thing, which handles http downloads. Would it be possible to use the android download manager for downloading podcasts via AntennaPod?
Manager.title: Feature Request: Support downloads via android download manager

Manager.description: Hi, in my eyes has your software the most potential to will the best podcast app on android market. :) Playlist Support (minimum Audio and Video Podcast playlist) podcast will delete after listen 2.a. mark podcast to hold on the phone "cloud" sync for multiple devices Video Playback (i can not test it on my phone during crashes) i hope you will bring much more tools on the app. regards, Thomas
Manager.title: Feature Request

Manager.description: When i add a random feed from http://dradio.de/ antennaPod loads half a second and didn't add it. All thehttp://www.dradio.de/podcast/ir Feeds: http://www.dradio.de/podcast/ Firefox and other podcatcher/feedreader have no problems with their feeds. Greetings lightonflux
Manager.title: Cannot add dradio.de-feeds

Manager.description: First of all: Let me thank you for this app, just what I was waiting for! However there is a small issue with two of my podcasts which might be somehow related to #14. Or maybe not. AntennaPod cannot find downloadable files in the following feeds: http://ulm.ccc.de/dev/radio/podcast-ogg.xml http://www.duden.de/feed/podcast In the latter case this might be a problem with the feed since SwallowCatcher cannot handle that one either. Thank you very much in advance for fixing this issue. proedie
Manager.title: No Downloadable Files Found for some Podcasts

Manager.description: First of all, I want to thank you for making the best free podcatcher I have found to date. I think headset controls would make this app even better. Even as basic as just play/pause would be great. Also would there be a way to automatically clear the refresh/download notification or an option to not show them at all? Thanks
Manager.title: Feature Request - Headset Controls

Manager.description: I noticed that the lockscreen controls are not centered and missing the right button. I can provide screenshot of the issue if needed.
Manager.title: Possible Bug

Manager.description: Would it be possible to have rewind and fast forward during playback. Maybe longpress to fast forward/rewind?
Manager.title: Feature Request - Playback Controls

Manager.description: I have noticed that often when i disconnect my earbuds and then reconnect them the lockscreen controls disappear and i have to force close and restart the app to get them back. Any idea what is causing this?
Manager.title: Possible Bug - Lockscreen

Manager.description: First off, thank you for your work. I'm glad someone has put together a good open source podcast app to replace Google Listen. Now, on to the problem. When I add two feeds from the CBC no new entry is created for the second one, but podcasts for the second start appearing in the list for the first. The CBC seems to be keeping all their XML files in the same directory (and this may be the source of the problem). To reproduce this, add the following feed: "http://www.cbc.ca/podcasting/includes/spark.xml" For me it shows up correctly in the feeds tab Then add "http://www.cbc.ca/podcasting/includes/writersandco.xml" No new feed appears, but podcasts for the second feed start to appear in the list for the first. To me this seems to be incorrect behaviour. Perhaps the URL used for the first feed is being replaced with the second -- I can't tell from what I'm seeing. You can reverse the order of adding the feeds -- the first feed added appears, the second always gets "added" to the first. If either feed is on a different host (for example NPR) two separate feeds are created and seem to work correctly. Perhaps the problem is that both of these XML files contain the link to the same site: "http://www.cbc.ca/podcasting", even though they are different and separate feeds. Thanks again. Tony
Manager.title: Adding podcasts from same source

Manager.description: One of the annoyances I've had with trying out any new podcast app is that I have to manually re-type in the urls of all of the podcasts that I have already subscribed to in Google Listen. This is true of AntennaPod as well, because few of the podcasts I want are in the Miro guide. I suspect that I am not the only one with this issue. I also suspect (though I don't know) that Listen is the most widely used podcatcher on Android. Perhaps is would help adoption of the app if the user could easily import their existing podcast subscriptions in Listen. I know nothing of what is involved in implementing such a feature, or if it is even possible. I believe a similar feature exists in Firefox for Android, where bookmarks and cookies can be imported from "Browser". Thanks for your attention Tony PS: None of this would be (as much of) an issue if I could get Firefox (or Browser) to subscribe to a podcast by simply tapping on the RSS link. Perhaps I'm just missing something obvious.
Manager.title: Feature Request: Importing from Google Listen

Manager.description: A lot of times, speakers speak too slowly or too fast. It would be great to have a way to adjust playback speed, especially without a $5 third party library like all other podcatchers do.
Manager.title: Variable speed playback

Manager.description: http://podcast.homerj.de/podcasts.xml does not work with AntennaPod but seems to work for Apple Thank you for AntennaPod
Manager.title: please add support for homerj.de podcast

Manager.description: When i listen to a podcast i just listen, i don't look a the show notes. After i listened a episode completely the episode is removed from the play list. If i want to browse through the show notes i have to retrieve the episode in "feeds" → "podcast name" → "list of episodes". I think a simply list which provides the last fifteen episodes which are completely listened would be a great time saver. BTW: The "automatic delete"-function should skip items of this list. Therewith it is easy to listen to something again. Hope my request is comprehensible :) Greetings lightonflux
Manager.title: "Recently listened" - Feature request

Manager.description: The new auto-delete-function works well, but is a bit to fast / rigorous. Wouldn't it be better that the user can configure how many episodes should be leave in the storage or how much space antennapod can use? In GUI: A simple config dialogue where the user can define something like: store 20 episode or 500 MB Hope my request is understandable ;) Greetings lightonflux
Manager.title: More intellegent delete function

Manager.description: I wonder if its possible to add an option in "settings" to "clear notifications after completed" or something to that effect. I understand they are needed while updating feeds and downloading episodes but it would be great to have them automatically go away when completed instead of having to manually clear them every time. Thank you
Manager.title: Feature Request - Clear Notifications

Manager.description: When you play an episode from the play list which isn't the first or last, a "bug" appears when you finished one episode. Normally play lists are played from the top to the bottom, no matter where you start. but AntennaPod jumps to the first entry every time you finished an episode, no matter which item is played. How it should be: If an episode is listened, the next (means the under lying entry) episode should be played.
Manager.title: Playlist jumps to the first entry when an episode is listened.

Manager.description: If you tab on a video to show the controls, the lower bar moves in from above. That's why there is a white block which appears when the bar is moving. The control bar should move up from the buttom of the screen.
Manager.title: Video: control bar animation looks wrong

Manager.description: I am not a person who changes his feeds every day. But when i start antenna i see all the well known stuff. But more interesting is the new stuff. In other words: When antennaPod start "new" should be the selected tab. And btw it looks really nice if the blue bar is symmetric.
Manager.title: Change start-tab to "new"

Manager.description: Hi, there is a podcast which doesn't work the right way. http://www.hackerfunk.ch/ Feeds: http://www.hackerfunk.ch/podcast.php?cat=OGG http://www.hackerfunk.ch/podcast.php?cat=MP3 AtennaPod makes everything right except that it doesn't notice(d) that there are audio files in posts. I am not sure whats the problem, but other Catcher works fine (Google Listen, gPodder, Rhythmbox, BeyondPod). Greetings lof
Manager.title: [Bug] Hackerfunk Podcast - Audio file is not detected

Manager.description: In version 0.9.5.1 (from FDroid, if that matters), if you enable the "Display only episodes" checkbox and then try to download (directly from the list of episodes, either for a single podcast or on the "New" tab) an episode that comes after where a hidden non-episode would have been, you either get the wrong file or no option to download at all. It's as if it's ignoring the "Display only episodes" option when working out which file to download.
Manager.title: Wrong episode downloaded in "Display only episodes" mode

Manager.description: For the feed at http://podcast.hr-online.de/lateline/podcast.xml the image is not loading. That's not a bug in AntennaPod, because the feed is broken (it contains image tags with empty urls in every single item), but maybe it would be possible to work around that by ignoring image tags that aren't direct children of a channel element.
Manager.title: Podcast image not loading

Manager.description: Notification controls Ability to reorder queue Automatically mark as read if podcast is downloaded Automatically remove from queue if podcast is deleted Just some ideas that could be implemented in the future. Thank you
Manager.title: Feature Requests

Manager.description: If there is network connection the app displays pictures in show notes. But if the network connection is down you can change to menu of antennapod and then move back and the images is not there. Please download and store images in show notes if the episode is downloaded.
Manager.title: Images in shownotes will not display if network is down

Manager.description: Hi there, just a minor enhancement request: if you have many downloads, it can take quite a while for the first one to finish as the downloads are parallel. Perhaps you could add an option so the downloads can also be sequential?
Manager.title: Download: sequential instead of parallel

Manager.description: In Feed list view, there is a number for every podcast which tells the user how many podcast episodes this podcast has in total. But it would be great to see in this list view, how many episodes where downloaded, too.
Manager.title: Enhancement: view number of downloaded episodes in list view

Manager.description: I put an file called "Podcasts.opml" in the indicated directory, but AntennaPod does not show it in its OPML import activity and I can't import my podcasts. I'm using the Google Play version of AntennaPod.
Manager.title: Can not import OPML file

Manager.description: Hi, I tried to use a feed which requires HTTP Basic Authentication: https://couch.fernsehkritik.tv/feed/ But it seems that AntennaPod don't support feeds with authentication. Would be nice to add this feature :-) Regards Bernd
Manager.title: Support feeds which uses HTTP Basic Authentication

Manager.description: Some feeds give all their audio files the same name (e.g. http://rss.sciam.com/sciam/60-second-earth). This will lead to AntennaPod overwriting the existing audio file when a new episode is downloaded, so basically only one episode can be present at any time.
Manager.title: New podcasts overwrite existing files if filenames coincide

Manager.description: It would be nice if there was a way to specify the directory where AntennaPod saves the Podcasts, for example /mnt/sdcard/Podcasts instead of the current location. This would be particularly useful for phones with both internal memory (/mnt/sdcard) and an external sdcard (/mnt/extSdCard).
Manager.title: Make data directory configurable

Manager.description: Would it be possible to support multi selection in the episode list-view for example by using long press.
Manager.title: Multiselect

Manager.description: Last update removes all elements of the playlist. listened an unlistenes episodes. It's not funny if you lose 30 episode you want to listen. :)
Manager.title: Last Update (→ 0.9.5.3) clears playlist

Manager.description: the current episode of pentaradio doesn't start playing. AntennaPod just displays the same message like after pressing "stream". "Bereite vor" - "prepare bla" This Episode: http://www.c3d2.de/news/pentaradio24-20121023.html Feed URL: http://c3d2.de/podcast.xml
Manager.title: Episode not playing - displays "prepare bla"-message

Manager.description: That feature would be helpful. If a episode is marked as unread its easier to find (bold text etc.).
Manager.title: Feature: Mark episode as unread

Manager.description: Like in this picture: http://i.imgur.com/o0dSL.jpg At the moment its not difficult to hit to button, but it feels a bit "delicate".
Manager.title: Expand arrow button

Manager.description: I think there's no reason for a differentiation between "downloaded" and "in queue". It just doesn't seem useful, but rather a hassle to me.
Manager.title: Unify queue with downloaded episodes.

Manager.description: One possible solution for this cold be to unify the "downloaded" and the "in queue" state.
Manager.title: Ability to view downloaded (not queued) items.

Manager.description: I'd like AntennaPod to automatically enqueue and download new episodes
Manager.title: Auto-Download option

Manager.description: Please add an option to star (add favorite) episodes. So the users can easily create a list of interesting episodes. If they want to hear that episode the open the favorite list and can download the episode again.
Manager.title: Favorite List

Manager.description: This just occured to me. I had my sd-card mounted in read-only mode (don't ask why) and antennaPod crashed when removing an item. when i restarted the app, the item was indeed removed, but still visible in /sdcard/Android/data/... I think it would be easy enough if AntennaPod first tries to delete the file, then remove it from the database. That way it will crash before it removes the item from the db.
Manager.title: Does not recover from failed file deletion.

Manager.description: I had a Podcast feed where AntednnaPod did not download an episode. It only returned HTTP status code 302 as error in the log. HTTP status code 302 denotes a redirect to a new location. AntennaPod should follow redirects in HTTP downloads.
Manager.title: AntennaPod does not follow HTTP redirects

Manager.description: When importing an OPML file, the text field is displayed to the user when picking which subscriptions to import, rather than the title feed. E.g. with:
Manager.title: Import OPML file shows text field to user, not title

Manager.description: I'd like to specify the folder, where downloaded episodes are saved. My phone memory (and internal SD memory) is used up with all kind of stuff I cannot move but I have an additional SD card with plenty of free memory which I'd like to use to save my podcast episodes.
Manager.title: Allow setting a download folder

Manager.description: Neither can I download episodes nor update podcast feeds. The download log just says: Unknown Error. Before this happened, I had a similar issue as described in #61 -- AntennaPod could not delete a file properly -- so this might be somehow related. Thank you very much in advance for helping me on this. Best wishes Proedie
Manager.title: All Downloads Fail

Manager.description: I use Antennapod on two devices and on one of them, when I try to download a podcast episode, I receive the message "An error occurred when trying to donwload the file: Failed to access the external storage". Also, when I update the episodes list, the download fails and I receive the message "IO error: /mnt/sdcard/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files/cache/feed-CBN - Podcast - No Divã do Gikovate (Invalid argument)" On the other device, this feed works without any problem. I've already tried to exclude the feed and delete this cache directory but It didn't help although It seems like some cache or temporary files problem... Is there any other directory I may clean or exclude to try to make this feed work ? Thank you, Regards, Renato.
Manager.title: Problem with RSS feed

Manager.description: Sometimes the downloaded podcasts are forgotten. The download icon just disappears from the list. But in the download log it is still visible that the download was successful. If I look into the "Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files/media" directory I can see that the file is there. I haven't found a way to reproduce this, but this problem happened at least on two different devices.
Manager.title: AntennaPod forgets downloaded podcasts

Manager.description: As a user, I don't really think of "new" episodes as opposed to "queued" ones. I just want to know what new stuff there is to hear, and operate the app while giving it as little thought as possible. I would AntennaPod's interface to reflect this. I made a quick mockup that you can see here: As you see there's still a "Feeds" tab, but the "New" and "Queued" tabs are replaced by a single "Episodes" one. The episode being played is at the top of it, with some control buttons. Right below it are the episodes that have been downloaded and are ready to be listened. When the current episode ends, it goes to the History and is replaced by the first item in the list. Old, listened items are removed automatically and make room for new ones to be downloaded (also automatically) and added to the list. This way, supposing I have already subscribed to a selection of feeds that I like, I can keep listening to new episodes without ever worrying to check for new episodes, or having to download newer ones or reorder the list, or even ever leaving the "Episodes" screen. As a user, I would only have to press "Play" to start listening and "Pause" to stop, and no further action would ever be required from me.
Manager.title: Merge "New" and "Queue" tabs for easier use

Manager.description: The text Shownotes screen is a bit too close to the screen edge. according to the Design Guidelines it should have a margin of 16DP if I understand it aright ^^.
Manager.title: add some margin to shownotes

Manager.description: I don't know how to call this but both the Google Music and the youtube app have this handy little button which lets you chose the output device for audio: on tap, it opens a context menu containing all available output devices:
Manager.title: add Audio output button

Manager.description: I have used SparseRSS to play audio from this feed http://www.guardian.co.uk/global-development/series/global-development-podcast/rss but Antennapod doesn't allow one to play audio: it just shows the show notes.
Manager.title: Can't play audio from guardian.co.uk podcast

Manager.description: Hya finally a great working floss app on android (1st one since my beloved gpodder on the n900 :)) can i ask an option to support android intents IE i want to be able to use tasker to auto play the current podcast in the playlist/queue when i plug in my headphones. i use that in other podapps that support intnets IE: http://beyondpod.com/support/index.php?/Knowledgebase/Article/View/31/5/beyondpod-public-apis thx alot Zeltak
Manager.title: add intents

Manager.description: Hya again im a huge gpodder fan (both on the desktop and my old n900 phone..). gpodder.net is a libre web service that allows you to manage your podcast subscriptions and discover new content. If you use multiple devices, you can synchronize subscriptions and your listening progress. it would be great if antennaPod can make use of this to import but even better sync the podcasts and listning postion between Antennapod instances (phone,tablet,goog TV etc) thx alot z
Manager.title: support for gpooder.net for import and syncing

Manager.description: When you download an episode and delete the file via a filemanager AntennaPod thinks the file would stiill be there. If you want to play it it doesnt work, it hangs at "preparing" Please add a check whether the files are still present or not or at least add an option to redownload an episode
Manager.title: Doesn't check whether downloaded files still exist

Manager.description: Hi! Building AntennaPod with Maven works great! Now, if I want to fork it to build my own customized version, I'd love to do that with an IDE. But whether I choose IntelliJ or Eclipse, I run into configuration issues. Can you give me a hint on what to do if starting development in AntennaPod with an IDE? Would be great! Thanks! PS: this is not really an issue, I know, but I found no other way of contacting you. If you like, please send me an email to toby(at)isolation.de, I'd love to discuss my ideas with you. Cheers, Toby
Manager.title: Introduction to building AntennaPod with Eclipse / IntelliJ

Manager.description: it would be nice to automaticly flattr a podcast episode when you listen like 80% of it. it should drop a notification then.
Manager.title: auto flattr

Manager.description: One feature that present in some podcast players, e.g. DoubleTwist, PocketCasts, etc., that I miss in AntennaPod is Forward and Backward Buttons, i.e. a button that skips ahead 30 seconds and one that skips behind 10 seconds. In regards to the interface, I think PocketCasts actually nailed it by making the buttons large overlays on the image art. Clicking to the right of the image art skips ahead 30 seconds. Clicking to the left of the image art skips behind 10 seconds. It makes it much easier to use the buttons blindly.
Manager.title: Forward and Backward Buttons

Manager.description: EscapePod has recently updated their feeds to use gzip encoding on the feed results. http://feeds.escapeartists.net/EscapePod Looking at the results that come back thru the browser using Fiddler (http tracer) I see that the orginal URL redirects (302) to http://escapepod.org/feed/rss2 which redirects (301) to http://escapepod.org/feed/ all of these have HTTP header of Content-Encoding: gzip. Looking at the downloaded feed in the cache directory I can see that the feed is still gzipped rather than unzipped to plain text. Antenapod throws a "Download failed Unsupported Feed type: Invalid type" Let me know of you want HTTP tracings or the gzipped feeds. Regards Stuart
Manager.title: Appears to have issues with gzip encoded feeds.

Manager.description: Please consider stopping the service, when it is not needed. I.e. only manual updates and no headphone polling.
Manager.title: Stop service if not needed

Manager.description: Let me start off by saying thank you for producing high quality open source software and sharing it with everyone. I have been wanting to mess with android app development for a while, and I have started hacking at your code to understand how things work. Anyways, I've been playing around with the Google Reader API in the hopes of adding (some level of) google reader functionality to AntennaPod. At the very least it would be trivial to get an OAuth2 token from Android and then access the OMPL for a particular label directly from google reader as an import option (I've already gotten this level of functionality working in a dummy app). This would be way easier than the current OMPL import functionality and would only require one extra permission (USE_CREDENTIALS or something). Taking the idea further, one could imagine using google reader as a full on sync target for all feeds and read/unread statuses. This isn't so much a feature request as a request to gauge interest. If there is interest in such a feature (I know that Issue #21 is sort of a request in this direction) and no one is working on it, I'd like to contribute. If not, I can just try to develop the changes in a fork that I'll use myself and won't submit to Google Play.
Manager.title: Google Reader Integration

Manager.description: please split the delete option never when removing from queue after listened both because i want an episode to be deleted when i completed it and not when its manually removed from the queue
Manager.title: Split delete option

Manager.description: If I've been listening to a podcast and then pause it, sometimes at some point several minutes (or even hours) later AntennaPod will start playing the podcast all on its own. This isn't just pocket activation, it happens when it's sitting on my desk, or when I'm using it in the car. The usual situation is that I've been listening in the car or on headphones, I'll pause the playback, and then it will spontaneously start again a while later. This seems to happen regardless of whether something was plugged into the headphone jack during playback and both when playback has been paused normally and when it's been paused because the audio cable was unplugged. This happens in 0.9.6.4, and in the previous version. Please let me know what I can do to help via logs, etc. Sadly, I can't figure out how to reproduce the behavior, but it happens several times a week. I'm experiencing this issue on my Tmo Galaxy S3 running Cyanogenmod 10.0.0-d2tmo (Android 4.1.2).
Manager.title: AntennaPod starts playing audio on its own

Manager.description: After upgrade from 0.9.6.2 to 0.9.6.3 (fdroid repo) videos from http://feeds.feedburner.com/cnet/allhdpodcast cannot be downloaded any more. The download fails almost immediately. After downgrade back to 0.9.6.2 the download works again.
Manager.title: Regression in 0.9.6.3: Download of videos from "All CNET Video Podcasts (HD)" fails

Manager.description: Playback can already be paused when the headphones are disconnected. It would be great if playback could be resumed when the headphones are plugged in again. I loved this feature on ACast: when somebody starts to talk, I just disconnect the headphones directly in my jacket's pocket, and when they're done, I just push the jack back in, and playback resumes. With AntennaPod I can do the disconnecting to stop, but to restart the podcast I need to get my phone out, unlock it, and click on the play button. Even less handy when I'm on my bike ;)
Manager.title: Feature Request: Start playback when headphones are connected

Manager.title: Feature request: Auto download new episodes when connected to charging.

This is different from the "Auto-delete" option in that the episode shouldn't be deleted from my cache when it is dequeued. Keep it in the cache in case I want to listen/view it again. Only delete it from cache at a later cache-expiration period, such as 7 days.
Manager.title: Auto-dequeue

Here my feature request: I have a bt headset with display and it would be nice, if I could get meta informations of the podcasts displayed there. I am not sure if this is part of the a2dp specs, but here are the specs: https://www.bluetooth.org/Technical/Specifications/adopted.htm Thanks and keep on working on this nice piece of software!

Manager.description: Hi, I am experiencing lots of failed downloads on cm10.1 nightly on a Samsung Galaxy Nexus. I assume it's because the wifi gets turned of after not working with the phone. Is it possible, that AntennaPod "blocks" this while downloading something. Thanks a lot!
Manager.title: failing Downloads through shutdown wifi?

Manager.description: When I get back home I usually finish to listen to my podcast with my phone but it would be a lot better to be able to stream audio via VLC to PC. It could be outside of AntennaPod scope but it would be nice to have this option.
Manager.title: Streaming to VLC

Manager.description: With latest version (0.9.7) AntennaPod use language translation. It would be nice to be able to choose the language you want to use.
Manager.title: Ability to choose language

Manager.description: In player view you can set a sleep timer but there's no button in interface to allow a quick access. Beside adding a button would make sleep timer more discoverable.
Manager.title: Add a button for sleep timer in player view

Manager.description: When pressed pause button on lock screen, the player disappears and I cannot press play again to continue listening the episode. Env: Sony Xperia SL Android 4.0.4 AntennaPod 0.9.7
Manager.title: When pressed pause button on lock screen, the player disappears

Manager.description: I don't think I have ever fully grasped what a "New" episode is. I guess it's new because it's been added recently? How recently? When does a new episode stop being new? Do I need to listen to it for it to become old, or does it automatically after some time? This suggestion is kind of related to #79 in that new and old episodes are added to the same list. The suggestion is to do away with the concept of "New" episodes and replace it with a concept much easier to grasp: "Downloaded" vs. "Undownloaded" episodes. The idea is that you have only one queue, and all new episodes are added to the bottom of that queue. The ones at the top are downloaded automatically when you have a WiFi connection, and then deleted after you listen to them in order to make room for new ones. That way you always have fresh new episodes ready to be listened without having to use 3G data, and you never have to worry about which ones you download because the application takes care of that by itself. Why separate downloaded episodes from undownloaded ones, then, if it's just one list? To let you know which ones you can listen to without using your data connection. That way, if there is one episode that attracts you in the "Undownloaded" section you can download it while you're at home, which will add it to "Downloaded" and let you listen to it on the go.
Manager.title: Instead of "Queued" and "New", use "Downloaded" and "Undownloaded"

Manager.description: This suggestion is related to #79 and #116 because it uses a single queue and doesn't distinguish between new and old episodes, but downloaded and undownloaded. I think that switching to a card interface would make the queue look cleaner and make it easier to delete unwanted episodes: As you see, each episode is separated from the rest and all the relevant data appears in a clean way: you can see the episode's title and channel, as well as duration and progress (except for undownloaded episodes, which show their size instead). Similarly to #79, the episode being played is shown at the top of the queue. Its card is a bit bigger than the rest and shows some extra data. It also has a bigger proggress bar that lets you scroll through the episode. As specified in #116 all new episodes are added to the bottom of the "Undownloaded" list. As you listen to the ones at the top they get deleted, making room, and the ones at the top of "Undownloaded" are downloaded and moved to the bottom of the "Downloaded" list, so that you know that you can listen to them without using any mobile data. You can browse through the whole list and if any particular episodes don't attract you you can simply swipe them away and make room for new ones, which is one of the main benefits of the card interface. If you're browsing through the Undownloaded episodes and you see one that you like you can long-press it and choose to "Play" it (which moves it to the top of the Downloaded list and starts playing it right away) or "Download" it (which moves it to the bottom of the Downloaded list).
Manager.title: Try a card interface

Manager.description: This issue is related to #116 because it implies the workflow suggested there. When you long-press an episode you get a lot of options that could be simplified: In that screenshot: "Remove" deletes the file but leaves the episode in the playing queue. "Remove from queue" returns the file to the waiting list, but keeps the file in the phone. If #116 is implemented neither of the above would make sense because being in the queue imply being downloaded, and the other way around. But we do need: A "Remove" option that completely deletes the file and makes the app forget about the episode. This should apply to items in the queue, waiting list or history. Also, in addition to a long-press action this could be triggered by swiping the episode away. An "Add to queue" option that takes items from the waiting list or the history and adds them to the bottom of the playing queue. Also, of course, sets them to be downloaded ASAP. Optionally some "Return to waiting list" and "Move to history" options for items in the queue. I don't think I would want these, though: once you move an episode to the queue you probably won't want to move it back unless you've lost your interest and don't want to listen to it anymore, in which case it would be simpler to just swipe it away and be done with it. "Mark as read" removes the "new" banner. "Mark as unread" adds it again. I find these largely irrelevant and, unless I've misunderstood their function, I don't think they're worth two slots in the long-press menu. Therefore, if you long-press an item in the playing queue I think that you should get these options: Play, which moves the episode to the top and starts playing it. Remove, already explained. And if you long-press an item in the waiting list or history you should get: Play. Remove. Add to playing queue, which adds it to the bottom of the queue. In addition to that, It could be useful to show these options as buttons on the bottom bar so that you can apply them to several items at once. Here's a quick mockup: As you see the mockup shows several selected items and three buttons at the bottom bar, which correspond to Play, Remove and Add to queue.
Manager.title: Simplify the long-press menu

Manager.description: If #116 is implemented there won't be any need for a Downloads screen. It will be easy to spot episodes being downloaded, because they will always be either in the playing queue or in the top spots of the waiting list. If you give them a "downloading" icon and a download progress bar (similar to the progress bar in half-listened items) seeing what downloads are taking place will be so simple right on the main screen that Downloads will be able to be removed, thus simplifying the interface and without losing anything.
Manager.title: Remove the "Downloads" screen.

Manager.description: Several issues suggest using auto-download. In order to have that we need the app to do the following: Devote some of the phone's memory to store podcasts when they are added to the playing queue. Erase already listened episodes in order to make room for new ones. This brings two problems: There needs to be a way to decide how much space is given. Episodes shouldn't be erased IMMEDIATELY after being listened, because if you like an episode and want to listen to it again you would have to use additional data. As a result, there needs to be a way to decide how much space is given to listened episodes. Therefore, two settings are needed: Disk space for cached episodes (by default: 10%). Disk space for listened episodes (by default: 5%). If you had a phone with 8GB memory AntennaPod would automatically download and enqueue new episodes until they reached 800MB, at which point it would stop. Additionally, listened episodes would be kept until they reached 400MB, at which point the older ones would be deleted from the memory. A user with a lower-end phone but really into podcasts could use those settings in order to devote more space.
Manager.title: Reserve some space to cache enqueued items and to keep listened ones.

Manager.description: After AntennaPod automatically downloads and enqueues a number of episodes, it would be useful to have a notification that reads "There are X new items ready to listen" and has a "Play" button to start listening right away.
Manager.title: Show notification after auto-downloading items.

Manager.description: Im a begginer in making android app. I was trying to load this on eclipse but there are many errors. I've already followed all the things in the wiki. Is there a prerequisites on what do I need to download for my SDK to work?
Manager.title: Beginers

Manager.description: Here's a couple mockups of AntennaPod if it used a dropdown to move between sections instead of tabs: I have several reasons to think that this would be better than we have now: First, it would save space. Once you have subscribed to the desired podcasts (and once auto-download and auto-enqueue are implemented) the user shouldn't really have a lot of reasons to switch between sections. He will probably spend most of the time in the Episodes section, so I think that the saved space will become more important than being able to change sections quickly. Second, it would allow to move the History section into the dropdown. Which, being a section and not an action, I think would make more sense than having it inside the overflow menu. Third and most important, it would allow to swipe episodes away. Unwanted episodes could be dismissed very quickly, with the flick of a finger. Which will become very important once new episodes are added automatically to the waiting list. It's important to note that swiping away is impossible with the current approach because horizontal movement just changes sections.
Manager.title: Use a dropdown instead of tabs

Manager.description: This suggestion is included in a couple other issues (e.g. #125) but I think it's worth having its own issue. Now that episodes are added to the waiting list and the playing queue automatically, we need an easy way to dismiss the ones that don't interest us. Swiping away is the quickest and handiest way, and the one many Google apps (e.g. Gmail) are favouring: The user would just have to flick their finger to the left or right, and the episode is dismissed. Unlistened episodes (that is, those the user never even started listening) would be deleted and forgotten, and listened ones (even partially listened ones) would be skipped and go to the History. It could even be used at the top of the queue (that is, on the current episode) to skip the current episode and start listening to the next one, which would be an easy way to implement Skip without having to use extra buttons or UI elements.
Manager.title: Swipe episodes away

Manager.description: Right now the Overflow menu has two different entries for History-related items: "Playback History" and "Downloads" The menu could be freed up if they were shown as tabs inside a "History" section, which would only take one slot in the menu. Additionally, it would make sense to show that item in a dropdown instead of the Overflow menu, which is shown in issue #125. That way it wouldn't even clutter Overflow at all.
Manager.title: "Listened" and "Downloaded" as two tabs inside History.

Manager.description: In the new test version of AntennaPod all enqueued items are downloaded automatically, but they don't show a progress bar until you start listening to them: They also show the word "Length" before they play time, but the ones you have started listening don't. I'm not sure whether or not this is intentional, but it looks like a UI inconsistency to me.
Manager.title: Show a progress bar for all downloaded items

Manager.description: I have been trying the test version for a couple days and it seems to check for new episodes, add them to the queue and download them automatically alright when I press the Refresh button. The only problem I see is that I have to press the button. The idea behind making everything automatic is that the user can add the podcasts he wants and forget about AntennaPod, and the app will still do its thing and serve him new episodes in a silver plate. To manage that the app shouldn't wait until the user opens it and presses Refresh. It should keep working in the background, checking for new episodes every so often (Daily? When the phone is charging and on WiFi?) and if it finds them, enqueue and download them automatically. And of course then let the user know, which is issue #122.
Manager.title: Check for new episodes automatically

Manager.description: The podcast "En Flux Libre"[1] cannot be used through AntennaPod, although they do have the OGG files directly linked into the RSS[2]. Home page: http://www.enfluxlibre.org/ RSS: http://www.enfluxlibre.org/?q=rss.xml It would be nice if AntennaPod could retrieve all/any audio file linked and use them as the actual podcast(s).
Manager.title: Ability to use any media linked in a post

Manager.description: When using Chrome as the default Android browser, the Flattr authorization does not work. After pressing the "Authentifizieren" button in Antennapod, Chrome is opened with the correct Flattr page to allow the app access to the Flattr account. However, after entering the credentials, the page redirects to an flattr4j://de.danoeh... URL, which Chrome seemingly can't handle, resulting in an error 302 (net::ERR_UNKNOWN_URL_SCHEME).
Manager.title: Initial Flattr authorization does not work when using Chrome

Manager.description: If you visit an unqueued, undownloaded episode and click Stream, the episode starts playing and is moved to the top of the queue. But this doesn't happen with the Download and Enqueue actions. If you click Download, the app downloads it but it doesn't add it to the bottom of the queue. If you click Enqueue, the app is added to the bottom of the queue but it isn't downloaded. Downloading an episode should always mean its getting added to the queue (and vice versa if you're on a WiFi) so these two buttons should be merge into a single Enqueue button.
Manager.title: Merge the Download and Enqueue buttons

Manager.description: When I add new feeds they don't work anymore. Feed is cached by its url: /mnt/sdcard/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files/cache/feed-httpwww.ivoox.comfeed_fg_f19701_filtro_1.xml But then it seems to be trying to access it by its name: W/System.err(22100): java.io.FileNotFoundException: /mnt/sdcard/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files/cache/feed-Documentales Sonoros (Invalid argument) This is Play Store version 0.9.7.1.
Manager.title: New feeds not working

Manager.description: Before playing each episode for the first time there's a delay of a few seconds. During it looks like there is network traffic. If coverage is bad it can take more than 20 seconds before start playing.
Manager.title: Delay before playing an episode

Manager.description: It would be nice to have an option to disable/enable the lockscreen widget, especially as right now it seems to stay on after the sleep timer gets down to 0. Will try and post a screenshot the next time it happens.
Manager.title: Option to disable lockscreen widget

Manager.description: please add the mark as unread option again just because i remove an episode from the queue doesn't mean i want it to be read i listen to older episodes when i have nothing new to listen to and so i can see which i haven't heard yet... and make this auto add feature an option... antenna pod just had downloaded older episodes w which were marked as unread and added then to my queue...and when i removed them they were all marked as read... it is a stupid behavior for my workflow with podcast...
Manager.title: No mark as unread option anymore

Manager.description: For mp3s with chapter information, the sleep timer may support setting the playback to end after n chapters instead of absolute time.
Manager.title: Set sleep timer to end playback after n chapters

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Rename "Waiting List" to "New"

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Remove Downloads view and log, just show progress bars on episodes everywhere

Manager.description: I have installed AntennaPod on a 9" tablet with Full HD resolution. The default UI blows application icons to about 1/4 of the tablet hight. That is about 256x256px... The present icon scaled to this size looks awful. I would suggest including a few larger bitmaps or SVG of the original (if Anroid understands SVG icons, of course).
Manager.title: Large Application Icon Needed

Manager.description: When i listen to a podcast that is in the playlist and stop it, after more than 1 hour of playtime, the time in the playlist just shows the correct minutes, and ignores the hour. The display on the bottom shows the correct played time.
Manager.title: Wrong time in Playlist

Manager.description: As a user I would like to define different settings for some podcasts. For example, I don't want to auto-download some of the podcasts I have subscribed to.
Manager.title: Configuration per podcast

Manager.description: I love having the new auto-download feature, but I find that the auto-enqueuing of auto-downloaded podcasts is a bit too aggressive. I like being able to create a playlist from the available podcasts. While I might be interested in a podcast in general, certain episodes may not strike my fancy, and I like being able to leave them out of the playlist. But with the new auto-downloading, I don't seem to have that ability. I had only used AntennaPod for a few days before this update, but I remember there being a setting to enqueue podcasts when they were downloaded. This allowed me to see a list of available podcasts in the "Waiting List" section, and then add specific ones of them to the "Queue" section as they interested me. I like auto-downloading, though, so what seems ideal to me is for podcasts to be auto-downloaded into the "Waiting List," but allow for manual enqueuing -- possibly by returning the option to enable/disable enqueuing downloaded podcasts. I hope that makes sense. I really think AntennaPod is great! Thanks for all your hard work.
Manager.title: Auto-download and auto-enqueue should be separated

Manager.description: Hey, since I (and I guess most of the people) just download and update their feeds on wifi, the submenus Playlist and Queue under Episodes is obsolete since queue is just used for the few seconds it needs to download the podcasts. So I suggest to have an and option in the settings menu to hide the categorys. Im not sure if someone needs it at all.
Manager.title: Option to hide Queue and Play-list

Manager.description: Thank you for your fantastic program. I use FindCast (iTunes search) to search for podcasts. Unfortunately, I cannot integrate it with Antennapod: When I click 'Open RSS' Antennapod is no option. Could you register Antennapod as RSS reader?
Manager.title: Register as RSS reader

Manager.description: It's still possible to mark an episode as read in the long press menu, but I couldn't find a way to mark a read episode as unread. Is it still possible but moved somewhere else or has the function been removed?
Manager.title: "Mark as unread" vanished from long-press menu

Manager.description: HI, I find there is one feature missing, that would make AntennaPod perfect and I believe it would be very easy to implement. An option to either globally or on a per feed level to set: to keep only the last X episodes (e.g. keep only last 3 episodes and auto-delete older ones) to delete episodes older than X days (e.g. clean out old ones after 7 days, 30 days, etc) to keep all episodes (as it does now) BeyondPod has this feature implemented, so have all PC-based podcatchers I have ever used (e.g. gpodder). With that implemented, one could run AntennaPod in fire-and-forget mode, without having to take care of deleting old content manually.
Manager.title: Cleanup/Auto-Delete missing

Manager.description: I have this selected in Settings but it does not ever automatically download anything. Also when adding a podcast to the list, it should mark the last podcast as "new" and download it, so it will start with something in the list.
Manager.title: Automatic Download option does not work.

Manager.description: I have written a small example podcast search that could be added onto the AntennaPod app if you would like. It easily allows users to search by topic and return a basic list of podcasts and url to add to their list, this is much easier than trying to get them from the web and type in a URL, and would be a great boon to new users especially, and the less tech savy. James
Manager.title: Podcast Search Engine

Manager.description: This issue is related to #135. A small reordering of the Network settings could make them clearer and avoid unwanted 3G usage. I think the Network settings should be as follows: AUTOMATIC UPDATE Both on WiFi and 3G. Only on WiFi. Never update automatically (selected by default). UPDATE INTERVAL (greyed out if automatic update is enabled) 1 hour / 2 hours / 4 hours / 8 hours / 12 hours / 24 hours. AUTOMATIC DOWNLOADING OF ENQUEUED EPISODES Both on WiFi and 3G. Only on WiFi (selected by default). Never download enqueued episodes automatically. AUTOMATIC STREAMING OF ENQUEUED EPISODES Checkbox: stream on 3G if it's their turn to play (unchecked by default). EPISODE CACHE 10 episodes / 20 episodes / 40 episodes / 60 episodes / 80 episodes / 100 episodes. WiFi FILTER Checkbox: treat unselected networks as if they were 3G. Checkboxes: list of known networks. There are several advantages to this: Data usage can be set more easily because you can set what the app can or cannot do while on 3G (and on WiFi) in a single field, without the need for an extra checkbox (as opposed to the "mobile updates" checkbox in the current version). All related options are together, and unrelated ones are separate: the automatic update setting is next to the update interval, but far from the WiFi filter (because the latter affects several other things). Last but not least, the "Automatic streaming of enqueued episodes" checkbox allows us to have a single action instead of the highly overlapping "Download" and "Enqueue", which is covered in #135.
Manager.title: Reorder the Network settings

Manager.description: Certain users (e.g. those in issues #132 and #158) are reporting that they like to listen to shorter episodes first, or those from specific podcasts, or to newer ones. It could be useful to have an option in the queue menu to reorder the queue according to any of these criteria, either automatically or on demand.
Manager.title: Queue reordering according to specific criteria

Manager.description: It would be cool, if dropped downloads (mostly due to no connectivity) could be resumed and not downloaded completely again.
Manager.title: Resume failed downloads

Manager.description: I currently have 352 episodes in waiting list, which i must decide individually to discard or to enqueue. I usually enter full description of the episode, then decide what to do, then go back. This process could be enhanced with some ideas: Have an optional expanded waiting list view, in which each episode includes its full description. When you are on the waiting episode view, have a gesture (eg: swipe left/right) to quick switch to next/prev element in the wating list, so you don't have to go back and select the next candidate. Have "add to queue" and "mark as listened" buttons embedded instead of through a menu. Allow to perform those operations (add to queue/mark as listened) with gestures.
Manager.title: More powerful waiting list

Manager.description: Pleas make the change folder available even when SD Card is not found
Manager.title: External memory not available

Manager.description: Using the dark theme, the app will often first start or re-start with the bright theme and then, after a brief delay, switch dark. This is a bit irritating. (I don't know if this a limitation of Android or if the app is setting the theme too late.)
Manager.title: Theme will switch dark with a delay

Manager.description: AntennaPod restarts the reading from the beginning when I unlock my phone. Here is how to reproduce: With the file manager, browse to a mp3 file. Mine are around 15 to 25MB for half an hour. Tap a file, open it with AntennaPod. Lock the phone (or wait for it to automatically lock) Unlock the phone AntennaPod goes back to start of the file. I use AntennaPod 0.9.7.3 on Android 4.1.2, but it was the same with 0.9.7.2.
Manager.title: Bug: file reading restarts when unlocking

Manager.description: I recently migrated from PodKicker to AntennaPod and imported via OPML my subscriptions. Sadly all episodes were marked as old. I have audio books from librivox.org which haven't listened to yet, or listened only to a few chapters, so marking them as new is really difficult. I think, as proposed in another issue, marking as new and queuing should be directly accessible, instead of through a menu. Also a select all/deselect all would be useful, coupled with 'mark selected as new' or 'queue selected'.
Manager.title: Easy selection + batch processing in podcast's episode list

Manager.description: Hi, I'm using a Galaxy Nexus with Android 4.2.2, and the lockscreen widget has this strange behaviour. When I pause with the screen locked, the widget becomes large and starts to flicker. The two attached images show the problem: If the widget is already large, it flicks anyway. When I try to slide left or right to see another widget or camera, the camera preview and the other widget start to flickr also. I don't know exactly if this problem is in your code, but the Google Play Music doesn't change at all on any interaction.
Manager.title: Lockscreen widget flickering

Manager.description: I would expect episodes on the waiting list to be shown chronologically, most recent first. But what I find is a dozen "science friday" episodes are always at the top of the list. That is, all the science friday episodes appear before anything else, even when any else is more recent. I would include the science friday podcast url in this issue, as I imagine that makes it easier to reproduce. however in antennapod I can't locate that information. When I go to Podcasts >> Science Friday >> Show information, the info shown does not include the URL.
Manager.title: waiting list order, not chronological

Manager.description: When I subscribe to more than one of the feeds on some sites, each one overwrites the other. Here is an example of two feeds that overwrite each other: http://www.wmmt.org/archives/category/whats-cookin-now/feed/atom http://www.wmmt.org/archives/category/coal-report/feed/atom I'm happy to submit a patch, but I had trouble finding the correct source file. If you point me to the correct source file I can work on the code. Thanks! -Ross
Manager.title: Subscribe to more than one feed on some sites fails

Manager.description: The title says everything. This request is because I use English language in my system cause Portuguese translation of cyanogenmod is bad. But as I am the Portuguese translator of this app I would like to use it.
Manager.title: Allow setting app language differente than the one used by system

Manager.description: In transifex, the English source file doesn´t have the string "Hours" existing in Preferences -> Update Interval. Please add them to translation. Regards
Manager.title: Inexistent strings in transifex source language

Manager.description: To reproduce: Add a podcast to the queue. Select the play button on top Listen carefully and you can hear it starts twice. The first time it starts it gets cut off after a millisecond. This only seems to happen for items in the queue, and only the first time it's selected. However, if you remove it from the queue, and readd it, the same thing happens.
Manager.title: Podcast in queue starts twice.

Manager.description: If i download an episode that is 1:00:00 long and the connection drops when having downloaded 00:16:00, the length of the episode shows up as 00:16:00 in the download logs, and as 1:00:00 everywhere else, the player stops the episode when skipping beyond 00:16:00
Manager.title: Downloads logged as successful even thoughthey were not

Manager.description: Moving a podcast up the queue either does nothing or moves a completely different podcast from elsewhere in the queue up. Possibly something to do with large (79) number of items in queue.
Manager.title: Moving podcast in organise queue moves different podcast

Manager.description: I had several hundred podcasts (downloaded files) on my 32Gb SD card. When I upgraded from v0.9.7 to v0.9.7.3, most of those files disappeared. Some of those I cannot re-download, because they come from feeds that make files available for only a short period of time (some BBC feeds, NHK, etc.). From what I could read in other issues, it seems that this might not be a bug but a feature. Can you confirm this? Is there a way to preserve files forever and only delete manually? In any case, it would have been nice if the user had been informed of such a behavior change, one that erases user files... I have been greatly pleased using AntennaPod, it has been very comfortable to use and works (almost) flawlessly, so it came as a shock when my files disappeared. :-(
Manager.title: AntennaPod deleted most of my podcasts (files)

Manager.description: Maybe in this case the big message should have been Download failed instead of Downloads completed:
Manager.title: Misleading notification message 'Downloads completed'

Manager.description: When operating a phone with a single hand, the organise queue operation can lead to accidental dragging of episodes sideways, which means eliminating the episode from the queue. Since there is no working confirmation of the changes (the check button is even eliminated in the test version @danieloeh sent me - 0.9.7.3+), there is no easy way to undo the operation.
Manager.title: Organising the queue can lead to episode loss

Manager.description: The Atom specification permits multiple files - one possible use for this is to do away with separate feeds for each podcast media format and include all available formats in a single feed. In this case, AntennaPod appears to simply download whatever format (that is recognized) is last in the list. I created a test "feed" (valid single-entry atom xml file) with the media enclosures in the same format order I use for HTML5 audio tags (i.e. preferred first). When the legacy mp3 format is last in the list, AntennaPod downloads the mp3 (skipping over the Ogg Vorbis version and the two other formats that it presumably doesn't recognize [opus and speex]). If I move the Ogg Vorbis version to the end of the list, the .ogg file is downloaded instead. Short term: I would have expected it to instead default to the FIRST one (on the assumption that the "preferred" formats would be put first in the feed by the feed author, the same way users of the HTML5 tag do). Long term (feature request): some sort of selection interface allowing download of any or all enclosures in at Atom entry (in addition to different formats of the same podcast media, multiple enclosures might also include "supporting media" such as diagram images, "show notes" text or pdf files, audio in different spoken languages, etc.) The static single-entry Atom "feed" that I'm using for testing currently may be found here: http://blinky.dogphilosophy.net/atomtest.xml
Manager.title: Atom feeds with multiple enclosures: wrong(?). file downloaded

Manager.description: When in the downloads screen or the player screen the back button in the upper left corner will always go to the Podcasts tab, which is really annoying and useless since I use that screen very seldom. Also this makes the button misleading since it suggests is a back button, but it isn't. A smarter thing would be to remember which was the tab from which that screen was opened and go to that tab. No long undo history is necessary, the last seen tab would be enough.
Manager.title: Return to the last seen screen/activity when going back from player or downloads

Manager.description: Hey, my Wifi is quite unstable, so when I download a file sometimes the downloaded .mp3 seems to be corrupt. But it doesn't get deleted and it plays without problems, but the Podcasts just stops playing after some time and is marked as read then. I checked the file sized and its acutally smaller than it should be. So I want to suggest the feature to let the downloadmanager check the filesizes of the downloaded mp3 and redownload it if the size differs from the expected one.
Manager.title: Check downloaded files

Manager.description: fix included in pull request #192
Manager.title: fix crash on null reference in FeedManager

Here is the RSS feed: http://www.startalkradio.net/feed/shows/ The image file http://www.startalkradio.net/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/Aki_Hoshide_takesself-portrait_outside_ISS_964x640.jpg is the image that is too wide for the screen on my Nexus 4. Here is a screenshot of this image displayed on my Nexus 4 running version 0.9.7.3 of AntennaPods:

Manager.description: It would be great to let AntennaPOD display PDF files. Either internally or externally... I already parsed the source code and it seems easy to introduce a new media type, but I'm actually unable to introduce some external viewer to the app. I am an experienced iOS dev. but very new to Android dev. Could someone help me find the trick ? Or if it is easy to implement it ? Much better, why not let the user decide what app to launch on unknown media type ?
Manager.title: Feature request : permits to view PDF files

Manager.description: Running Cyanogenmod 7.2 on my Motorola Defy, Android 2.3.7. When opening the Miro guide to add some podcasts I get an otherwise white screen with only th etext "No peer certificate". Is there anything I can do about this?
Manager.title: "No peer certificate" when opening Miro guide.

Manager.description: From time to time download status message stays with "0 downloads left". There is no way to remove that message except trying to download something again (and not always working). I'm not sure how to reproduce it, but i have it at least once a week.
Manager.title: Persistent message of 0 downloads left

Manager.description: Noticed this on listening to an episode from the Logbuch:Netzpolitik Ogg Vorbis feed (http://logbuch-netzpolitik.de/feed/oga) One would expect the famous "Guten Morgen, Linus!". But instead the first 10 seconds of an episode are not played if the file is downloaded. Playback starts at 00:00:10. You can not skip to 00:00:00. Neither via the skip back button, nor via the slider bar or chapter marks. When the file is streamed, playback starts at the beginning and skipping is possible. This does not happen with M4A or MP3 files. I also checked with one other Ogg Vorbis podcast, although produced with the same toolchain. It is reproducible. http://www.staatsbuergerkunde-podcast.de/feed/ogg-rss/
Manager.title: Does not play first 10 seconds of downloaded Ogg Vorbis episodes

Manager.description: I have a lot of subscriptions and might easily have more than 100 waiting episodes at a time. Please add an options to allow unlimited downloaded episodes at a time.
Manager.title: Please remove nr. of episodes restriction

Manager.description: I keep a large number of podcasts downloaded and the arbitrary limit to 100 is too low.
Manager.title: Allow unlimited number of downloaded episodes

Manager.description: Some feeds I want to auto-download them, some other I just want to sometimes manually download one episode from time to time
Manager.title: Allow for selective, per-feed auto-download

Manager.description: Samsung Galaxy S 2 i9100 CyanogenMod 9.1.0 Whenever I press the pause button in the lockscreen widget, the whole thing disappears so I have to unlock the phone and start playback in the app again.
Manager.title: Lockscreen widget disappears after pressing pause

Manager.description: as seen in the screenshot the resuming of a podcast is done on the main thread. this also causes the app to crash if you send the app to background.
Manager.title: ANR on resuming

Manager.description: I tried to play a .m4a file from the file manager using antennapod as the audio player, which did not work. It turned out that the .m4a file was corrupt, the download stopped at 95%. Now antennapod always crashes right after starting the program. I removed the corrupt file, I also put the valid file at the same location as the corrupt file, still no chance. Deleting antennapod and all data helps, but I lose all my subscriptions and progress info. When I restore from a backup (done right before deleting antennapod to fix the problem) I see in the background that all subscriptions are there, but then the program crashes :-( I sent a bug report using the built-in crash handler, maybe you have received it? Regards, and thanks for this beautiful app! Thomas
Manager.title: Antennapod always crashes at startup after playing corrupt m4a file once

Manager.description: The lockscreen control is completely black and only the controls and the title is displayed.
Manager.title: Episode Image not shown on lockscreen control

Manager.description: Only a minor quibble, but if you're in the episodes tab in the main activity and go to the settings page, then press back, you're taken back to the podcast tab. The same thing happens with the downloads and playback history too. Would it be possible to go back to whichever tab you were in previously?
Manager.title: Settings, playback history and downloads all go back to Podcasts view when back is pressed

Manager.description: Play an episode Skip almost to the end, when there's a few seconds left. Continuously press the forward button. If tapped 3-4 times AntennaPod crashes. Alternatively. Play an episode Skip almost to the end, when there's a few seconds left. When the time index circle has reached the end of the episode, pull it back and it will occasionally crash.
Manager.title: Moving the time index circle or pressing skip forward at the end of an episode crashes AntennaPod.

Manager.description: The organize queue fetarure in 0.9.7.4 is broken. If one tryes to Organize queue the app returns FC I´m using CyanogenMod 7.1
Manager.title: Organize queue makes FC in 0.9.7.4

Manager.description: I think it would be great, if the sleep-timer wouldn't just stop playing, it should fade out. And it happens, that the sleep-timer stops the podcast but I'm not sleeping yet. Therefor there should be something like the Snooze-function from alarm-clocks just inverted. I'm thinking of this: The sleep-timer starts fading out and I'm pressing a button (the hardware volume buttons would be predestined) and the volume is faded in to the former level and the sleep timer is set for 15 minutes (e.g.).
Manager.title: Feature request: Enhanced Sleep-Timer

Manager.description: I want to request a feature, to have a configuration-box to decide if I want to automatically resume my podcast when pulling my plug back in. I often hear podcasts when Im walking through the city but sometimes get interrupted. Then I just take the plug out so the episode gets stopped automatically. But after the interruption it doesn't resume when I plug it back in.
Manager.title: Feature Request: Autoresume on plug-in
