Manager.title: Force close loop with a cursor message

Manager.description: I just updated to 0.9.7.4 for my BB Z10 and now when ever I try to reorder pod cast episodes AntennaPod crashes. Also updating pod casts also crashes some of the time.
Manager.title: Invoking Episodes | Organize Que causes crash on BB10

Manager.description: Here is a way to crash AntennaPod 100% of the time: From the file manager, open an mp3 file with AntennaPod, start reading. Quit AP (completely, either by killing the process or by rebooting the device). Move the file Try to start AP: it will crashes 100% of the time. One workaround is to put back the file, but it may not be possible in some cases. Example: someone gives you a SD card, you listen to some music or podcast. Then you turn off the phone to give back the SD card, when you start AP again you have no way to prevent it from crashing. Tested on my smartphone with Android 4.1.2.
Manager.title: Crash if file is moved

Manager.description: I've got a bunch of downloaded audio files on my phone's SD card: podcast episodes that are not available in their feeds anymore. It would be great to be able to create a "feed" by pointing AntennaPod to that specific folder on the SD card. (Sorry if this is a duplicate, can't seem to find the search function anymore on GitHub, likely fallout from when the GH issues search was "leaking" passwords?)
Manager.title: Feature Request: Add local SD card folder

Manager.description: I have used Google Listen from when I got my Android phone to when the Google Reader service was discontinued. I tried BeyondPod and AntennaPod before the service ended and decided to stick with AntennaPod. They are both good, but one is free and open source :) The only feature I really miss now that I am using AntennaPod is that Google Listen would pause and resume playback during voice navigation. I think this would be a great convenience feature to add. I am willing to make a donation.
Manager.title: Feature request: pause and resume playback during voice navigation

Manager.description: Yesterday evening AntennaPod crashed during a manual feed update and when I went back in everything was gone! "You haven't subscribed to any feeds yet". Opening a file manager, I see that Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/ still looks good (so I made a copy of it!). The files/media/ directories still contain podcasts that I have downloaded, and the files/cache/ directories still contain all the feed-* files. Is there a way in which I can get AntennaPod to recreate the settings, etc, or should I just go ahead and add everything back in manually? Where are the settings files stored that tell AntennaPod what I'm subscribed to, etc? I have Update interval set to Manual, and I manually update feeds several times a day. Every couple of days or so, the app crashes during an update, usually if I try to do other operations within the app at the same time. I just go back in and retry and all is fine. Thanks! -Ross
Manager.title: Crash + wiped all settings/etc.

Manager.description: Thee playback should be paused while an alarm is running...
Manager.title: Pause playback

Manager.description: I noticed that automatic feed refreshes for the ~ 50 feeds I subscribed to can take up to around 20 minutes when the device is asleep, in contrast to less than a minute when the device is awake. This is happening because AntennaPod fails to hold a WakeLock while it is refreshing feeds or downloading media files. As a consequence, after the FeedUpdateReceiver's onReceive() method returns, the device will go back to sleep, although the actual downloads are still pending.
Manager.title: Automatic feed updates are slow when device is asleep

Manager.description: It seems that new podcast episodes which get enqueued in the waiting list are added on top of the list, where the next downloaded episodes are taken from. Is that correct?
Manager.title: Enqueue of new episodes in waiting list

Manager.description: Support for paged-feeds (RFC 5005) would help a lot ! please see http://podlove.org/paged-feeds/ The podcast http://cre.fm/feed/m4a/ uses it for example. Currently I can only see the first page, the last 30 episodes. I don´t find any other android app that supports it.
Manager.title: Support for paged-feeds

Manager.description: IMHO, there is a high probability that people want to use the same sleep timer settings. Currently, it has to be set anew each time. Please make AntennaPod remember the set sleep time. Thanks and greetings!
Manager.title: FR: remember sleep timer setting

Manager.description: AntennaPod downloads episodes even if not enough space is on the device. So it downloads a episode of 100MB and then says "oh sorry not enought space left on device". That's not funny if you only have some 100MB or 1GB of full speed mobile internet and then the bandwith drops to unusable for AntennaPods download mechanism. Why doesn't AP checks if enough space is left before downloading a whole episode? I know there are some cases where you don't know how big the file will be, but in most cases it not a problem.
Manager.title: AP downloads episodes even if not enough space is on the device.

Manager.description: I can use the Kinivo BTC450 to pause, but when I then try to use it to continue playing, nothing happens. I have small patch to fix this issue. Pull request to follow shortly.
Manager.title: Cannot use Kinivo BTC450 bluetooth car kit to play after pause

Manager.description: After deleting a feed, I updated manually the feeds. During the update stage the deleted feed was recreated. I am using the variable speed test version.
Manager.title: Deleted feed is recreated after update

Manager.description: AntennaPod "forgets" the already downloaded files within a very short time no matter if the episodes are downloaded manually or by the automatic download function (which is working for me btw). What happens: Download progress is looking good. After successful downloading there is an indication (arrow down) the files are stored locally and I can play them offline. Fine. But after closing and restarting the app most of the time (not always) the little indication is gone and AntennaPod is offering the download option again. That's wrong. It's more annoying if one is using the automatic download function. The podcast episodes are downloaded over and over again until the sd-card is full(?). After 60 minutes I had a lot of files like xxxxx-1.mp3 xxxxxx-2.mp3 xxxxxx-3.mp3 and so on... What am I using: AntennaPod 0.9.7.4 (from F-Droid repo) Android 4.2.2 Cyanogenmod 10.1.2 Path to podcasts: /storage/sdcard0/Podcasts/... Best regards, AlfredSK
Manager.title: AntennaPod forgets about already downloaded podcast episodes

Manager.description: When trying to add podcast feed from url. Invokes error-popup: "An error has occurred: Connection error" Solved by removing the "feed://" prefix, and only use the "feeds.feedburner.com/podcastname" part. This could be solved by automatically removing the protocol prefix on error and retrying.
Manager.title: Connection error when url starts with "feed://"

Manager.description: Hi It would be nice to support paged feeds.
Manager.title: Support paged feeds.

Manager.description: I went to export to OPML in order to migrate from the fdroid version to the Play version and didn't pay attention to where it saved the file. When I went to reinstall, the file was gone, as it was cleared with the app uninstall. It would be wonderful if it could be stored in a public place so fat fingers can't so easily wipe the backup. Maybe just on the root of the SD card or in the Downloads folder.
Manager.title: Export to OPML in a public directory

Manager.description: Currently, when no podcast is playing, the widget shows a generic "No media playing" message. Clicking it, brings up the empty "player page". If one wants to select a new episode to play, one has to click the app logo to get back to the podcast list and once more on "EPISODES". Please make it possible to skip this procedure by making the widget load the episode list directly, when none is playing.
Manager.title: FR: click on widget should load episode list if no media is playing

Manager.description: Whenever I ask AntennaPod to download an episode, it force closes. The crashes used to only happen when downloading everything in my queue, but now it crashes even when I request an individual episode to be downloaded. If I increase the number of episodes allowed in my cache, I can then download specific episodes for a few days and then it starts force closing again. I suspect this is caused by two inter-related issues. When the episode cache is full, it force closes instead of cancelling the download and providing some intelligent message to the user It appears not clean up download episodes after listening to them. I recently cleared dozens of old episodes out of my media folder that were not deleted when I completed listening to them. I suspect that some counter was not cleared when I deleted the files, so the application still thinks I'm at my limit of cached episodes. AntennaPod 0.9.7.4 Nexus 4, Build JWR66V
Manager.title: Force close when downloading an episode

Manager.description: Feed Items which contain an Iframe are open in an external browser. They should probably be opened inline. The thing is that shouldOverrideUrlLoading() is called for iframes while loading the page, and not only when user clicks on a link. I am not sure about the workaround, but i think we should use a condition in handling of shouldOverrideUrlLoading(): While page is loading assume url is an iframe and load internally (return false). After page finished loading use current behaviour, load externally (do the intent and return true).
Manager.title: Iframes are open separately

Manager.description: I just added this feed: http://freakshow.fm/feed/opus/ it downloads fine, but trying to play crashes antennapod on my Galaxy Nexus. I guess a warning dialog/check for supported formats would be a good idea.
Manager.title: Opus leads to silent failure

Manager.description: Each time AntennaPod is trying to download an episode containing a colon ":" in the filename it will fail end result in the following Error: IO Error: /storage/extSdCard/AntennaPod/media/DRadio Wissen - Medien/dradiowissen_ct-gespraech:_20130830_f0c443f5.mp3: open failed: EINVAL (Invalid argument) As AntennaPod is going to try it again and again... this will result in a long list of errors in the Download Log.
Manager.title: Download Error on Files with a Colon (":")

Manager.description: A cool feature would be the ability to mark episodes as played in the podcast's list of episodes. You could turn the title text grey to signify that the episode has been listened to. I follow a lot of podcasts and it would be nice to see which I've finished listening to and which ones I haven't. I know that this functionality is sort of provided by having a queue, but just a suggestion. I used to use a Zune for podcasts and really liked how it managed them.
Manager.title: Feature Request: Read/Unread marker

Manager.description: Hello, Since yesterday, I can not sort episodes anymore. It used to work fine. Now, when trying to move an episode up or down: after following my finger, when I drop it where I wan it, the complete list flickers, then it goes back to its initial position. I am using AntennaPod 0.9.7.4 on Android 4.1.2 since a few months. What can I do, except uninstall / reinstall (and lose all my history) ? Could it be a missing right on a file somewhere, lost for an unknown reason? Thanks for your help.
Manager.title: Sort mecanism broken

Manager.description:
I'm trying to build AntennaPod to fix an issue, since it's such a great project and I want to contribute back. I'm having an issue compiling; I'm on Debian, and installed gradle by unzipping the gradle ZIP distribution from its website. I unzipped it into ~/gradle-1.7/ and got this error: androider@pathi:~/AntennaPod$ ~/gradle-1.7/bin/gradle assembleDebug
FAILURE: Could not determine which tasks to execute.
* What went wrong: Task 'assembleDebug' not found in root project 'antennapod'.
* Try: Run gradle tasks to get a list of available tasks.
BUILD FAILED
Total time: 3.84 secs I'm hoping to do the compile with gradle rather than eclipse, and it seems to me that this should work according to https://github.com/danieloeh/AntennaPod/wiki/Building-AntennaPod#building-on-the-command-line-with-gradle . If the issue is a documentation error, and you can describe what I need to do here, I am willing to fix the docs too if I can reproduce that the solution works for me, too. Let me know. Thanks!
Manager.title: gradle doesn't seem to believe there is an assembleDebug

Manager.description: When I install the Prestissimo package playing breaks. When I try to play it will do nothing. All I get in logcat is this: 09-11 19:28:24.052 D/AocateServiceBackedMediaPlayer( 7096): getDuration() 311 09-11 19:28:24.068 D/AocateServiceBackedMediaPlayer( 7096): getDuration() 311 09-11 19:28:25.021 D/AocateServiceBackedMediaPlayer( 7096): getDuration() 311 09-11 19:28:25.060 D/AocateServiceBackedMediaPlayer( 7096): getDuration() 311
Manager.title: Variable speed not working in 0.9.7.5

Manager.description: Is there a reason why the "Play" button was removed from the podcast description activity? Now there's an extra step where I have to go to the overflow menu to reach the play option, and the action bar is left essentially empty.
Manager.title: "Play" button removed from the podcast description activity (v0.9.7.5)

Manager.description: In the episode preview, there used to be a playback button (as seen in this old screenshot here: http://blog.znn.info/antennapod/20121116_224017/). Instead, there is now a playback item in the context menu as shown in the attached screenshot. Can we please have the button back?
Manager.title: Playback button disappeared from action bar

Manager.description: Running Google TV 3.2 Logitech Revue, app crashes when settings menu is selected. AntennaPod 0.9.7.5
Manager.title: Bug: Google TV AntennaPod crashes when settings is selected

Manager.description: In Google TV 3.2 Logitech Revue on a 1080p TV, using AntennaPod 16:9 video has a significant black border on the bottom, left and right edges. The previous version properly scaled the video to full screen without any borders. I don't know if its not scaling the 16:9 720p source video is not scaling enough. I think it might be scaling it but just not to maximum resolution of the display. AntennaPod 0.9.7.5
Manager.title: Google TV AntennaPod issue - Video no longer plays in full screen

Manager.description: In Google TV 3.2 Logitech Revue, pressing the pause button on the device's remote does not pause the video. When the pause button is pressed on the device's remote, the video appears to re-buffer and then continues to play. (Pressing skip forward and skip back buttons on the remote do work properly however :D ) Pressing pause via the app's UI with a mouse press does properly pause the video's playback. AntennaPod 0.9.7.5
Manager.title: Google TV AnntenaPod issue - Pause key on the Google TV remote does not pause playback

Manager.description: Hey, On my device (Asus PadFone 2, Android 4.1) the menu button has disappeared (like the play button in issue #273) from the podcast description activity so simply I can not play anything :-( It happened after I upgraded to the last version (v0.9.7.5) Thanks, Yoni
Manager.title: Menu disappeared from action bar
Missing i18n for ProgressDialog of "Remove Feed" action

Manager.description: i would love to see a ability to stream a episode to a extern player. like bubbleupnp or the yatse xbmc remote. its something i use alot to play podcasts on my xmbc machine. i dont know how difficult this is... but it would be a nice feature.
Manager.title: Streaming to extern player

Manager.description: Recently icons stopped loading, both in podcast and episodes tab. I get this in logcat: 09-17 10:02:31.398 W/BitmapDecodeWorkerTask( 7056): Could not load bitmap. Using default image. 09-17 10:02:31.452 W/BitmapDecodeWorkerTask( 7056): Could not load bitmap. Using default image. 09-17 10:02:31.476 W/BitmapDecodeWorkerTask( 7056): Could not load bitmap. Using default image. Not sure since when this is happening.
Manager.title: Most bitmaps/icons not showing

Manager.description: v0.9.7.5 In the podcast list screen, when there is a podcast with no episodes, it is displayed as "Most Recent Episode" of the next podcast in the list. The subsequent "Most Recent Episode" timestamps are are also incorrect, each being shuffled up i.e. podcast number 3 has the timestamp from podcast 4, podcast 4 has the timestamp from podcast 5 and so on. Device: Samsung Galaxy Ace 2 GT-I18160 Android 4.1.2
Manager.title: Most Recent Episode incorrect following podcast with no episodes

Manager.description: Setting the number in "Episode cache" does not update until Setting menu gets closed and opened again. In 0.9.7.4 it worked as expected. Similar behaviour can be observed also within "Automatic download": Setting the tick at "Automatic download" does not enable "Enable Wi-Fi filter". To get "Enable Wi-Fi filter accessible you need to exit from the "Settings" menu completely and choose "Settings/Automatic download" again.
Manager.title: Regression in 0.9.7.5: "Settings" menu does not update itself for changes in submenus.

Manager.description: I am subscribed to 2 high-frequency podcasts (daily 07:00 and 19:00 radio news), which I only infrequently listen to: maybe once a week I'll manually download the latest episode. But those 2 feeds show up with 2 new episodes per day in the list of recent episodes, which to me only represent noise. I would appreciate a way to "hide" the episodes from these feeds in the list of new episodes. This would be a per-feed option, "do not show new episodes in list". With such a feature, i could go to the Feed and download the latest episode, only when I want to listen to an episode. The rest of the time, those episodes don't fill up the newest episodes, and that list has more meaningful items in it ;)
Manager.title: Feature Request: Per-feed option to not add episodes to new list

Manager.description: I've got a very memory-challenged phone, and am always trying to skim a few MB on the internal memory to be able to install new apps, but unfortunately AntennaPod can't be moved to the SD card. I believe this is done adding android:installLocation to the manifest file. I'd suggest using "preferExternal", although "auto" (install by default on internal memory, on external if internal is already full)
Manager.title: Feature Request: allow installing/moving application to SD card

Manager.description: When the headphone are disconnected, AP stops playing. That's fine. However, as one has to unlock the phone to do anything with it, then AP restarts playing. This is a recent behavior, and should not happen, at least for this use case: using the headphone removal to stop playing, then moving on to something else. If it is not a bug but a recent feature, could it be optionnal? Thanks.
Manager.title: Bug: reading autostart on unlocking

Manager.description: I understand the rationale for not offering the ability to mark episodes as unread (although I don't agree with it...). But I don't think this rationale applies when you've added a new feed - in some cases, you'd probably need to start from episode 1 but you wouldn't necessarily want top add 200+ episodes to the queue. For example, many educational podcasts will need to be listened to in order, as later episodes will use concepts introduced earlier ones. In my case, I have a beginners Spanish podcast that I've started listening to with a few hundred episodes already recorded and tracking where I'm up to is already a bit of a pain. With this in mind, could we have an option when adding the feed to mark the entire feed unread?
Manager.title: Feature request: optionally mark episodes as unread when adding a new feed

Manager.description: The latest version does not show a play button for all my mp3 files and I can not play any. Downgrading to 0.9.7.4 also does not work since then the app force closes right after each start. This is an F-Droid build. F-Droid is building releases according to https://github.com/danieloeh/AntennaPod/wiki/Building-AntennaPod
Manager.title: Version 0.9.7.5 does not show play button, does not play (F-Droid build)

Manager.description: OPML import it´s not possible in this release. How to reproduce: Import OPML Feed list is loaded Select feeds to import Import Observed: Feeds not imported Expected: Feeds imported It works in 0.9.7.4. I´m using cyanogenmod 7.
Manager.title: OPML import not working in 0.9.7.5

Manager.description: Since v0.7.5 (Google Play store build), I have the impression that episode details aren't viewable anymore, if downloads are running in parallel. The display stays blank for many seconds often, and sometimes the app also crashes (although that might be related to me running CM 10.2 nightlies). When no downloads are running, the episode details are displayes as quickly as expected. It would be great if downloading episode details could be prioritised over other downloads. Thanks and greetings!
Manager.title: prioritise episode details

Manager.description: If I play pause button on my headphones when just connected to a wifi network it will actually pause or play several seconds to minutes later. This only happens when just connected to a wifi network. If I have been connected for a while it will work normally. I can easily reproduce the problem by start playing, disabling and enabling wifi and let it connect, then pause on headphones. Tested on 0.9.7.5 as well as develop versions. Android 4.2.2 (CM10.1 Unofficial). Samsung GT-i9003
Manager.title: Pause button delays for minutes

Manager.description: I suggest making bottom bar in different color Reason: to make it different from episodes list
Manager.title: Feature request: bottom play bar different color

Manager.description: It would be a great addition to be able to continually play through the queue list. Thanks for the great work.
Manager.title: feature request: play whole queue

Manager.description: The present version on the play store (0.9.7.5 from the About screen) has frequent crashes on my Nexus-4 running stock 4.3 It seems to occur more often when switching screens while a download is occurring. Here is a stacktrace from logcat - unfortunately, it's proguarded, but I hope it's enough to isolate the issue. W/dalvikvm(30864): threadid=1: thread exiting with uncaught exception (group=0x41c21700) E/AndroidRuntime(30864): FATAL EXCEPTION: main E/AndroidRuntime(30864): java.lang.IllegalStateException: Content view not yet created E/AndroidRuntime(30864): at android.support.v4.app.ListFragment.ensureList(SourceFile:328) E/AndroidRuntime(30864): at android.support.v4.app.ListFragment.getListView(SourceFile:222) E/AndroidRuntime(30864): at eV.b(SourceFile:42) E/AndroidRuntime(30864): at eX.onPostExecute(SourceFile:143) E/AndroidRuntime(30864): at android.os.AsyncTask.finish(AsyncTask.java:631) E/AndroidRuntime(30864): at android.os.AsyncTask.access$600(AsyncTask.java:177) E/AndroidRuntime(30864): at android.os.AsyncTask$InternalHandler.handleMessage(AsyncTask.java:644) E/AndroidRuntime(30864): at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) E/AndroidRuntime(30864): at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) E/AndroidRuntime(30864): at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5103) E/AndroidRuntime(30864): at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) E/AndroidRuntime(30864): at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:525) E/AndroidRuntime(30864): at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:737) E/AndroidRuntime(30864): at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:553) E/AndroidRuntime(30864): at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method) W/ActivityManager( 1182): Force finishing activity de.danoeh.antennapod/.activity.MainActivity
Manager.title: Version 0.9.7.5 frequent crashes

Manager.description: I noticed this problem first with v0.9.7.5 with Freakshow's AAC feed: http://freakshow.fm/feed/m4a/ and now again with http://www.raumschiff-rumdenker.de/feed/mpeg-4/. Episodes are played at maybe 10% of the normal speed. Increasing the playback speed changed something, but even 3x wasn't fast enough to make any speech understandable. Strangely, the time display looked normal, only the audio was too slow.
Manager.title: v0.9.8 plays M4As too slow

Manager.description: I would love to see support for Podlove's chapter makrs. Additional information can be found on the project website: http://podlove.org/specifications/ What do you think? Bye F4l0
Manager.title: Feature Request: Support for Podlove Chapter Marks

Manager.description: Downloading of audio file failed if audio URL contains spaces. Streaming is fine.
Manager.title: Failed Download

Manager.description: How can we pre populate or add default podcast stream urls to application?
Manager.title: Adding default stream URL to application

Manager.description: Hi! Can you add an option to select the behaviour after an episode has ended? I thought about autodelete.
Manager.title: Behaviour after episode end

Manager.description: AP should be able to import already downloaded episodes. Some feeds offer only the last episodes. But most times you can manually download episodes from archives
Manager.title: Importing episodes

Manager.description: It would be useful if tapping an episode's icon in the episode view would cause that episode to immediately start playing. I know that you can click the play icon from the top of the episode details screen but being able to do this from the episode list would be quicker and safer (for example when in a car).
Manager.title: Feature Request: Tapping icon should play episode

Manager.description: gpodder.net service login screen can show white text on white backgrounds while the app is set to use the "Dark" theme. This is most evident when the user inputs text in the login fields. This issue is not seen while the theme is set to "Light." Device: Samsung Galaxy SII (i9100) gpodder ver. 0.9.8.0
Manager.title: Unreadable (White on White) text in gpodder.net Login menu.

Manager.description: When I play videos from this podcast, the aspect ratio is wrong: http://mediacenter.dw.de/english/podcasts/ Compare it to playback via the build in video player or VLC for Android.
Manager.title: Video aspect ratio wrong

Manager.description: When you have the dark theme selected and login to gpodder.net the popup will be in the light theme. It is a bit annoying because it is very bright, and the text is white on white, because text is white in the dark theme.
Manager.title: gpodder.net login light themed popup even with dark theme

Manager.description: We have a website with around 100 Media RSS Feeds, would it be possible to use your to preload these RSS Feeds? i.e. we create an instance of your App and add these feeds as defaults? I am new to app development not a programmer full-time so any pointers would be highly appreciated.
Manager.title: Not an Issue just a Question

Manager.description: When the automatic download updates the feeds and a new episode is found, that episode is not downloaded immediately. Instead AntennaPod will wait for your custom set update interval (2h in my case). Leaving the house with an undownloaded episode is a bit annoying, easpecially when the download would have only taken a few seconds on your wifi. I did not test if that issue appears when setting a high update interval, but if it does one would receive all new episodes only after a high delay. My personal fix is to regularly check for new podcasts and hitting the update button manully, but I would like AntennaPod to be purely push- and not pull-style.
Manager.title: Auto downloading doesn't download new podcasts immediately but waits for the next interval

Manager.description: Congrats for your job in this app, its so amazing and for me almost perfect, I don't know if its hard to do or not, but if you could add the auto delete of the podcast when we finish it will be good. Thanks!
Manager.title: Feature request - auto delete already listened podcasts

Manager.description: I don't understand autodownload. The N topmost queued podcast should always be downloaded. Instead, i'd like to choose certain feeds auto-queued whenever a new item appears.
Manager.title: AutoQueue instead of AutoDownload

Manager.description: Many times when i want to resume playback it will resume at earlier location than when i left it. Other times it will stop after a minute of playback. When I try to play again it will start from a very old time of that chapter.
Manager.title: Sudden stops and wrong resume time.

Manager.description: Following the principal of not having a user option if the author or software can choose for you, I suggest removing the "Headphones disconnect" option, and acting as if it is always ticked. In other words, make the app always pause when the headphones are removed without giving the user the choice to make the app behave otherwise. My reasoning is that almost all users will have this option ticked already, making the option redundant and just taking up space in the Settings screen. I cannot see any reason why anyone would want playback to continue when headphones are removed. If for some reason someone wanted to share a good bit of a podcast with a wider audience, they could just press the play button after they remove the headphones.
Manager.title: Remove option regarding headphone disconnect, act as if always ticked

Manager.description: It would be nice if there was a "proper" website for AntennaPod, other than the github page or Play Store page.
Manager.title: Create website for AntennaPod

Manager.description: Is there anywhere to discuss AntennaPod in general, e.g. the overall direction of development. Whether a web forum or a mailing list, it would be good to have something separate from the github issues list.
Manager.title: Discussion forum for AntennaPod

Manager.description: Needs a way to organize downloaded podcasts by holding and sliding them up or down. An auto to organize them by episode number would be nice as well. The current options of move to the top or bottom are very much limited. It would be nice to organize the un-downloaded podcasts from old to new as well in case one wants to listen to a pod channel from the beginning.
Manager.title: Organization

Manager.description: IMHO it would make more sense if the last played episode would come first. Short: reverse order
Manager.title: Last played: sort order

Manager.description: Example of rss feed: http://news.tut.by/rss/s~1185.rss. Updated weekly. Initially, items in feed are populated without media content. This is an announcement. AntennaPod shows this item with no media content attached. After one - two days there media content was added. AntennaPod shows that no media content was attached to this rss item after updating feed.
Manager.title: Media content not shown and not loaded, when added to existing rss item

Manager.description: When listening to downloaded audio podcasts with the screen off on Android 4.4.2 the playback stops before the end of the file. For example, on one of the MP3s from http://downloads.bbc.co.uk/podcasts/radio4/thpop/rss.xml it stops around 15 seconds from the end when the device is locked, but continues to the end if the screen is on. I've seen this on a Nexus 5 using version 0.9.8.0 from the Play store, and on an generic emulated device with the current master, develop and playbackservice_rewrite branches. An emulated Android 4.2.2 image doesn't have any trouble.
Manager.title: Playback finishes early on Android 4.4.2

Manager.description: Feed: http://feeds.feedburner.com/PennSundaySchool Failing URL: "http://acedl.noxsolutions.com/ace/Don't Call Salman Rushdie Sneezy in Finland.mp3", at character 39. AntennaPod version 0.9.8.0 on htc Sensation with Android 2.3.4 and Nexus 7 with Android 4.4.2. As far as I can tell apostrophe is a perfectly valid character in a http URL.
Manager.title: Download failed: Unknown Error: Illegal character in path ...

Manager.description: Antennapod doesn't have a way for other apps to subscribe a podcast. For example, feed:// and itpc:// urls don't subscribe with Antennapod, so Tunesviewer can't subscribe a podcast with Antennapod.
Manager.title: No intent to call Antennapod to subscribe a podcast.

Manager.description: Can you add the functionality to add feeds which require a login? Examples on http://www.bitsundso.de/plus-faq/: http://username:passwort@www.bitsundso.de/feed/plus/ or http://www.bitsundso.de/feed/plus/
Manager.title: Feeds which require passwords

Manager.description: Is there a way to download antennapod without google play? will it even run without google services?
Manager.title: Google play independent download

Manager.description: When I add the Feed http://podcast.hr2.de/derTag/podcast.xml it shows all files/episodes as 0 Byte. They are not automatically downloaded. I can download manually and listen to every episode. Every time the feed updates the first entry vanishes (even when downloaded) until everything is gone. Recent version (0.9.8.0) from play store on Android 4.1.1
Manager.title: Problem with derTag Podcast - 0 byte files vanish

Manager.description: Sometimes when listening to podcasts one gets distracted a bit, but not intense or long enough to pause the podcast playback, for example when sitting on a train and there's an announcement where one does not know from the beginning if it is important for oneself. In such cases I like to jump back some seconds in the playback where the jump buttons in the player come in quite handy. But it would be even nicer if those buttons were also on the lock screen widget, as this way one would not have to unlock the phone and fire up antennapod to do so.
Manager.title: Feature request: jump buttons on lock screen widget

Manager.description: Using VLC to listen to the lectures, I have found the option in the player to jump to a particular time quite handy. Could you add something similar to that on VLC for android? Thanks, Alex
Manager.title: Feature request: Jump to time

Manager.description: The order of the list of podcast feeds seems to be ordered in ASCII order, i.e. it is case-sensitive. Thus, the position of a podcast named abcdef is after that of ZYXWVU, which seems counter-intuitive to me. It would be better if the order would be case-insensitive, i.e. AABB -> abcdef -> ZYWWVU.
Manager.title: Case-insensitive ordering of podcast feed list

Manager.description: Use case: podcasts recorded by radio broadcasters are extremely quiet. Listening to these podcasts interrupted by (relatively very loud) car navigation announcements is very uncomfortable.
Manager.title: [Feature request] Option for normalisation of audio volume after download.

Manager.description: When I try to login to my gpodder.net account from the settings menu, I get an error in red text saying: "Bad response code: 404" I have added my logcat logs as a gist here: https://gist.github.com/AdamHarte/8795424 Device details: LG Nexus 5 Android 4.4.2 (with ART enabled) AntennaPod 0.9.8.0
Manager.title: "Bad response code: 404" when try to login to gpodder

Manager.description: I would like to see support for paged feeds. RFC 5005 http://podlove.org/paged-feeds/ http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5005
Manager.title: Support Paged Feeds

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: support control the speed
support control the speed ?

Manager.description: The following feed does not correctly update with AntennaPod: http://podcast.hr2.de/derTag/podcast.xml Once I add the podcast to AntennaPod everything is fine. As soon as I try to make an update, new entries are not added, intead the latest entry is removed. So if I 2 times try to make an update, the first 2 entries are removed. Seems to be a bug of Antennapod. Please fix this issue. thanks chris412
Manager.title: Feed does not correctly update

Manager.description: media seekTo() run not nice than android system media player. you can use your player and try seek to any position ,and then you can try use android system media player. some time the seekTo method will use a lot of time ,i mean sometimes it so slow restart play.
Manager.title: media seekTo() run not nice than android system media player

Manager.description: It seems to me that there is no ipv6 support implemented. I've setup my own mygpo instance on a shared ipv4. AntennaPod throws an exception regarding wrong hostname in cert cause of missing sni support. The mygpo instance is also available on a dedicated IPv6 but it seems ipv6 is completely ignored and it always falls back to the A-record (the shared ipv4 with the missing sni problem in antennapod). Would be nice if ipv6 and/or sni would be implemented.
Manager.title: IPv6 and/SNI support

Manager.description: when i play some MP3 file on my project .sometimes,when i back to the home activity ,it will no response (ANR alert).why ? so i just guess the log print ,when i back ,it will print that i didn't unbindService.but i use media.release() in activity's onDestroy(),so as i know ,the service will unbind auto .but not. so what's wrong? why ANR and why unbindService ?
Manager.title: Activity ANR?

Manager.description: A while ago my local NPR station "upgraded" their web site and the new podcast feeds don't work in AntennaPod. That is, each episode shows up, but only the episode description but no media. I tried the feed in foobar2000 and it worked, so I'm suspecting there's a corner case in their RSS. The feed I've been looking at is http://wnpr.org/podcasts/47/rss.xml but I suspect any on that site have the same issue. I am running AntennaPod 0.9.8.0 (though previous versions had the same issue) from f-droid on my Kindle Fire. Thanks for a fantastic podcast tool!
Manager.title: NPR feed doesn't work

Manager.description: Presto Client MediaPlayer seekTo has Noise. How to fix it ?
Manager.title: Presto Client MediaPlayer seekTo has Noise.

Manager.description: In the sync settings for gpodder.net, it would be nice to have the device name and other relevant settings displayed (after you have connected to it).
Manager.title: gpodder.net: display device name in sync settings

Manager.description: It seems like the regular update/refresh action does not sync the subscription list from gpodder.net. I had to update several times, before a new subscription was picked up. I think that a separate "Sync with gpodder.net" button in the gpodder.net settings would be useful, which would explicitly carry out that action. Apart from that, the regular update/refresh action could be improved to always sync with gpodder.net, too.
Manager.title: gpodder.net: add "Sync now" button / improve update/refresh action

Manager.description: Newest update (Late Feb 2014) does no play video from RSS feed on a Logitech Revue Google TV, running Android v3.2. The audio from the video can be heard for a few seconds and then stops prematurely. The playback screen is black during this time (no video can be seen). These are RSS video feeds that played normally under the previous version of the app just days earlier. I tested it with video feeds from multiple sources, each have the same issue.
Manager.title: Revue/GoogleTV AntennaPod video from RSS is broken

Manager.description: How to reproduce: 1 - In main screen touch icon for refresh all feeds. Observed: App makes fc Expected: All feeds got updated. I´m using 0.9.8.1 in android 2.3.7 (cyanogen mod)
Manager.title: Fc when updating all feeds in main screen

Manager.description: The display goes to sleep while playing videos.
Manager.title: The display goes to sleep while playing videos.

Manager.description: The Navbar is shown so not the complete screen is used while playing videos.
Manager.title: Navbar is shown while playing videos

Manager.description: Like the new video screen, but miss the skip ahead/behind buttons. Ideally the number of seconds would be configurable.
Manager.title: Skip ahead/behind missing from new video screen

Manager.description: AntennaPod crashes when all feeds are updated in the main screen. Workaround: Update each feed manually. Device: Motorola xt890 (Android 4.1.2) Exception Class Name: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException Source file: ArrayList.java Source class: java.util.ArrayList Source method: get Line Number 306
Manager.title: Chrashes when updating rss-feeds since Version 0.9.8.1

Manager.description: Recently this problem showed up. I think its related to the new 0.9.8.1 release but can't be sure. My podcast finishes playing and AntennaPod gets into a stuck state. It looks like the file is still playing. I can't get it to stop or allow me to delete the file. I can delete the app's data but that's a tad extreme. Some screenshots of what I see... http://yasmar.net/?attachment_id=187 http://yasmar.net/?attachment_id=188
Manager.title: File doesn't stop playing?!

Manager.description: AntennaPod v0.9.8.1 is failing to write to my data folder that's located on my SD card since I upgraded to KitKat, All writes appear to be affected: downloads, deleting previously downloaded files, and export OPML. The specific error is "open failed: EACCES (Permission denied).
Manager.title: Lost write access to SD card after upgrade to KitKat 4.4.2

Manager.description: After refreshing feeds the notification remains with "0 downloads left" for about 1 minute after. I think this could be optimized somehow. It could be related to having many feeds (about 50).
Manager.title: "0 downloads left" message keeps for a while after refreshing feeds

Manager.description: Could someone please reopen issue 367? danieloeh#367
Manager.title: Please reopen issue 367

Manager.description: It seems impossible to delete the last podcast of the playlist. Even if skipping this episode (effectively completely clearing the playlist), it still can't be removed from within its feed overview. The only options offered are to skip the epidosde (which doesn't make any sense) and to add it to the playlist again.
Manager.title: Make it possible to remove last podcast of playlist

Manager.description: I recently had to re-install AntennaPod and lost list of feed subscriptions. Wouldn't it be nice if AntennaPod backed up it's feed list to a remote storage using the Backup API? Is anyone working on this, or should I?
Manager.title: Backup feed list using the Android Backup API

Manager.description: Instead of removing "move to top" and"move to bottom" for first and last item, disable them. I've accidentally removed items from the queue instead of moving them to the top because the "move to bottom" entry went away and shifted the location of "move to top" on the screen.
Manager.title: in context menu, disable "move to x"

Manager.description: The AC360 podcast show 0 bytes episodes that can't be downloaded. Feed works and has full downloadable episodes in other players. Feed: http://www.cnn.com/services/podcasting?eref=ac360audio
Manager.title: The AC360 podcast shows 0 bytes episodes

Manager.description: I'm running 0.9.8.2 on a Moto X with Android 4.2.2. I have auto download set but new podcasts are only added to the Waiting List but not downloaded. Aren't they supposed to be downloaded right away? It's possible I do not fully understand how the Waiting List and auto download works, but I compare to Podkicker Pro where new shows are downloaded as soon as a refresh finds a new episode. I am running Podkicker also to compare and it is downloading the new episodes right away.
Manager.title: Not auto downloading.

Manager.description: Hi, How does the episode cache limit actually work? What will happen if you are up to the limit you've set, have auto download set and are adding a new podcast to the queue whichh should be downloaded? Will the oldest downloaded podcast be deleted or will the new episode not be downloaded until you manually delete episodes keeping you under the set limit? Also is the limit per podcast or total downloaded episodes?
Manager.title: How does the episode cache work?

Manager.description: None of the CNN podcast feeds work with AntennaPod. They get added but when checking episodes all of them show with "Size 0 B" but with correct publication time. The episodes can not be downloaded but can be streamed. These feeds work fine in other players like Podkicker and PodcastAddict. A couple of examples: AC360: http://rss.cnn.com/services/podcasting/ac360audio/rss Erin Burnett Out Front: http://rss.cnn.com/services/podcasting/eboutfront/rss I'm running 0.9.8.2 on Android 4.2.2
Manager.title: None of the CNN podcast feeds work.

Manager.description: Hi, All media players I use and have used on Android respond to standard external input for "Fast Forward, "Next", "Previous" etc. inputs. I was surprised when AntennaPod only responds to "Play/Pause" but none of the other media controls. This matters since I use the HeadsetButton Controller app and also Bluetooth headsets with more than "Play/Pause" controls and they do not work with AntennaPod. It would be very helpful if AntennaPod could respond like other players to external playback controls
Manager.title: AntennaPod doesn't respond to external "Fast Forward", "Next", "Previous" etc. input.

Manager.description: I'm working off the develop branch, fetched two hours ago. Normally I wouldn't write a bug report about the develop branch, but considering you merged it to the master branch 6 hours ago, I think it's fine. To reproduce this Have an empty queue Go the podcasts tab and play something directly from the list (so without adding anything to the queue). Finish the episode (doesn't matter how: skip, slide, listen) Repeat 2, but make sure it's the same episode 4a. Notice that you can't play the episode. 4b. Notice that the episode is now in the queue, but can't play it from there either 4c. Remove and repeat 4 will result in the same situation. How to get out of this situation (sometimes) Play a different episode Finish the episode (doesn't matter how: skip, slide, listen) The app should skip to the next episode Sometimes you can play this, sometimes you can't, but when you can and the episode finishes, things will go back to normal.
Manager.title: Playback and queue corrupts when an episode that was played outside of the queue finishes.

Manager.description: Hi, I would like an option to have new episodes downloaded directly to the Waiting List and not wait until added to the Queue or until next refresh. It could be a setting under Automatic Download: "Download directly to Waiting List". Personally I would like this to be default behavior. I do not really understand why automatic download is tied to adding to queue or the next refresh like it is now. It works but isn't as automated as I would like it to be. I would like all new episodes download as soon as they come in.
Manager.title: Automatic Download directly to the Waiting List. (Feature/enhancement)

Manager.description: So, apparently the newest version downloads episode pictures. My issue is that most of my podcast provide an image for each episode (although it's apparently always just the logo/image of the podcast itself) and with some feeds containing 100+ or even 300+ episodes, I now have an "images" folder with 100+mb of completely useless copies of a few podcast images, and that was after I quit the update by force-closing the app halfway through. One example is "Stop Podcasting Yourself".. over 300 episodes and each one has a 500kb 1400x1400px jpg file. So the images from that podcast alone would use up ~150mb on my phone. And that's just one podcast. It's the most egregious example, but it's a problem with many feeds. Judge John Hodgman for example..150x152kb. Especially for people with limited data, actually doing that first refresh with the newest version can really screw you over (luckily I was on wifi). But even then, 100-200mb for pointless episode images is a waste considering the limited storage on most phones. Additionally it seems like a download queue of 1000+ can crash the app. There needs to be a way to deal with this and imho it shouldn't be default behavior, especially not on mobile data.
Manager.title: impossible to disable downloading of episode images

Manager.description: Please add opus podcast support
Manager.title: Please add opus podcast support

Manager.description: Hi, I would like the app to open to the Episodes tab either as default, as an option or based on remembering last tab open when closing. Having it as an option in the settings would be preferred.
Manager.title: Open the app to Episodes (feature/enhancement)

Manager.description: https://github.com/danieloeh/AntennaPod/blob/master/src/de/danoeh/antennapod/dialog/TimeDialog.java#L29 Please make these time units translatable.
Manager.title: The sleep timer units are not translated

Manager.description: Using the nightly, I load an can (Basic-Auth) authenticated feed, but it does not store the authentication information and reuse it for retrieving the files. Consider the zeit.de audio podcast, which you can retrieve even without Basic Auth, but all files referenced in the RSS need Basic Auth.
Manager.title: Propagate authentication to files

Manager.description: In the latest nightly build (antennapod-develop-05b2295-nightly) some of the icons for episodes downloaded and added to queue disappears as soon as the download is complete so that there's just a blank field when the icon should have been.
Manager.title: Icon for some downloaded episodes disappears when completed (in nightly)

Manager.description: I am using AntennaPod android 0.9.8.3 with continuous playback of audio podcasts. My Android version is 4.4.2 Since several weeks now, the playback of the current playing audio podcasts stops to early and the next podcasts does not start at the beginning. In both cases approx. 5 seconds are missing at the end / in the beginning of the next one. This problems does occur with every audio podcast that I am playing. The same problem is reported by my wife. She uses the same Android and AntennePod versions. I have continuous playback enabled as I use the device during my daily commuting routine. Please help! Thomas
Manager.title: Bug: audio playback stopps to early, next audio starts not at beginning

Manager.description: When refreshing feeds and downloading podcasts I see this Icon everywhere (eg.: notification bar): At least when downloading podcast there should be an animated version of this icon.

Manager.description: Dear developers, thank you for this great app. Is it possible to implement a view which lists all downloaded files? This would enable an easy manual file management. The cache functionality isn't applicable for this case because this would delete also files which I would like to keep e.g. podcasts where a felt asleep before the end ;)

Manager.description: Awesome App! Feature Request - Ability to Remember Authorization Login PW Right now i have to authorize EVERY episode of podcast. Would be great either to be able to set authorization as a podcast setting would be a beautiful thing... TY for all the hard work!

Manager.description: The Al Jazeera audio podcast at: http://feeds.aljazeera.net/podcasts/aljazeeraworldAU can be added and updates but when I try to play an episode AntennaPod freezes totally. It's almost impossible to remove the feed again after that happens and I have had to restart the phone after having tried.
Manager.title: Al Jazeera audio podcast can't be played.

Manager.description: When streaming a podcast, continue to buffer the rest of the file. Then the entire podcast will play even if the internet connection is lost.
Manager.title: Buffer ahead while streaming

Manager.description: I really like the new UI, but more than how it looks I am concerned about how it works. I am hoping to be able to have AntennaPod work like this: All new episodes are downloaded immediately, not with the next refresh like it is today. I also want all new episodes automatically to be added the the queue. And finally I would like to either be able to set which screen it opens to (Queue or New Episodes) or that it opens to the screen you had open when you closed it. I would like new episodes added to the top of the queue by default (at least as an options also. Finally I want episodes automatically deleted when they are played although I can live with the current episode cache method of limited storage use by AntennaPod. How happy should I be with the new UI in this regard, or are the things I am talking about not part of the redesign?
Manager.title: The new UI.

Manager.description: I have discovered an issue with the new UI, there's no easy way to add all new episodes to the queue in one operation. You have to add them one by one. That was not the case in the current UI where you could add all from the waiting list to the queue. Or maybe I am missing something? If #316 got fixed this would not be an issue.
Manager.title: Can't find an easy way to add all new episodes to the queue with the new UI

Manager.description: I have a whole bunch of podcasts in my AntennaPod with some of them being feeds from radio stations, which generate a lot episodes (several per day) and where I'm only interested in single episodes. Every other day (like once a week or so) I browse through all the podcasts I have in my list and add the episodes I'm interested in to my playlist. This is of course easiest done by selecting one source and going to all the new tracks there and then proceed with the next source. Therefore I then end up with a playlist that has the tracks in the order in which I have added them, i.e. with lets say 5 tracks from radio station A then two from station B and so on. Especially with topics that are currently in the news it would be convenient if there was an option to sort the tracks chronologically by their release date. For example a menu (maybe also with other sort orders) in the "organize playlist" view could do that.
Manager.title: Option to sort episodes in playlist by release date

Manager.description: In the 0.9.9-NewUI-nightly, this podcast feed results in a truncated URL-display: "http:/. Not sure if it's a bug in AntennaPod, or a broken feed. Either way, a fall back to simply "domain.tld" might be a good idea.
Manager.title: fallback URL if feed doesn't include proper one

Manager.description: If I go to Settings and change the theme, then click the back button or the settings icon, the app closes. It doesn't show a Force Close or any error, just returns to the home screen. Tested with 0.9.8.3 on Android 4.4 (CM11)
Manager.title: App exits after changing theme

Manager.description: Hi, The Frontline audio podcast suddenly started to kill AntennaPod. Every time I refreshed AntennaPod died without any error message. I removed all feeds and added one at a time from my opml until I got to the one that made AntennaPod crash. It was Frontline from PBS. The feed URL is: http://feeds.feedburner.com/FrontlineAudiocastPbs This feed has worked until today. I do not mind that some feeds may not work with AntennaPod, but that a feed kills the app instantly is difficult to work with and troubleshoot. It took quite a while getting through all my feeds to find the perpetrator! :)
Manager.title: Podcast feed killing AntennaPod.

Manager.description: I have a few ideas for refactorings I’d like to run by the project. When I implemented OPML backup I saw some places where I think it would be beneficial for the app to “offload” functionality to other libraries and services. Less code (and sources of bugs) at the expense (possibly) of less control. Specifically, EventDistributor can be replaced (or backed) with LocalBroadcastManager that ships with the support libaries This is a small change and would be straight forward to implement. The EventDistributor API could stay the same. Use Volley (or other library designed to download small files) to download feeds and images (it also does caching) Use the Download Manager to download podcasts and videos Getting HTTP downloads right is not straight forward (AntennaPod has 8 classes for this purpose) and requires threads, locks, background services and notifications to work properly. Download Manager takes care of all that and does retries as well as handles connectivity failures. It is not clear that using Download Manager would work exactly the same as the current solution, but I think it will and I’m willing to give it a shot. I appreciate all the time and effort that was put in to these parts of the app, and would totally understand if there's hesitation in changing them too much. The obvious reason not to is that it currently works. Also, these changes would not change how AntennaPod functions or looks. If, however, you think it’d be a good idea to simplify the code base then I would be interested in seeing if we can make it work. What do you think?
Manager.title: Ideas for code refactorings

Manager.description: From time to time I'm downloading podcasts manually (mainly because they are not propagated within the feed itself anymore). When opening these files in the file explorer, it is not possible to select AntennaPod as an option. I would like to use AntennaPod for this purpose, though, because of its playback speed options and because I don't want to bother installing another application for that matter alone.
Manager.title: Allow playback from files

Manager.description: Hi, I have AntennaPod set to auto-downoad and keep an episode cache of 20. But when I was checking I had at least 40 episodes. AntennaPod was still deleting episodes but there were really old ones in there and even some duplicates. How does AntennaPod keep track of how many episodes are in the cache and is there anything I can do to get the cache back within the set limit?
Manager.title: AntennaPod not keeping within the set episode cache.

Manager.description: I may have requested this in the past but over time it has gotten more important: A setting to have new downloaded episodes added to the top of the queue.
Manager.title: Feature request: Add new downloaded episodes to the top of the queue.

Manager.description: Hi, some of the podcstvi follow are "last minute news" this means that they are updated frequently but I am only interested in the last episode or so. Unfortunately in antenna they tend to swarm my queue.
Manager.title: per podcasts cache limit

Manager.description: Hey! When pausing in the lockscreen, also in the notification screen, the player disappears. I have to open the app or use the homescreen widget to play again.

Look here: video rss feed: http://www.cczwei.de/rss_tvissues.php audio rss feed: http://www.cczwei.de/rss_issues.php I can't add both of these rss feeds at the same time - only one of them, because when trying this, Antennapod states that I've already subscribed to it! Please fix this annoying issue. Thanks! Regards, Mister Floppy
Manager.title: Problem with adding audio and video rss feeds from the same website

Manager.description: [ AntennaPod, v0.9.8.3, Samsung G4 mini, Android 4.2.2 ] Right now it seems as if Flattr has changed some URL settings. If I try adding the connection to Flattr, I get towards the dialogue to enter my credentials, submit and afterwards receive a 404 popup. Unfortunately AntennaPod doesn't know the connection succeeded. Checking the Flattr website I do see a working connected AntennaPod application.
Manager.title: Unable to add Flattr connection

Manager.description: I´m trying to search podcasts in gpodder.net directory but everytime I try to i got an error. How to reproduce: Add podcast -> Find in gpodder.net ... Wait Observed behaviour Info from Top podcasts - Error occured:java.net.ssl.SSLPeerUnverifiedException: No peer certificate Expected: Podcast list is populated with podcasts Same error occur when searching from top magnificator.
Manager.title: Peer certificare error when trying to add podcast from gpodder

Manager.description: Hi, after the 0.9.9.0 release with the new UI became available on F-Droid I was finally able to test the new UI. Some feedback from my perspective: I like that there is finally a view that shows all downloaded items. Great that play list manipulation (moving up/down etc.) is much easier now. I seem to accidentally swipe off episodes too easily, but that may be just my clumsy fingers. Deletion on long press or context menu or so might be safer. Please bring back display of playing time and possibly release date and podcast name to items in the playlist. This seems to be only available in the Downloads/Finished view. Release date and podcast name should at least be avaibale from the episode detail view. But playing time is quite essential for me. One thing that feels really completely wrong is that in the All Episodes view, when trying to scroll up from the top of the list, a refresh of all podcasts is triggered. This alone makes this view completely unusable for me. Please note that this process can take quite some time and it seems that other parts (Playlist etc.) are not accessible at all. (I have a lot of podcasts and not the fastest device on the market.) IMO it should only be triggered explicitly and not accidentally when scrolling a list where one even cannot see whether one is at the top of the list or not. Even worse as when entering the app from the widget and clicking in the upper left of the player one ends up automatically in this view. Also there is the refresh button in the upper right, why should one be able to trigger this in another way? Anyway, please keep up the good work and thanks for releasing the software for free. Edit: It would also be great if the number of contained episodes would be visible again at the top of the list as before.
Manager.title: New UI: Some feedback

Manager.description: AntennaPod is now so close to perfect I feel the need to repeat the few issues I have. The most important one is a setting to have new episodes added to the top of the queue, #424 . For me it's much easier to move podcasts down than up, and the concept of having the newest on top suits my workflow better.
Manager.title: Bumping a feature request: Option to add new episodes to the top of the queue (#424)

Manager.description: One of the feeds I subscribe to references an episode that has either been deleted, moved or renamed. With the new version of AP, it ends up repeatedly trying to download it every 2 seconds - I had to remove episode from the queue to stop it. Is this something to do with the new code to re-attempt failed downloads?
Manager.title: Re-attempting podcast download every 2 seconds

Manager.description: Hello! I remember seeing a download over wifi only option. Is it gone? I can't find it anymore and AntennaPod has skyrocketed my monthly data usage.

In the log tab, I get errors including "parser exceptions" and "unsupported feed type". Also in the notification area I get "processing download" that I can only kill if I force close the app. Related issue I guess. I hope it can be fixed because this was a great app.

Manager.description: The feed http://www.radioradicale.it/podcasting.php?e=74 only works just after being added to antennapod. When I try to update it, it doesn't download new episodes; the only way to get new episodes is by removing the feed and re-adding it. I guess there must be something wrong with the feed (feedvalidator.org shows some errors), but the feed works fine with other podcast clients (e.g. gpodder on my desktop), so maybe antennapod could be "fixed" to support it? Of course if you can spot the problem in the feed, I will be happy to forward the problem to the original author so that it can be fixed.
Manager.title: This feed only works one time, after being added

Manager.description: Since the latest update with the new UI I can't delete Antennapod from the notification area. "Downloading podcast data" with the syncing logo always stays in the notification area without any option/possibility to remove it from there After the sync process it should be possible to remove the entry from the notification area

Manager.description: When the "All episodes" view is empty there are 3 icons in the right upper corner: search synchronize (look for new episodes) menu But when there are some episodes the synchronize option moves into the menu and instead there is the "mark all as read/listen" icon. In my opinion this option should be in the menu and the synchronize icon should always be on the view in the upper corner. This bug only affects episodes that have just been downloaded in the current session, episodes donwloaded in previous sessions can be re-played without problems.

Manager.description: Hi! With the new UI the user is not able to know how many episodes he has in the queue (or at least I don't know how to see it). Seems necessary to me.

Manager.description: The titles of the podcast are cropped to much: See screenshot ("Das ..."). If a crop-by-word is not possible, you may consider crop-by-char. BTW: It would be nice, if it would be possible to group podcasts. PS: Thanks for your work. (I like the app.)

Manager.description: I have a small issue with the new UI: I don't find the 'All episodes' screen very useful. It shows every episode of every podcast grouped by podcast* (hundreds of episodes). When 'show only new episodes' is selected the screen is empty (because they have been automatically downloaded and queued). As all of my newly downloaded episodes are sitting in the 'Queue' I'd like that to be the screen I see whenever I open AntennaPod. Could there be an option to make the queue the starting screen? * it'd make more sense if they were in descending chronological order with the newest episodes at the top - edit: I think it does this on some feeds not others, several feeds seem to appear at the top with every episode's date set to today

Manager.description: Hello! There are a way to integrate the AntennaPod with my podcast manager?

Manager.description: If I remove an item from the queue by swiping it to the side I am informed I can undo this by pressing the back button. Doing this causes me to leave Antennapod for the Android home screen with no clue as to whether the removal has been done. In general it seems too easy to remove things from the queue accidentally. It would be nice to have an option to require confirmation before removal rather than undo afterward or a screen with recently removed items on it from which they can be restored.

Manager.description: Hi, I checked the option "Continuous playback", and it's working fine with audio files. However, for videos after finishing one item, the player only selects the next one in the list, but doesn't start it automatically, so you have to press "PLAY" manually. Please fix this very annoying issue, when taking a bath in the tub, I don't want to get my tablet wet :-) Thanks!

Only those entries with media enclosures have the individual "Mark as read" items. Unless I've been missing the obvious - in that case I'm suggesting to make it better visible, e.g. in the same place (article details) where you can find it for articles with media enclosures.

Manager.description: related to #106 Some podcasts use those for some reason, resulting in ineligible shownotes, esp. in the dark theme. I have written to them, kindly requesting to know why and/or to stop. What are your opinions on this? Is there a substantial use-case that justifies accepting the theme incompatibility? How about implementing ignorance towards such formatting?

Manager.description: The gpodder.net website supports Google account login. It would be nice if this feature could be added to AntennaPod as well.

Manager.description: A Podcast had a episode url starting with Http:// instead of http:// Antennapod reports the message Could not resolve the host 'Http'. It retries after 2 seconds failing with the same message. This is the case since 24h with active WiFi! I reported to the Publisher. He said he has fixed it. But antennapod does not updates the url and tries every 2 seconds.

Manager.description: Add option to step ahead or behind by a customizable amount of time. This is helpful when scanning through lengthy audio files.
Manager.title: add step ahead/behind buttons

Manager.description: I love this app! But there's one bug that is getting me on the brink of switching. Not always, but very often, when I come back to an episode that I've started listening to before, it does not resume from where I paused it. It does not matter if I have played another episode since or if I just paused this episode, closed the app and came back later. Often the seeker is at the correct place, but when I hit play, it jumps either to the very begining of the episode, or to somewhere close to the beginning. I've had this issue since the previous version of AntennaPod, and on two different phones with both stock Android and Cyanogenmod. I'm using 0.9.9.0 now, and it's the same. I hope this will be fixed soon. I'd hate to switch to a non-Free podcast app and I really want to be able to recommend AntennaPod to my friends! Thanks!
Manager.title: Often does not resume playback from where I was

Manager.description: I have the following packages installed: Android SDK Tools 23.0.2 Android SDK Platform-tools 20 Android SDK Build-tools 20 SDK Platform 20.1 When I run ./gradlew assembleDebug, it gives the build error Execution failed for task ':preBuild'. failed to find target android-19 : /Applications/Android Studio.app/sdk Installing SDK Platform 19.3 (alongside 20.1) then gives the error Execution failed for task ':preBuild'. > failed to find Build Tools revision 19.1.0 Installing Build Tools 19.1 then gives the error Execution failed for task ':submodules:dslv:library:preBuild'. > failed to find Build Tools revision 19.0.3 Installing Build Tools 19.0.3 then gives the error Execution failed for task ':submodules:dslv:library:preBuild'. > The SDK Build Tools revision (19.0.3) is too low for project ':submodules:dslv:library'. Minimum required is 19.1.0 I'm not sure how to go from here :(
Manager.title: Build error: "The SDK Build Tools revision (19.0.3) is too low for project ':submodules:dslv:library'. Minimum required is 19.1.0"

Manager.description: Version: 0.9.9.1 von F-Droid OS: CyanogenMod 11m8 (Android 4.4.4) Gerät: Samsung Galaxy S2 In der "Alle Episoden"-Ansicht wird bei mir öfters nach Drücken des Menübuttons am Gerät (nicht des ... Buttons oben rechts) das Menü in 2 Schritten aufgebaut, anstatt in einem Rutsch vollständig angezeigt zu werden. Leider habe ich so schon öfters "Alle als gelesen markieren" getroffen, obwohl ich eigentlich "Aktualisieren" wollte. Letzterer wurde durch einen anderen Menüeintrag, der den Bruchteil einer Sekunde später auftauchte, nach oben geschoben. Habe leider noch kein Muster dieses Problems gefunden. Evtl., wenn die Liste aller neuen Episoden schon etwas länger (ca. 20) wurde. Dodgy menu display In the "All episodes" view pressing the device's menu button (not the ... in the top right corner) sometimes results in the menu being displayed in two steps instead of being displayed in full in one go. Unfortunately, I've therefore hit "Mark as read" often already, even though I wanted to "Refresh", because the latter got pushed upwards by another menu entry appearing a fraction of a second later. Unfortunately, I found no pattern of this problem so far. Maybe it appears when the list of all episodes grew larger (ca. 20).

The latest version of AntennaPod force-closes for me whenever I try to play any video at all, streamed or downloaded. Device info and logcat in this gist: https://gist.github.com/inducer/6cb61acc7dbc05ac4f66
