The error shown in logs under download tab is, Unknown Error. I have reinstalled the App yet the problem still persists. The Android update was the official Samsung certified OTA update. How do I resolve this issue?
Manager.title: Error with Android 4.4.2

Manager.description: If there is an item in the queue of a podcast that is removed completely, the podcast will get removed from the queue, but the queue count on the slide panel will not update.
Manager.title: Queue count doesn't update when a podcast is removed

Manager.description: i am trying a few gpodder clients. with antennapod not all podcasts got synced from gpodder.net , eg: https://gpodder.net/podcast/the-titanium-physicists-podcast won't get synced. I don't see it in my podcast list. Moto G, 4.4.4 latest antennapod from fdroid
Manager.title: not syncing with gpodder

Manager.description: After subscribing to a podcast that either needs authentication, or that one wants to not have auto-downloaded, it's cumbersum to get out of the Add Podcast dialogue, scroll down the list and enter the podcast's info page. Being able to adjust such options directly after subscribing would be neat.
Manager.title: unify info and subscription page of a podcast

Manager.description: related (maybe an alternative) to #490 My most common mode of subscribing to a new podcast is because I got interested in its most current episode. This currently involves a lot of clicking so it would be nice if the general Auto-download option could also determine what happens to the latest episode of a newly subscribed podcast. If it is set, it should be downloaded. What do you think?
Manager.title: automatically add most recent episode of newly added postcast to Queue or All Episodes list

Manager.description: I have a Nokia BH-217 headset that works fine with CSipSimple and Skype. It is connected to my Nexus 7 running CyanogenMod cm-11-20140804-SNAPSHOT-M9 and is used by CSipSimple. AntennaPod 0.9.9.3 however refuses to use it and is instead using the speaker. How can I get AntennaPod to use this Bluetooth headset? According to Android this headset only offers one profile "Phone audio" and the list under "paired Bluetooth devices" says "Connected to phone audio". According to Nokia's documentation: "The headset is compliant with the Bluetooth Specification 2.1 + EDR supporting the Headset Profile 1.1 and Hands-Free Profile 1.5." Thank you for AntennaPod!
Manager.title: bluetooth "phone audio" headset not working

Manager.description: Fresh google play install on Xiaomi MI 3W MIUI-4.6.27 crashes when pressing the settings menu item.
Manager.title: Antennapod crashes on opening settings

Manager.description: Hello! In the old UI it was possible to add items to the queue and then select 'download all'. I would appreciate if this behaviour would return as the new one can cause trouble when one wants to download several episodes with different file sizes. For example, a podcaster released three new episodes with different lengths: Episode One (1:00) Episode Two (0:45) Episode Three (0:30) Naturally, I would like to listen to the episodes in the correct order, but when I download them, Episode Three will be completed first and added to the queue first so that, in this example, they end up with the opposite order on the queue. Thanks in advance! Cheers
Manager.title: Add to Queue, then Download

Manager.description: I recently added a podcast which happened to have the same title as one of the podcasts I already had, except for one letter that was lowercase in one title and uppercase in the other title. Here they are: http://www.rtl.fr/podcast/la-revue-de-presse.xml (title: "La revue de Presse") http://cdn-new-europe1.ladmedia.fr/var/exports/podcasts/sound/revue-de-presse.xml (title: "La revue de presse") After refreshing my episode list, I got broken entries, as if AntennaPod mixed the 2 podcasts somehow (title from one of the podcast, with photo from the other podcast for instance). Since podcast infos are kept in files named after the podcast titles on my FAT32 formatted memory card (case insensitive filesystem), my best guess is that when refreshing the whole episode list, the files from one of the podcasts overwrite the files from the other podcast.
Manager.title: Broken episode entries when having 2 podcasts with the same title (case insensitive)

Manager.description: if available
Manager.title: show current chapter in notification

Manager.description: Since http://freakshow.fm/fs139-rectal-temperature-sensor-location was loaded together with its special title, the APP directly shows a black screen without any additional information. Note: The app though doesn't crash. Is there any way to provide you more information?
Manager.title: Since freakshow 139 antennapod is broken

Manager.description: gradle fails with latest android SDK -- it looks for v19 sdk but version is 20 I'm not 100% sure which lines need to be updated; did a blind update in build.gradle and submodules/dslv/library/build.gradle: android { compileSdkVersion 20 buildToolsVersion "20.0" defaultConfig { minSdkVersion 10 targetSdkVersion 20
Manager.title: Update wiki for sdk v23 gradle build instructions

Manager.description: The log in the "Downloads" section appears to keep every download (successful and failed) forever. It would be great to be able to clear the log since it's getting very long.
Manager.title: Way to delete/clear download log?

Manager.description: I'd like to donate to AntennaPod since I use it a lot, but I don't use Flattr or bitcoin. Do you have any other options? 👍 1
Manager.title: donations

Manager.description: Hi AntennaPod-Team, I observed an undesired behavior of AntennaPod. The "PlaybackService" hangs in status "Will be restarted" (in German: "Neustart wird durchgeführt"). This happens even if the application has been closed weeks ago and several other applications have been unsed in the meantime. Please see screenshot attached. How to reproduce: Start AntennaPod Start playback of a previously downloaded podcast (I use the play-button at the bottom of the screen which starts the most recent played podcast) After round about one hour: Stopp playback (I use the stopp-button at the bottom of the screen) Leave AntennaPod by pressing "back-button" several times (until I'm back on homescreen) Check taskmanager after several days of heavy usage of my device --> PlaybackService says: ---- "will be restarted", ---- Size: "0.00 B", ---- 0 Processes, 1 Service See screenshot attached. Expected: AntennaPod and PlaybackService should be closed properly and not must appear in the taskmanager (at least not in this status) My setup: HTC One S, Android Version 4.1.1 Please let me know if you need further information or tests. Thank you for that great app!! WF
Manager.title: "PlaybackService" hangs in status "Will be restarted"

Manager.description: The first time you add a podcast, app tries to download all of the entries of the podcast, even the very old ones. That makes an annoying attempt to download episodes that already don't exist (404 error) and notification bar shows the error again and again. A configurable limit by number (since the last one) or by date should be supported. In this way, Antennapod would "forget" the old entries when the automatic download is enabled.
Manager.title: Automatic podcast download should be limit by number or date

Manager.description: Here it is compiled for ARChon. Seems to work perfectly.
Manager.title: AntennaPod for ChromeOS

Manager.description: Hey, first off, love AntennaPod. Just have been having some weird issues that seem to be independent of any updates to the app or Android. As far as I can tell, they appeared out of nowhere. The biggest issue is that pushing the play button next to a podcast in the queue no longer plays the podcast. instead, it takes me to the playback screen of the currently playing podcast (which remains paused). I can push the play button in the queue repeatedly and sometimes after a few presses it will take me to the playback screen and I can hit play again and the cast plays, but sometimes it can be upwards of 20 presses. If there is not a podcast currently playing then I can switch to any other podcast. Sometimes I will get an playback error message and then the playback screen will come up empty and I can play a new podcast then. Another (I'm guessing) related issue is that continuous playback is checked but when a podcast ends and a new one loads, it does not play automatically. Continuous playback is checked in the setttings. I'm running version 0.9.9.3 on a Republic Wireless Moto X running Android 4.4.2
Manager.title: Playback/Queue problems

Manager.description: Before podcast is downloaded, the podcast image/icon is just fine. But after downloading, it disappears. This happens on all my podcasts. I am using a Nexus 7 (2013) running Android 4.4.4, AntenaPod version 0.9.9.3
Manager.title: Podcast Image Disappears After Downloading

Manager.description: Menu background for Dark Theme is White (making white text invisible) I have selected the Dark theme for the application and the Menu (bottom button on the phone) for the Settings and it has white test on a white background. My Android version 2.3.5. I have reviewed the code, but I am not aware of which Theme element is required for this to be set to a Dark colour.
Manager.title: Menu background for Dark Theme is White (making white text invisible)

Manager.description: Device: Samsung S3, Android 4.3, AntennaPod Ver 0.9.9.3 After a podcast episode has finished the play button is still active and not automatically deleting the episode on the device. Not sure if this is because I turned Episode cache to 100?
Manager.title: Podcast Episodes Not Automatically Deleting

Manager.description: Device: Samsung S3, Android 4.3, AntennaPod Ver 0.9.9.3 On some occasions when a phone call comes through and the AntennaPod is paused and when I have to open AntennaPod and un-pause the episode starts from the beginning.
Manager.title: Episode Re-starts After Interruption

Manager.description: Device: Samsung S3, Android 4.3, AntennaPod Ver 0.9.9.3 Assuming Skip Episode is not supposed to be a Skip Episode with an automatic delete function, which if it is, only Skips the episode for me. It would be great if there was a Delete button on the screen while in the specific episode with Delete being listed form the Menu button or maybe even at the top of the screen in the centre between the back to the main screen menu and http link. Daniel big thanks to you and all the people that help to make this great app!
Manager.title: Feature Request: Delete Button In Episode

Manager.description: Hi AntennaPod-Team, after a certain time of playback, AntennaPod stps playing audio. It just breaks off, but AntennaPod still shows the play button and I can also press pause and stop. Also a complete restart of the app is useless, I have to start every time the whole Cell Phone new. How to reproduce: The whole thing is not reproducible by time or by user interaction. Expected: No crashing audio. My setup: build.brand: Samsung build.host: cyanogenmod build.product: GT-I9100 version.release: 4.4.4 version.sdk_int: 19 log: http://pastebin.com/ss93LdGN
Manager.title: AntennaPod audio crashing

Manager.description: When selecting how many podcasts to keep downloaded, the minimum is 10. I'd like to set that even lower, like 5 or maybe even 2. More options under 10 or the ability to enter your own number would be a great feature!
Manager.title: Keep less than the 10 last podcasts

Manager.description: What I'd like is when adding a podcast the option to queue it in chronological order (I.E. Append the podcast to the queue, oldest episode first, newest episode last). Imagine you had this queue already:- Podcast 1 - Season 5 - Episode 4 Podcast 2 - Season 2 - Episode 8 Then added Podcast 3, which is has two seasons of 5 episodes each, it'd end up with:- Podcast 1 - Season 5 - Episode 4 Podcast 2 - Season 2 - Episode 8 Podcast 3 - Season 1 - Episode 1 Podcast 3 - Season 1 - Episode 2 Podcast 3 - Season 1 - Episode 3 Podcast 3 - Season 1 - Episode 4 Podcast 3 - Season 1 - Episode 5 Podcast 3 - Season 2 - Episode 1 Podcast 3 - Season 2 - Episode 2 Podcast 3 - Season 2 - Episode 3 Podcast 3 - Season 2 - Episode 4 Podcast 3 - Season 2 - Episode 5 This would be useful for people who like to listen to the backlog of a Podcast. Maybe also add some advanced options (Reverse order, only add newest X episodes/time, Regex, only add season X-Y,Z), etc... Maybe also add the option to the podcast's page.
Manager.title: Queue podcast when adding it

Manager.description: I removed a podcast as the new entries were refusing to download, now I can't re-subscribe, so I suspect something in the feed. Validators seem OK with it. It may be that there's some trace of my previous subscription, though I've tried to delete all files associated with it. Does this work for others? http://mediaweb.musicradio.com/RSSFeed.xml?Channel=9495 I'm on v0.9.9.3 on Android 4.0.3 (yes it's an old phone!)
Manager.title: Can't add podcast

Manager.description: Adding podcast http://lhf-podcast.rhcloud.com/feed/ fails with An error occured:Parser Exception (). According to validator.w3.org this url contains a valid xml. Opera successfully parses it as an rss feed. I use latest f-droid build 0.9.9.3 on android 4.4.2.
Manager.title: Parser Exception on well-formed XML

Manager.description: I'm not sure if this is already in the app and Im overlooking it, but I want to be able to set a different number of episodes to keep for each podcast. For example, I would like to keep 5 of the most recent episodes of Podcast A, and 10 of the most recent episodes of Podcast B. Is this possible?
Manager.title: Seperate Episode Cache Limit for each Podcast

Manager.description: With a nightly build that fixes the progress bar refresh issue (antennapod-develop-39c365e-nightly), all podcast downloads crash at the end, causing a failure. My next post contains a logcat. It looks like it might be an unhandled exception upon failure to connect to Google Analytics.
Manager.title: Crash at end of downloads

Manager.description: Hi all. I have issues subscribing to the following feed: http://echo.msk.ru/programs/code/rss-audio.xml. I can subscribe using HTC One, which runs Android 4.4.4, but can't do it using HTC Desire X, which runs Android 4.1.1. Update: is was fixed in the pull-request #324
Manager.title: Can't subscribe to podcast on specific device

Manager.description: Phone: Xiaomi MI3 Android Version: 4.4.4 KTU84P MIUI Version: MIUI-4.10.24 AntennaPod Version: 0.9.9.4 When I 'Add Podcast' then select 'Browse gpodder.net', the list of categories is very briefly displayed before AntennaPod crashes back to the home screen. It also crashes back to the home screen when I 'Add Podcast by URL' after pressing 'Confirm'.
Manager.title: Crashes when browsing podcast directory

Manager.description: I have an issue with AntennaPod. After downloading a lot of podcasts, it does not play podcasts any more. I'll try to describe the problem and its circumstances. I had no previous issues with antenna pod. It all worked flawlessly Suddenly, Antennapod would not play any episode anymore. This was correlated with me downloading quite a few new podcasts episodes. Although I do not know whether this is a coincidence or if there is more to this. At the moment, I can see the "Abspielliste", "Alle Episoden" etc. but as soon as I play an episode, antennapod stalls and crashes eventually before playing one sound.
Manager.title: Does not play podcasts

Manager.description: Currently the images folder can grow without bound. It would be useful to set a cap on the size, as well as provide a "clear" action.
Manager.title: Manage images on disk

Manager.description: I noticed that the directory containing the images (de.daneoh.antennapod/files/images) was over half a GB, so I deleted it. Now none of my shows have images, which is expected. But shouldn't AntennaPod refetch them as necessary? Also see #535
Manager.title: Refetch image media after clearing cache

Manager.description: With paged feeds you can list all Episodes of a Podcast instead of only the last 10 or 20... Episodes. RFC 5005 Podlove
Manager.title: Paged Feeds

Manager.description: If the podcasting app one uses supports it, you can see a list of your recently played episodes on your gPodder.net profile. It would be nice if AntennaPod would support this, but it should be possible to toggle it off or on for privacy reasons. Have a look at my profile for an example: https://gpodder.net/user/forteller/
Manager.title: Add support for gPodder's recently played episodes function

Manager.description: When I access the Playback history area of AntennaPod, all of the entries there are at least a few weeks old. Also they are not listed chronologically.
Manager.title: Playback history doesn't work

Manager.description: For some reason downloads fail quite often for me. When I tap the "Downloads completed" message and get sent to the log, I'd like to be able to choose to retry the failed episodes right there and then.
Manager.title: Let me retry failed downloads from the log

Manager.description: One of Android 5.0 APIs is the Media playback. Quoting from here, http://developer.android.com/about/versions/android-5.0.html, "If you are implementing notifications that present media playback status or transport controls, consider using the new Notification.MediaStyle template instead of a custom RemoteViews.RemoteView object. Whichever approach you choose, make sure to set the notification's visibility to VISIBILITY_PUBLIC so that your controls are accessible from the lock screen. Note that beginning in Android 5.0, the system no longer shows RemoteControlClient objects on the lock screen. For more information, see If your app uses RemoteControlClient." Notification.MediaStyle can be found here: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/Notification.MediaStyle.html Unfortunately, the solution provided in Issue #405 doesn't seem like it will be supported in Android 5.0 and on.
Manager.title: Persistent notification and lockscreen controls for Android 5.0

Manager.description: Just can't seem to get the podcast files to download in one go. Log just shows connection error and download failed. Will have to keep downloading again and again (luckily, it resumes from where it stopped) Pretty sure that my wifi connection is not getting disconnected or anything. Damn annoying, this. I use a Motorola E.
Manager.title: Issue in downloading over wifi

Manager.description: Hi There I have been trying to add a certain podcast feed to antennaPod list. It is the podcast for "Richard Herring's Leicester Square Theatre Podcast". Every time I add the feed it thinks every podcast is today. The next day when I updated the feed it increments the day and shows every podcast as today. I've had the feed in the app for a week and it does the same thing every day. The issue looks very similar to an issue reported before, #178, which was marked as won't fix because the was a legal issue with that feeds contents. The feed in this case is sourced via a feedburner link, I would have assumed there would have been some legal checks performed on it. I have check the pubDate values and they are all different dates. However I did notice that the timezone region is listed as GMT, not something like +0000.
Manager.title: Unable to interpret correct dates on a podcast

Manager.description: If a podcast episode has the search term in two of: Title, Chapters, or Description, the episode will be duplicated, once as "found in title" and the other as "found in shownotes."
Manager.title: Duplicate search results

Manager.description: Since this afternoon AntennaPod gives an error No external storage is avalable. Please make sure external storage is mounted so that the app can work properly I've used the app this morning, so I am not quite sure what has changed to cause this error. When I clear the data on the app, the app seems to be functional again. I haven't tried downloading podcasts after clearing data. I have a OnePlus One, so no SD-card. The /sdcard partition is filled and looks normal from ES File Explorer.
Manager.title: Antennepod giving error no external storage is available

Manager.description: I'm trying to add a podcast (my own!) which has an SSL certificate generated by CloudFlare. I get the error hostname in certificate didn't match. I think that the app is failing due to not supporting the SAN https://www.digicert.com/subject-alternative-name.htm
Manager.title: HTTPS certificate issues

Manager.description: The scroll position should of the Queue list should be saved and remembered, at least for the session if not in a persistent manner. I tend to keep quite a lot of podcast episodes in the AntennaPod queue for later listening (20-40 episodes). The current/recent episodes always reside at the bottom. So each time I want to select one of them, I need to scroll down all the way. When I change to the All Episodes view (to trigger a manual refresh for example) and then change back to Queue I have to scroll down again. This happens multiple times each day for me, so I'd be glad if this enhancement could be implemented soon. Thanks for working on AntennaPod!
Manager.title: Make scroll position in Queue view persistent

Manager.description: The one issue I currently have with AntennaPod is that I can't have new episodes added to the top of the queue. Please add this option.
Manager.title: Please add an option to add new episodes to the top if the queue

Manager.description: Two days ago I updated my phone (Nexus 5) to Android 5.0/Lollipop. Antennapod works like before. But yesterday there was a new Antennapod update (0.9.9.5) and now the playback speed controls are missing. I'm able to set the playback speeds in the setting menu, but I can't speed up the playback in the podcast view when listening to an podcast. I tried to uninstall und reinstall Prestissimo, but this doesn't help.
Manager.title: Playback speed controls missing since latest update 0.9.9.5

Manager.description: Please add option to only sync when Sync is turned on. ... Because that is what it's for. Thank you, and keep up the good work. Your Podcatcher is the one and only.
Manager.title: WISH: Please add option to only sync when Sync is turned on.

Manager.description: Since I loaded the latest update yesterday, the podcast queue no longer works. It will not always continue to the next podcast, or maybe it simply stops playing after a period of time. I need a podcast player that will always play the next podcast in the queue indefinitely.
Manager.title: Queue doesn't work since update

Manager.description: If i have a podcast playing currently I can't go find another one and play that one instead. This previously worked in other versions. When i click on a different podcasts play button it goes to the playing screen but has the podcast I was listening to stopped but set as the active podcast. This is occurring v0.9.9.5 on the Lollipop operation system, Nexus 5 phone. Restarting, clearing the chase or rebooting didn't make a difference either. (same as sthesing)
Manager.title: Can't switch to a different podcast while one is playing in v0.9.9.5

Manager.description: In the latest version Antenna Pod stopped playing podcasts through BT. The phone seems to be paired and connected correctly, but plays the podcast through the internal speaker of my nexus 5 (Lollipop). However, When I shutdown the BT Audio device, AntennaPod still notices that the connection was lost, and stops the podcast, even though it was played through the internal speaker. When I play AntennaPod first, and only then I turn on the BT device, it connects, the music plays through the BT device for ~1 sec, and then switches back to the internal speaker! All of this used to work 100% a day or two ago. System Info: Phone: Nexus 5 with Lollipop. 2 BT devices: Jabra Cruiser2 configured only for "Phone Audio" and "Contact Sharing" Generic Chinese A2DP BT to 3.5mm stereo adapter (BT ID is "H163"), configured for "Media Audio"
Manager.title: Bluetooth Audio not working anymore

Manager.description: There is a narrow edge around the video. No fullscreen anymore.
Manager.title: No fullscreen video in android 5.0

Manager.description: There is a narrow edge around the video. No fullscreen anymore with nexus 5
Manager.title: No fullscreen video in android 5.0

Manager.description: At least in JellyBean (4.1.2). Sent several reports. Without menu button, unable to access settings. Previous version was fine. The fact nobody other has open a bug for this makes me suspect that it does not happen in KitKat or Lollipod? It produces a java.lang.NullPointerException in class com.android.internal.policy.impl.PhoneWindow method oneKeyUpPanel line number 1002. Observed similar behaviour in some other apps after adapted to lollipop (not sure if it's related, but suspicious).
Manager.title: Hitting 'menu' button force closes in 0.9.9.5

Manager.description: With the introduction of 0.9.9.5 when touching the text title 'All episodes'/"Queue"/"Downloads"/... no longer opens the lateral "drawer" which allows switching between the activities. The drawer opens only when touching the icon in the upper left side of the screen. This is really uncomfortable/hard to achieve for right handed people when using the phone in a single hand, especially if the screen width is large relative to the hand size. Please bring back the possibility to open the drawer when touching the title of the screen.
Manager.title: 0.9.9.5: Usability regression - touching the tile text no longer opens the "lateral drawer"

Manager.description: Automatic feed updates not working. I was wait some days, restarted phone - nothing helps. Only manual update works (top right button). My settings: Mobile network updates disabled. Wifi updates enabled. Wifi filter disabled. Update interval 1 hour. AntennaPod 0.9.9.5 Android 4.1.1 (Prestigio Multiphone 4055 DUO)
Manager.title: Automatic feed updates not working

Manager.description: The is no button to flattr AntennaPod monthly. I think this would be a very useful feature an I can't use AntennaPod any more without it. regards Andre
Manager.title: No possibility to flattr App monthly

Manager.description: On protocol relative url AntennaPod prepends http:// which leads to an unusable url of form http:////example.com
Manager.title: AntennaPod fails on protocol relative urls

Manager.description: Hi, first of all, thanks for the app. On the lock screen using Android 5 / Lollipop, the app offers these controls: Play, Pause, Stop. I'd prefer a different set of controls: Rewind, Play/Pause*, Forward. (* The control should change depending on the current state of playback.) Use case is simple: While listening, I often rewind a few seconds if I missed something during a podcast. Also, I never use "stop", only "pause".
Manager.title: Please use different controls on lock screen

Manager.description: Until now Changelog file was using asterisks "*" at the beginning of each line. But in this release it seems to be using dashes "-". I think it should use the same character everywhere.
Manager.title: Cosmetic issue with 0.9.9.6 Changelog

Manager.description: Currently the option is disabled by default. I'm not sure if this is a good idea or not, but it was requested in danieloeh#115 (comment) and wanted to collect opinions here.
Manager.title: Enable persistent notification option by default

Manager.description: Apparently AntennaPod stores audio files using the episode title as the filename (as opposed to using the original filename from the URL). If the episode title is too long then it is not possible to download the episode due to a filesystem limitation -- it can still be streamed though. The typical limit for a filename on common filesystems is 255 bytes.
Manager.title: IOError: ENAMETOOLONG when downloading episode with long title

Manager.description: First of all I'd like to congratulate for this great podcast app! :-) I wonder if it would be possible to implement a feed-specific button to hide/unhide episodes which haven't been downloaded yet. Let me give you a short background on that: I usually don't download all podcast episodes from a feed (it would take to much space on my mobile phone) and if there are a lot of episodes it's hard to keep track of which ones are already downloaded (which I preferably would like to listen to) and which are not. This would make it easier to keep an oversight of downloaded files in a feed-specific way.
Manager.title: feed-specific button to hide/unhide not downloaded podcasts

Manager.description: Hi, There are some compatibility issues with the following Podcasts: http://resource.ffh.de/podcasts/ffh/rachederwartenden.rss http://static.rpr1.de/podcast/abenteuer/abenteuer.xml These 2 XML feeds are not correctly parsed and it seems that AntennaPod always identifies each entry as a new element. Additional the file-size does not match. Do you know the reason? Are there any possibilities to fix this issue? Best regards Chris
Manager.title: Compatibility issues with the some podcasts

Manager.description: Re-opening this closed issue, it appears that this option did exist at some point but has been removed again. This feature (and the ability to sync it with gpodder mentioned here) would be fantastic.
Manager.title: "Mark as (Un)read" option

Manager.description: I have chosen black backgrounds wherever I can. When opening Antennapod, there's always a flash of white screen before my Dark theme is applied (and content loaded). This is glaring (especially at night), and wastes power etc. I would like that, at least when the Dark theme is selected, the app starts with a black background.
Manager.title: Antennapod always uses white background on load

Manager.description: By default I think the 'Queue' should be the first screen the user sees and not 'All Episodes'. The rational is that the user came in to the app for the most common operation: listening to podcasts. Putting them in 'All Episodes' first makes them take an extra couple of steps to get to what they really want. I could see only defaulting to Queue if there are actually episodes in the queue. Thoughts?
Manager.title: Queue should be the default screen, not All Episodes

Manager.description: Consider the following use case: User is subscribed to a number of podcasts User's queue is full with previously downloaded podcasts All the episodes in the queue are stale. The user doesn't want to listen to them (they already listened to them, they got behind, whatever). With the current model the user would have to manually remove all the episodes from the queue, one by one. That can be very time consuming and tedious with a long queue. If there were a 'empty queue' or 'clear queue' command the user could issue that command, all the episodes in the queue would be removed and then, when the system auto-updates, the queue would be filled with the latest episodes from their various subscriptions. Worthwhile?
Manager.title: Add an 'Empty Queue' command

Manager.description: moved from the "soon closed" issue #458 It would be nice, if the queue view would get an "refresh" button, too. This is the only reason why i call the "all episode" view.
Manager.title: add a refresh button to the queue view

Manager.description: I have just done it. For a while I have been fearing the possibility and now it has turned into a reality. Because, in All episodes view, 'Refresh' option is right above 'Mark all episodes as read', and also in part due to me being slightly retarded, I accidentally touched the latter in place of the former. With no confirmation requested and no undo option available, I am now unaware of what episodes I have and haven't heard, and moderately bemused over this situation. I really wish there were a confirmation step or an undo option to this. Thank you for your time, attention and a great app.
Manager.title: Too easy to accidentally mark all episodes as read

Manager.description: When I try to login to my gpodder.net account from the settings menu, I get an error in red text saying: "Bad response code: 404" Hostname: gpodder.net I am able to login to gpodder.net on the web just fine. Android Version: 4.4.2 Model Number: SAMSUNG-SM-G870A AntennaPod 0.9.9.6
Manager.title: Unable to login to gpodder

Manager.description: BBC Today In Parliament don't give any indication of date in their show titles or descriptions, so I'm often left looking at the list in AntennaPod wondering which one is most recent (having reorganised my queue several times). I see there's a date in the raw xml (below), nicely displayed by firefox. It would be great if AntennaPod could display the date somewhere. It's a daily show so quite high volume. http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b006qtqd http://www.bbc.co.uk/podcasts/series/tip http://downloads.bbc.co.uk/podcasts/radio4/tip/rss.xml Many thanks for such a great piece of software. Loved the latest UI improvements, much better.
Manager.title: Show date from rss feed item - BBC Today In Parliament

Manager.description: There used to be an option to have volume buttons either control volume or control playback (rewind vs fastforward). This option doesn't seem to exist anymore -- the volume buttons just control playback. (Using f-droid latest version.)
Manager.title: Volume buttons rewind

Manager.description: Could not GET 'https://jcenter.bintray.com/net/sf/proguard-gradle/5.1/proguard-gradle-5.1.pom'. Received status code 400 from server:Bad Request Using: Android studio 1.0 -> use default gradle wrapper i'm from china,maybe some websites couldn't visit?
Manager.title: Could not GET

Manager.description: I'm not sure if it's a bug, but I noticed the context menu (long press) from 'All episodes' has gone away. The options that were in there are still available elsewhere, just not as easy to get to, was that intentional. If I recall you used to be able to download, delete, or add an episode to the queue.
Manager.title: All Episodes Context Menu Missing

Manager.description: On Android 5.0 the sync notification sometimes show up as empty, but other notifications work (the icon is there, but it's white and hard to see): Other times they work; I haven't noticed a pattern yet. Currently on the latest commit in the develop branch.
Manager.title: Sync notification broken on Android 5

Manager.description: Each time AntennaPod is downloading podcasts, has downloaded them or failed to download them, it adds a notification. Users should be able to control what notifications they do or don't want to receive, so there should be an option to disable the download notifications.
Manager.title: Option to disable download notifications

Manager.description: In #604 @LatinSuD made the following comment: "In the episode detailed view there are 2 actions shown ("Download" and "Stream"). I personally almost never use them. What I use a lot is "Add to queue", but that one is only accessible through the submenu. Not sure if other people use this screen the same way i do."
Manager.title: Make 'Add to Queue' more visible in All Episodes

Manager.description: Just updated to version 1.0 from the playstore. I can not see any of my old podcast, queues or history.
Manager.title: Doesn't show any data in version 1.0

Manager.description: It would be nice if the podcast would rewind x seconds (with advanced pref? default 10 sec?) at stop and pause.
Manager.title: pause should rewind x seconds

Manager.description: I would like to scan down the list of episodes in "All Episodes" view, tap the download icons of all episodes I wish to retrieve, and then have those episodes downloaded one at a time in order (instead of simultaneously). Often my queue will be empty, and I'll want that first episode to download as soon as possible so I have something to listen to while the rest download. Is this already possible?
Manager.title: Download serially instead of in parallel

Manager.description: Currently app only allows OPML import from a given directory, would be nice if this opened up a file dialog instead and allowed user to select the OPML file.
Manager.title: OPML Import

Manager.description: On devices such as Blackberry's, the volume up down buttons also have a play/pause functionality. This is tied to some type of android functionality as it works as expected for some apps, ie soundcloud, and beyondpod, but not AntennaPod.
Manager.title: Play / Pause Media Button Not Supported

Manager.description: Would seem useful to discover and search for podcast feeds in the iTunes podcast directory - API for the directory - https://www.apple.com/itunes/affiliates/resources/documentation/itunes-store-web-service-search-api.html
Manager.title: Integration with iTunes Podcast Search

Manager.description: I just noticed the update to the README that the project will not be receiving any further updates. I also noticed that a version of this app in the blackberry world app market is out of date with the current master and 1.0 tag. I'd like to offer to take over the maintenance of the blackberry specific functionality, testing and release management, if it in fact is currently being done by the same team here? If not would it be advisable that I just create a fork to continue on with the project?
Manager.title: Blackberry Package Maintainer

Manager.description: I've subscribed to the ZEIT Premium Podcast (URL: https://premium.zeit.de/itunes/feed) which is only available with a valid user name and password. Everything worked fine on v0.9.9.4, however, now on v1.0 I'm always prompted to reenter my credentials when I want to download a new entry although previously saved. However, reentering the login information does nothing so that the download fails in general. I've already triple-checked by password. Furthermore, I deleted and reinstalled the pod, without any changes. Ideas? — running on CM11 M9, Android 4.4.4
Manager.title: Password protected pods fail to load

Manager.description: When going back after viewing a single episode i jump to the top of the list instead of to the previous looked at episode
Manager.title: Going back to top after viewing single episode

Manager.description:
On OSX Yosemite after doing a clean checkout running: ./gradlew tasks * What went wrong: A problem occurred configuring project ':app'. > Cannot evaluate module library : Configuration with name 'default' not found.
* Try: Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace. Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output. Any help or ideas would be appreciated.
Manager.title: Issue /w Build

Manager.description: After a recent upgrade, the Refresh icon is no more available in the top bar (in all views). Now one must click the top-right "three dots" icon, and then select refresh, which I find cumbersome. Please consider bringing back the old refresh icon (at least in the single podcast view), beside the Search icon, or even instead of it.
Manager.title: Please bring back the Refresh icon

Manager.description: When using my phones menu button the menu should appear from the top right, just like it does when I click the three dots menu button in the app. (Like how it's done in the official Twitter app) Now it opens from the bottom.
Manager.title: Open the menu from the same place every time

Manager.description: In the menu you can set a fast forward/backward step width between 5 and 60 seconds. This value will be applied on both, forward and backward. The most frequent use cases for fast forward/backward are (in my opinion/experience): you want to skip some less interesting passage and find a point to continue listening you want to repeat a passage of about the last minute, maybe you have not listened to concentrated enough and and you must find the exact starting point again For both use cases an unsymmetric forward/backward step size which allows you to step forward coarse and find the exact point stepping backward fine. For example Linux Totem Video Player uses this technique with fixed step sizes of +60s / -15s. It is very easy to find a desired point by this means. My suggestion is to gives the possibility to selcet forward/backward step widths independantly by providing: separate inputs for both values - or - an input for fast forward and an extra multiplier for backward ratio: 0.1 / 0.25 / 0.5 / 1 (optional additionally: 2 / 4 / 10)
Manager.title: Enhancement: Unsymmetric fast forward/backward

Manager.description: When I view a list (e.g. "All episodes") and click on a single item to view details, I would like to swipe left/right to go to the next/previous item in the list. 👍 1
Manager.title: When viewing an item in a list, allow swipe left/right to go to next/previous list item

Manager.description: In some lists (e.g. "All items"), clicking a single item and going back out again makes it jump to the top of the list. It should stay where it was before you clicked the single item, like when viewing single feeds.
Manager.title: Should not scroll to top when going back to list view

Manager.description: Hi, There's a play/pause button to the right in the queue but it takes you to the playback screen when you press it. I would like for it to simply start playing or pause and stay in the queue view while adding a long press option to be taken to the playback screen.
Manager.title: [Feature Request] Play/pause directly from the queue without changing to the playback screen.

Manager.description: When I play back podcasts there's a little choppy part occurring every 3-6 minutes. It sounds like a a slightly damaged mp3 or what happens when the buffer is empty during streaming. However, since it occurs on downloaded epsodes it's not buffering.
Manager.title: Playback turns choppy in a few minutes intervals.

Manager.description: HI, I was wondering what happens when the cached limit is reached, specifically whether a deleted episode is removed from the queue if it's present there? If not consider that a feature request.
Manager.title: Will episodes deleted when reaching the cache limit also be deleted from the queue if present there?

Manager.description: In either the All Episodes or Queue, it is possible to play the episode using the play button at the right of the item. This button changes into a pause button as expected; however, it doesn't function as one. If tapped upon, it goes into the media view without pausing. Note: it is possible to pause using other methods, but the button in the list view never changes between play and pause after it has changed to pause.
Manager.title: When playing, pause doesn't work in the lists

Manager.description: In the queue list, it is possible to order the list by tap and holding onto the three horizontal lines, and moving the item up and down. I suggest using the podcast's image instead to tap and hold and sort vertically.
Manager.title: Use the podcast's image to sort the Queue list

Manager.description: We currently re-download all the feeds. It would be nice if we only downloaded feeds that have been modified (by using If-Modified-Since).
Manager.title: Improve Efficiency of Refreshing Feeds

Manager.description: On my LG L 5 Optimus there is no option to fast forward or rewind for Global National video podcast (http://feeds.feedburner.com/globalnationalvideopodcast). Please make these features available for video podcasts.
Manager.title: Video Player: Add fast forward and rewind controls

Manager.description: I noticed that there is no quick way to clear items or the queue in its entirety. Potential ways to solve item clearing: Long press, then multi select (would require an action bar with the delete option) Swipe left/right to clear individual items (with undo option displayed until a timeout or scrolling occurs) Menu option to "clear queue" and would remove all items from the queue.
Manager.title: option to clear queue

Manager.description: Firstly, thanks for your work. Please could you add episode actions synctonization with gpodder.net? Thank you again.
Manager.title: Add episode actions syncronization with gpodder.net

Manager.description: I think it be a cool feature to have a setting where you can specify amount of time, minutes, seconds etc. where if a podcast is stopped then it is marked as playing. I realize we can do this manually by marking as played from the queue, but there are cases where I'll skip to next track in my queue with a minute or something left just to skip the outro.
Manager.title: Time Left for "Mark as Played"

Manager.description: It had been implemented using the method outlined here: http://developer.android.com/training/monitoring-device-state/battery-monitoring.html However, that method isn't working anymore. In the logs we see that the call to intent.getIntExtra(BatteryManager.EXTRA_STATUS, -1) is returning -1. It isn't clear why this happened. We could resolve it by creating two different power connection listeners, ones that just handled connected/disconnected. I'd be interested in figuring out why this happened however. What changed? Continuing to look at it.
Manager.title: Autodownload based on charging isn't working in the 1.1rc1 release.

Manager.description: Hi, Sometimes when I click the play button in the queue the episode starts playing, but more often it doesn't and I'm taken to playback and have to click 'play' from there again. What's the mechanism behind this and would it be possible to consistently have episodes play directly from the queue? The queue is what I work from all the time and would like to have a way to not having to leave it unless I want more information about an episode.
Manager.title: Start playback directly from the queue.

Manager.description: If possible we should. Would be much better than having to put it in two places.
Manager.title: About screen does not pull the version from AndroidManifest.xml

Manager.description: It would be nice if you could swipe an item in the 'All Episodes' list to mark it as read. Granted, this only makes sense if you're only displaying 'new' items, but I think it might be a common use case. The problem is that DSLV doesn't support lists that can remove items but that don't want to be dragged around. I took a stab at this here: https://github.com/TomHennen/AntennaPod/tree/swipe_to_mark_as_read but was thwarted because of the DSLV issue. I may take another look at this in the future, but I figured I'd at least note it as a feature request.
Manager.title: Swipe to mark as read

Manager.description: We've been making some good progress over the last few months and it's time to get ready for a new release. To get ready for that I submitted the current strings file to Transifex. Per @danieloeh I used the 'tx' client. I documented the steps I took on the wiki (https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/wiki/Updating-Translations). However, I'm not sure I did it properly (this is my first time using Transifex). I'd appreciate it if someone (perhaps @danieloeh) could comment on if things look correct in the instructions and in the Transifex project (https://www.transifex.com/organization/antennapod/dashboard/antennapod). Thanks
Manager.title: Update translations for AntennaPod 1.1

Manager.description: Version 1.1 is about to be released. Some pretty significant changes were made and we'd like to make sure no problems have been introduced. It would really help if people could test the current release build, either by joining the AntennaPod Alpha Google Plus group (https://plus.google.com/communities/117446128636140585144) or by just downloading the latest release build here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/4c475h3yst0ys38/AntennaPod-develop-current-release.apk?dl=0 Please report any new bugs that you encounter. As many of you know @danieloeh stopped maintaining the project with 1.0. I'm trying my best to maintain the project properly. If you see that I'm doing anything wrong please let me know. I'd like to thank @mfietz for all the hard works he's put in to fixing bugs and adding new features. He's probably responsible for 70-80% of the changes you'll see in version 1.1. Of course, a big thanks to everyone else that's contributed for this release, their changes have provided some great new features and fixes. Going forward, if anyone would like to contribute, the most valuable thing for me would be if you could build the proposed pull requests and test the functionality introduced in that request. If you encounter any problems or have any suggestions, just add a comment to the PR. If everything works well, please comment saying that everything works well. That will give me more confidence when merging the requests. Thanks everyone!
Manager.title: Release candidate for 1.1 needs testing

Manager.description: I did not found a way to view the exact url of the feed of an podcast. This can be useful to check if i have an old url in case the url has changed for a podcast.
Manager.title: add ability to show feed url

Manager.description: Some thoughts about how the navigation drawer could be re-designed. Of course, some ideas might not be completely thought through - Feedback and ideas are appreciated. Basically, I think we should get rid of the Playback history and Downloads in its current form. In order: New episodes: This is already changed in the current build, no further changes required. Think "Inbox". Queue/Playlist: No changes. If requested, we could also have several Playlists. Feeds might get linked to a specific Playlist where new episodes would be added. Episodes would not get added to "the queue", but rather "Add to [default playlist]" and "Add to..." (Opens dialog where user can choose playlist, if there a more than one). Playlists could get renamed and episodes could be moved from one to the other. Downloads: Should behave like an "Download folder". Will show any episodes currently downloaded to the device. Will have the ability to play and delete episodes. Sorting criteria could include publication date, file size, progress, "last usage" and more. Favorites: Would only be displayed if the user actually marked episodes as favorites (yet to be implemented). Actions would basically be the same as Downloads. Being a favorite episode would also be considered when cleaning the cache to download new episodes. Add podcast: No changes. Maybe some small visual changes. +++ Feeds: No changes. +++ Settings: no changes.
Manager.title: Navigation drawer re-design

Manager.description: I have a site which is fully protected by HTTP Basic Auth. When users try to add the feed in AntennaPod, they are prompted for the password twice, even though both the website and the feed are on the same domain and use the same HTTP Basic Auth realm. Steps to reproduce: Add the following site to AntennaPod: http://p.j-crew.de Enter the username and password (both are "a", without the quotes) Confirm the RSS feed (there is only one) Expected result: The password from step 2 above is remembered and used for the feed and for downloading the MP3 files. Actual result: The user is queried again for the password after selecting the feed. Further information: The apache logs can be seen live at http://misc.j-crew.de/p-access.log and http://misc.j-crew.de/p-error.log (to see exactly which URLs were queried). There is an identical site except without HTTP Basic Auth at http://q.j-crew.de for comparison (with logs at http://misc.j-crew.de/q-access.log and http://misc.j-crew.de/q-error.log).
Manager.title: When discovering xml feed, password is not remembered

Manager.description: Specifically PlaybackTests. startLocalPlaybackFromQueue and PlaybackTests. startLocalPlayback are failing. They're failing because they expect the AudioplayerActivity to show up after you click on 'Play' from within 'New Episodes' and 'Queue'. That isn't happening anymore. I don't know when this change was introduced, if it was intentional or inadvertent (if I had to guess I'd say it was #693). I think that, before we make any change, we should figure out what the behavior should be. Do we want the audio player activity to start when you click on 'play' on an item in the list? I'm not sure that makes sense. Any opinions?
Manager.title: PlaybackTests currently failing

Manager.description: AntennaPod doesn't currently have a way to easily skip to the next episode. You can go to a sub-menu and click 'Skip episode' and that will do it, but it's not very accessible. I personally want to skip past episodes a lot, but that doesn't necessarily mean I want them removed from the queue. I think ideally we could add track forward/back buttons that let you navigate in your queue without removing episodes when you do so. These buttons (or at least forward) should be available on the widgets. Additionally, it should be possible to configure bluetooth buttons to track forward/back instead of rewind/fast forward. Does anyone else think such a thing is desirable? A lower-effort method would be to simply expose 'Skip episode' as a button on the various player widgets. All opinions are appreciated.
Manager.title: Episode Forward/Back

Manager.description: Here is a screenshot from an emulated Moto X running 4.4.4: When the episode cache dialog opens, the first entry is completely invisible. I find this extremely user unfriendly, I should not have to scroll in such dialogs. I think we should get rid of at least 2 options. 1 and 2 seem completely unnecessary. Proposal: Unlimited, 5, 10, 25, 50, 100 Another solution could be to have have the option unlimited (and maybe some valies) and a textfield where one can input the desired value. Advantage: Most flexible. Disadvantage: Having to type a value...
Manager.title: Episode cache preferences has to many entries

Manager.description:
I had a discussion with someone on the Google Group for AntennaPod. I'm not quite sure why they're experiencing the issues they're seeing. If it's something to do with the device they're using or if this is a usability issue or some combination of the two. He seems frustrated enough that we should probably consider what is going on and think about how it could be addressed. I'm following up with the author to find out what device they're using. Tim: Sad enough that you had to switch from the play list to "all episodes" every time you launch the app for a few months now, the "all episodes" lists is now missing completely. If I want to listen to an episode now, I have to search 3 lists to find it. This makes this great app almost unusable. Additionally, you have to scroll very, very carefully now not to swype one of the episodes out of the list. Please bring back the "all episodes" list or at least have a switch in the settings to turn it on. I was so glad I found a good podcast app, finally, I don't want to move all my podcasts again. Me: Hi Tim,
The All Episodes list is still around, it's just called 'New Episodes'. 'New Episodes' defaults to showing only those episodes that haven't been added to the queue. However, you can click the little three dots and clear the option that says to show new episodes only.
I wonder if you're using the app in a way that is somehow different from how most other people are using it. Most people add episodes to the queue and listen to them from there. You can configure the app to do this for you automatically if you like. Tim Thanks for your answer. I tried to use the app the way you proposed now and add the episodes I want to listen to to the playlist, but this release seems to be extremely buggy. E.g. - Some of my podcasts were in the playlist, some are not, I could not figure out what rule is behind this. So I decided to start from scracht und delete the episodes in the playlist to start with an empty one and add the episodes I plan to listen to. A few seconds after I emptied the list, more and more seemingly random episodes appeared in the list again. If I swype episodes away from the playlist, these exact same episode appear again in the list (happened 4 times with one episode) after a few seconds or minutes. The list is constantly filled up with random episodes - and the app seems to start downloading these random episodes after adding them to the list. - If "swyping away" multiple episodes in a row, the app reproducibly crases - Some of my podcasts are automatically downloaded, some are not, even though I have "automatic download" enabled for all podcasts (but this problem also existed in previous releases) - If I download podcasts manually in the "new eposodes" list, they are not marked as downloaded after the download (at least in 90% of the cases) - so I don't know which one I already downloaded - As already said, swyping is much more sensive than in any other app, which always makes you swype episodes away when scolling. Undoing the operation does not bring back the episode, at least not until changing to another list and then opening the first list again. - Loading the list sometimes takes minutes - or maybe the process hangs somehow. I never experienced that with the previous releases.
Maybe going back to the last stable release and fixing the bugs beforde publishing the new release would be a good idea. I really appreciate the work you do for a good, free opensource app, but on my part I cannot really use the app in this condition. Me: Hmm. We honestly haven't had those problems (crashes, random downloads, etc...) and have received mostly positive feedback regarding this release.
However, I'm certainly concerned. I'll be sure to relay these concerns to the rest of the team and we'll see what we can do.
Manager.title: Issues Reported from Google Groups "Please(!) bring back the "all episodes" list"

Manager.description: I think we missed a major use case of 'All Episodes' From a recent play store review: All episodes listing removed No clue why it was removed, now I have to look at a list with barely visible episodes. The old listing was far better. Showed episodes and clearly showed what was new. Silly change for the sake of change. Nothing beneficial. The user from #741 also seemed to care quite a bit about 'All Episodes'. I think some users (not sure how many) weren't actually using the queue. They were just using All Episodes and playing things as they wished. Our changes disrupted their workflow significantly. We didn't notice this because we all play everything from the queue and thought of 'All Episodes' as a place to go simply to add things to the Queue. I'd like to suggest the following changes for a 1.1.1 release (based on the version_1.1 branch): Instead of defaulting to the Queue view, we should really just display the last fragment the user was looking at when the app closed We should probably decrease or remove the amount of fading that happens to 'read' episodes in the 'New Episodes' list We should see if there are any low risk ways to implement some of @heckler01's suggestions from #721 (if there's no easy way it can wait for a more major update) Thoughts?
Manager.title: Major missed use case: Managing everything from 'All Episodes'

Manager.description: Sometimes I would like to control the order of episodes displayed. I might want to listen to the podcast from the first. Right now, I have to scroll all the way down to play each episode and this is especially a problem if there are a lot of episodes in the podcast. Could there be an option to control the order of podcasts by "Date-Added" or so on?
Manager.title: Control order of episodes

Manager.description: From Google Play Can't see downloaded episodes Why did you remove the All Podcasts list? Once a podcast is downloaded, it is removed from the New Podcast list, and not added to my queue. Its hard to see what podcasts I have to listen to. So I wouldn't worry much about this, except that they say the that after the episode is downloaded it doesn't show up in the Queue. My guess is that they don't have auto add enabled. But that's definitely not good behavior. Once #748 is published his overall issue should go away, but the queue, at least for him, isn't working the way it should. We should take a look at this.
Manager.title: Downloaded items not added the queue

Manager.description: I recently uploaded a release candidate of 1.1.1 to the Alpha channel for testing (you can also find it here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/7dyg37vi34gqunu/AntennaPod_1.1.1_release.apk?dl=0). This resolves some issues that were reported by users who missed the All Episodes view and used it instead of the Queue. All things considered this is a fairly minor change. But some feedback would be welcome before we push it out to production. Are there any other immediate changes we should include in 1.1.1? My hope is to get this out quickly to help out folks that are currently broken, but if anything is missing and straightforward we could include it now (or in a 1.1.2). Changelog: Version 1.1.1 All Episodes and New Episodes are now both present Remembers which activity was last active instead of always going to the Queue When adding a podcast the most recent episode is considered 'new'
Manager.title: Release 1.1.1 needs testing

Manager.description: It would be nice if we prominently indicated which feeds failed to refresh. You can probably get this from the download log but something more in your face would be nice. An indicator on the Podcast itself in the Nav drawer perhaps? Taken from a play store comment: Stopped showing new podcasts Used to be good, but won't show which podcasts it has failed to refresh. Podcast Addict doesn't have this problem so will be using that from now on. Update: The app will not show me which podcasts have failed or succeeded to download. Podcast Addict shows that certain podcasts have new content, this app does not right now.
Manager.title: Should indicate which Feeds failed to refresh

Manager.description: It can make a mess of the crash reports. Yes, if we keep the mapping we could reproduce them. But is there any upside to obfuscating? We're an open source application. There's no IP to protect? I'm considering adding -dontobfuscate to proguard.cfg. Are there any reasons I shouldn't? (see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9651703/using-proguard-with-android-without-obfuscation for some potential problems and a solution)
Manager.title: Don't obfuscate with ProGuard

Manager.description: Enable autodownload. Refresh so that a number of new episodes is found. Open the "Downloads" view. Choose any new episode and click the "x" on the right to stop the download. Each time a download of another item has finished, the episode where the download is stopped will be marked to be downloaded again.
Manager.title: Stopping downloads does not work

Manager.description: Hi! I'd like to mark multiple episodes to apply actions. For example if I want to mark some episodes as read.
Manager.title: Mark multiple episodes

Manager.description: I would like to see AntennaPod report media progress. This can be picked up e.g. by Music Boss to show media progress on the Pebble smartwatch.
Manager.title: Report media progress

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Version 1.1.1 was not tagged (or tags weren't pushed)

Manager.description: I am unable to listen to this podcast: http://daswort.geschichtendose.de/dtw/show they just have episodes 5 seconds long maybe thats the problem other podcasts seems to work.
Manager.title: Super short Episodes seems not work

Manager.description: Sometimes when your connection is slow and you want to see which podcasts the app downloads. So you can decide if you want to stop the download. But often antennapod is not downloading anymore. And the notification only shows that the download has finished long ago. On devices with bigger screens it can be annoying to open the notification area for nothing.... You could alter the icon in the following way: Make the right arrow a bit shorter and add a dot between the arrows to indicate that the arrows don't go round and round but stopped at some point.
Manager.title: Use different icons for "syncing" and "sync finished" notification

Manager.description: I'm using AntennaPod 1.1 and I just signed up for http://gpodder.net and configured the service for the first time. I was surprised to see that many of the podcasts I'm subscribed to appear as "Unknown Podcast" at https://gpodder.net/user/pdurbin/subscriptions Here are some examples: All of these have proper titles in AntennaPod, such as "Illegal Argument": Did I do something wrong? How can I get the titles from AntennaPod to gpodder.net? Thanks!
Manager.title: Podcast titles uploaded to gpodder.net as "Unknown Podcast"

Manager.description: I've been thinking that we have a bad user experience when you first subscribe to a podcast. Namely, you subscribe and then have to click back like 4 times to get to the main screen. It would be nice if when you subscribe it takes you to the subscribed podcast view (ItemListFragment), and then you don't have to navigate all those back buttons. This should make it much easier for people to interact with the podcast they just subscribed to.
Manager.title: Bring user to ItemListView when subscribing to a podcast

Manager.description: Hi, I would like to see a toggle option to have episodes deleted when swiped off the queue regardless of whether they are listened to or not. If that's not feasible a context menu option to delete the episode in addition to moving it up and remove it from the queue would be helpful. The way I use AntennaPod keeps me in the queue most of the time. That is where I play from (thank you for including direct playback from the queue) and organize my listening, so it would be great if I could delete episodes from there also.
Manager.title: Toggle option to have episodes deleted when swiped off the queue.

Manager.description: I tested (months ago) the WiFi Filter. I activated the filter and added my home and work wifi. But I changed my mind and deactivated the filter (home and work remained with an checkmark, but grayed out) . Now I found out the automatic downloads does not work on other wifi than both selected.
Manager.title: Automatic download problem

Manager.description: I use Tiny-Tiny RSS (a.k.a. TT-RSS) to manage my RSS feeds, including podcasts, but I generally prefer to use it as a backend for applications like Liferea on the desktop, which use TT-RSS's API to sync feeds. It'd be great if Antennapod could sync with TT-RSS similarly to the way it works with gpodder.net, with the ability to specify a particular folder/category within the TT-RSS tree as the root for podcasts and have new subscriptions added within Antennapod placed there, read/unread status updated as appropriate, etc. 👍 1
Manager.title: Support syncing with TT-RSS

Manager.description: otherwise prestissimo has no access to files created by AntennaPod This issue is comes to light when media is stored on a filesystem that obeys file permissions. At the moment downloaded files are readable only for AntennaPod UID. If you point me to the right place in code where completed downloads can be processed, I'll supply push request.
Manager.title: make downloaded media files world-readable

Manager.description: I've disabled the mobile updates setting so that downloads will only occur over WiFi. However, I just accidentally downloaded multiple podcasts over the cell network. Similar settings on other applications work properly. Details: I'm running AntennaPod v1.1.1 on CyanogenMod (KitKat).
Manager.title: Mobile Updates setting doesn't work

Manager.description: The player pauses a playing podcasts right at midnight, observed in timezone UTC+1, from May 1st to May 2nd. Manually resuming the player worked fine. Version 1.1.1, via F-Droid, on Nexus 5, Android 5.1
Manager.title: Player pauses at midnight

Manager.description: Would it be possible to get an option to mark episodes of podcasts as new/unlplayed if they get accidentally played. At the moment the only way to reset the play status appears to be to play the podcast, pause it and manually scrub back to the start (00:00 time)
Manager.title: Mark as unplayed

Manager.description: It would be good when viewing the episode list of an individual podcast if there way a way to hide completed/finished episodes hide episodes not downloaded
Manager.title: Hide finished / not downloaded episodes

Manager.description: I would like suggest a new feature that would show the number un-listened to or partially listened to episodes of each posdcast that you are subscribed to. This could be shown in the side menu next to or on top of the Podcast image. Best example of this implementation is doggcatcher here with all podcasts showing unlistened to episodes and "The Month Podcast" also showing the in progress episodes
Manager.title: Show unlistened episode count

Manager.description: At the moment AntennaPod allows you to specify an update interval, x number of hours, if auto update is enable. Could we get an option to specify a time of day that updates happen.
Manager.title: Auto-update at a specific time of day

Manager.description: When the search button is displayed in the toolbar it is sometimes displayed as the word 'search' instead of the search icon (the magnifying glass). This happened on 2.3.7 in the New Episodes view when that view was empty (no new episodes). May occur at other times.
Manager.title: 'Search' displays in toolbar as word and not icon

Manager.description: There appears to be a small issue with the widget that when the current listening episode ends all the information updates for the next podcast except the time. What you get: podcast-new title podcast-old time played / time total In the case of the time played and time total they are the same, eg 30:00 / 30:00 What you should get podcast-new title podcast-new time played / time total In the case of the time played and time total they are the same, eg 00:00 / 30:00
Manager.title: widget incorrectly displays information when podcast episode ends

Manager.description: I would really like to see an option in AntennaPod to be able to set that all episodes older than 'n' days should be deleted. It could either be a sliding scale, or something like "one week", "two weeks", "one month", six months" or "one year". It would of course be even better if you could set this on a per subscribed podcast basis.
Manager.title: Option to set all episodes older than 'n' to be deleted.

Manager.description: It would be great if a could put a quota in GB on the data folder. Therefore, if the storage space of all the downloaded episodes reach over this limit, the oldest ones will be deleted.
Manager.title: Storage quota on data folder

Manager.description: 1.1.2 fixed a problem with the gpodder.net certificate handling for 2.3 devices. We should merge that change in to 1.2. There will likely be a merge conflict when dealing with AndroidManifest.xml and about.html. We should probably just take the version of those files that are in develop.
Manager.title: Merge 1.1.2 change in to develop

Manager.description: The text "Clear Queue" is not localized since 1.1.x release. I know it because I have translated in transifex and it is not shown in app.
Manager.title: Text "Clear queue" not localized

Manager.description: I've installed the latest version 1.1.2 from the PlayStore on both my mobile phone and my tablet and recieve connection errors with some feeds and when trying to connect to gpodder.net over wifi. With gpodder the following error message appears: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: failed to connect to gpodder.net/2605:2700:0:5::4713:9656 (port 443) after 30000ms Many feeds are working fine, but for these I get a similar error message: http://blog.ct.de/ctuplink/ctuplink.rss https://netzpolitik.org/category/netzpolitik-podcast/feed/ http://stimmen.univie.ac.at/feed/mp3 http://www.jungundnaiv-podcast.de/feed/mp3 http://feeds.feedburner.com/sowiradio?format=xml http://chaosradio.ccc.de/chaosradio-latest.rss http://cre.fm/feed/mp3/ The error messages always include IPv6 adresses and read like this failed to connect to cre.fm/2a01:a380:4408:a001::30 (port 80) after 30000ms The error does only occur over wifi. When trying to connect to gpodder or downloading feeds via mobile data connections everything is working fine. The issue also had appeared in the last version by the way. Thanks in advance!
Manager.title: weird connection errors over wifi

Manager.description: I noticed when there is 1 download remaining, the notification still says "1 Downloads Left". Not "1 Download Left". Not a big deal, but thought I would point it out in case nobody had noticed it yet. Love the application! I'm using a Nexus 4 with Android 5.1 in English, but it looks like this is language and version-independent.
Manager.title: Minor UI issue: "1 Downloads Left"

Manager.description: Hi Thanks for this app. It does the job for me except that I am confused about what I have listened and finished. It seems to me that there is no way to differentiate finished, marked as read etc from regular casts. For example I mark one mp3 as read but in the list it does not look any different. I can see that ones I dowloaded have a play icon. But that is the most visible identification that I can tell. I hope it makes sense. thanks
Manager.title: No way to differentiate marked as read?

Manager.description: Hi! I often use Antennapod in my car, that can display the title data send with A2DP. With Antennapod the Artist is missing, also the playtime is not running. There is only a random value for the time.
Manager.title: Missing A2DP data

Manager.description: Hi When I add a url, it brings up the list which is great, butnno dates are shown there which sucks because it is hard to tell if the pcasts are updated recently or not. It would be nice if the dates aare listed there if possible.
Manager.title: Subscribe view: Show publication dates

Manager.description: When downloading an episode from the New Episodes list the download progress bar isn't shown.
Manager.title: Download indicator not show on the New Episodes list

Manager.description: Hi everyone, We're getting ready to release version 1.2 of AntennaPod and would appreciate it if people would take it for a spin. It should show up in the Alpha channel if you're enrolled (https://plus.google.com/communities/117446128636140585144) Otherwise you can download and run it manually here debug or release. Please let us know what you think or if you experience any problems. Thanks!
Manager.title: New Release, 1.2 Needs Testing

Manager.description: When I attempt to import the file linked below the app appears to do nothing with Options 1 and 2 on the import screen. I also attempted sharing the file to AntennaPod and got a message box containing "An error occured:Parser Exception()" https://gist.github.com/CWftw/bf6e36e28360762db5b6
Manager.title: OPML Import not working with Podcast Addict backup

Manager.description: I ran in to a deadlock issue when testing 1.2 build 53 on my HTC One M7 running 5.0.2. It started when playback was getting interrupted by navigation. Some of the interruptions worked and then eventually playback just never resumed. Eventually I hooked it up to adb logcat and was able to see it generate the traces.txt file. The entire time it was locked it was printing lots of these messages: 05-23 16:38:10.624: D/PlayerWidgetService(1653): Service was called while updating. Ignoring update request I think this may be due to this change where the tryLock() was changed to a lock(). Here is a dump of the thread traces
Manager.title: Deadlock during playback in 1.2 alpha

Manager.description: When listening at higher speed than 1x, tail of the clip is being cut off. It's always a small amount of time -- but at a high speed, it's not negligible. Example clip: http://www.npr.org/2015/05/26/409673364/artist-makes-money-off-other-peoples-instagram-photos 1x cuts off the last word 2.3x cuts off last 2 sentences Notes: I listen to podcasts at up to 2.3x speed
Manager.title: End of clip cut off when playing at >1x speed

Manager.description: Currently playing clips are usually OK, but if the next one comes up -- the app frequently stops playing (and often can't start back up) until the BT headset is disconnected. When disconnected, next clip can be played and if BT headset is connected while playing, everything is fine. Notes: Does not stop on every clip transition. Some clips refuse to start playing via BT headset almost 100% of the time (different podcast/filetype??) I usually listen at up to 2.3x speed, but switching down to 1.0 doesn't seem to help much. Possibly unrelated: sometimes "Prestissimo has stopped" error pops up, then the clip starts playing at 1.0x speed (and speed controls become unavailable until playback is paused)
Manager.title: Clips often fail to play when using BT headset

Manager.description: An item that has been deactivated and reactivated download won't be auto-downloaded. How to reproduce this: Wait for an item to be downloading (or delete the download to force it). Cancel download. The app will disable auto-download for the item. Reenable auto-download for the item. Delete next downloaded episodes. Wait for download (or force it, by disabling and reenabling wifi). Expected result: The reenabled item should download Actual result: Following items would be downloaded instead Version. 1.2 build 54.
Manager.title: Reenabling auto-download is not effective

Manager.description: You can see that 'Enable Temporarily' is displayed properly. This occurred on my HTC One M7 with Android 5.0. It was reproducible on a Nexus One emulator running API 21.
Manager.title: 'Confirm Mobile Download' screen sometimes clips options

Manager.description: Here we can only see the first button and we can't scroll to see the other two.
Manager.title: OPML Import Screen doesn't show all options on small screens

Manager.description: New strings have already been submitted to Transifex. Just need to pull the new ones when they're ready and bump the version number.
Manager.title: Update translations for AntennaPod 1.2
