Manager.description: Hello is it possible to set a default podcasts with URL? so instead of asking the user to input the podcast, we already have 2 or 3 podcasts available
Manager.title: default podcast

Manager.description: Running: AntennaPod 1.1.2 on CyanogenMod CM11 M11 and a Galaxy S4. AntennaPod is set up so that podcast episodes must be manually downloaded Issue: If I have at least two new podcast episodes in my download list, downloading the 2nd after the first causing the error unfortunately antennapod has stopped and AntennaPod to restart If I have a number of new episodes, for example 3, available in my queue for downloads. podcast1_e12 podcast2_e05 podcast3_e634 I start to download these new episodes first pressing the download icon for podcast1_e12. The download begins, I then click the download icon for podcast2_e05. As soon as I do this AntennaPod crashes/restarts with error unfortunately antennapod has stopped. The crash is always on the 2nd podcast in the list and no others (largest sample to date is 4). However if I try and download them in any other order than 1, 2, 3 the download works fine. If I do it in any order other than 1, 2, 3 and then cancel all downloads I am then able to download in order 1, 2, 3 with out a crash.
Manager.title: Crash when downloading episodes manually in a particular order

Manager.description: I listened to the podcast Glaubenssache in Februar without problems. Now i can not update the stream. Via Wifi (my DSL ipv6) i had the error "gzip finished without exhausting source", with UMTS i had "failed to connect to... after 30000 ms". What ever. For testing i deleted the podcast and tried to readd it: Now i have "gzip finished without exhausting source" with both network connections via iTunes search and the timeout for this direct feed: http://glaubenssache.info/feed/mp3/

Manager.description: I see this issue in the French locale, not sure if this plays in other locales. Everything work, but I can't forward any episode. When I use the forward button the episode jumps to the beginning. Same is happening when I type on any position of the track (line). A delete and afterwards resubscribe doesn't have any difference. It's not working. Device: GT-I9505 (Samsung Galaxy S4) Software: CyanogenMod 12.1 Android: 5.1.1 AndennaPod: 1.1.2 EDIT Streaming of an episode works. The issue appears only with downloaded episodes.
Manager.title: Fast forward not working

Here's what alogcat found for the query "json": W/System.err( 3998): org.json.JSONException: Value {} at update_urls of type org.json.JSONObject cannot be converted to JSONArray W/System.err( 3998): at org.json.JSON.typeMismatch(JSON.java:100) W/System.err( 3998): at org.json.JSONObject.getJSONArray(JSONObject.java:548) W/System.err( 3998): iL: org.json.JSONException: Value {} at update_urls of type org.json.JSONObject cannot be converted to JSONArray W/System.err( 3998): Caused by: org.json.JSONException: Value {} at update_urls of type org.json.JSONObject cannot be converted to JSONArray W/System.err( 3998): at org.json.JSON.typeMismatch(JSON.java:100) W/System.err( 3998): at org.json.JSONObject.getJSONArray(JSONObject.java:548)

Manager.description: Hi Will there ever be the capability to play an episode from the main list of a selected podcast after completion it automatically goes to the next episode without having to add items to the queue? I have reviewed your app and fee this is one important feature missing.
Manager.title: Continuous play on main list

Manager.description: It would be useful to see, artist, bitrate etc. (edit: title is already displayed in action bar). I think it could be added to the bottom of the description so that the UI for playing podcasts and playing back other media files would be similar. Or, bury it behind the overflow menu, but in this case white screen is often wasted.
Manager.title: Display id3 tag info

Manager.description: Hi, I have only recently begun to experiment with AntennaPod, but I like it so far. This is more of a question than a bug report maybe. I'm wondering about the skip button and the auto delete behavior. I am on the Google play version 1.1.2 and I download episodes manually so far. I understand that there's a cache where episodes go after I listened to them and the oldest gets deleted from there once it's full. Or do all episodes go there once I download them and they delete no matter whether I ever listened to them? Is there a way to list all episodes that I have currently downloaded? Does the cache only work with auto-downloading? The auto-delete after playback option is in addition to the cache, isn't it? #111 talks about a skip button in relation to auto-deleting. This is exactly the behavior that I am looking for. However, the skip button is just not there on my phone. Or I cannot spot it :) The notification area only shows play / pause. What's the easiest way to get to the next episode? Kind regards, Matthias Kauer
Manager.title: Cache and deletion questions, skip button in player missing

Manager.description: When trying to visit the following mistyped link of the current TWIT episode, AntennaPod crashes: htatp://twit.tv/twit/514 Sorry for sleazy bug report, but it's clear I think.
Manager.title: Link with typo crashes Antennapod

Manager.description: Now that 1.2 is released it's time to start thinking about 1.3. There have been some suggestions for major UI improvements. Some visible, some under the covers. I think it would make sense to think through all the GUI related features and changes we want and try to make them all work well together. Some thoughts on improvements: Material design overhaul Use of RecyclerView in place of DSLV New subscription view (#848, #836) Better sharing of episodes (#861) Display of itunes 'explicit' tags (#724) Filtering by itunes 'explicit' tags (#725) Support for multiple queues I don't think this will happen in 1.3 Improve visibility of adding podcasts via iTunes - Done This is really the easiest way of adding podcasts Perhaps making it the first option users see and only labeling it 'search'? Download all episodes from a feed (#871, #520) Episode forward/back (#732) I bet there are some other good thoughts on what could be done. We should think hard about any changes to how we interact with the app, how these features would change them and how they could all work together.
Manager.title: Any ideas for AntennaPod 1.3?

Manager.description: Hi Is it possible to get the Fdroid version to the latest one? I do not have access to Gplay. thanks
Manager.title: Fdroid store update?

Manager.description: On my Nexus 4 and 7 (both running Cyanogenmod 12.1 nightly) I've noticed that downloading of feeds and episodes causes unusual high memory usage. It's increasing with the number of downloads in parallel but the used memory is not assigned to AntennaPod itself but seems to be used by the android system. While "system" is used to use around 300 MB on my Nexus 7 when idle, it's increasing to 750 MB while downloading 3 episodes and to more than 1.1 GB when downloading 10. Sometimes the used system memory stays at 800 MB, even after the downloads are finished and AntennaPod was killed using a task killer. I could reproduce this behaviour after reinstalling (only imported my previously created OPML file). In Version 1.1.2 the memory usage is perfectly normal so I'm now back on this version.
Manager.title: Huge memory usage on AntennaPod 1.2

Manager.description: HI It would be great if there is http/socks proxy support for downloads and streaming. thanks
Manager.title: Proxy support

If I add a new feed it works with the picture and all (see the empire podcast above). Is there a way to manually update the pictures or what do I have to do? Thanks
Manager.title: Feed-pictures not displayed after restore from gpodder

Manager.description: Hi, I'm no contributer to AntennaPod, but simply a single user observing some issues with the newest version of AntennaPod. The update was done automatically within my Wiko Rainbow (Android 4.4.2) at 16.06. First of all thank you for this marvellous piece of software. I'm that glad to have it as no other podcast-player on Android is that simple, minimalistic, stable and focused. With the newest update from 16.06.2015 I observe a significant delay in displaying the episodes-lists, the played list, the podcasts themselves, etc. The feature showing the unlistened episodes on the right side of the podcasts is great, however it looks like all the changes have changed the speed of the application overall. Showing the playing list with 321 entries needs more than 20 seconds. Potentially a problem with the length of the list as after deletion of the playing list things are fine again. However adding a podcast-episode to the playing list by using the context menu lasts ~10-15 seconds. Opening a podcast-overview lasts 2-3 seconds. That's definitely longer than before. Not dramatic, but new. But the most significant problem I observed first today having no internet connection at all. I have downloaded all the episodes and placed them in the playing list. Opening the playing list lasted approx. 40-50 seconds. Jumping back and opening one of the podcasts directly was not possible, no episodes were displayed. From my perspective AntennaPod seems to unusable if there's no internet connection even the episodes are downloaded. I could not observe this behaviour with the previously installed version. Perhaps you can use these details for further improvement. With a heavy heart I will have to search for another podcast-player. Ciao, Georg
Manager.title: Some remarks on the version released on 16.06.2015 (performance issues)

Manager.description: Hi it would be nice when we share the url or the podcast if the all the data sent to other apps properly. now no show name podcastname etc us listed. It can be similar to how browsers passes data to other apps.
Manager.title: Share website url comes out as share url

Manager.description: Hi A rating sytem for individual casts would be nice, so we can rate them for further use. Thanks
Manager.title: FR: Rating

Manager.description: Moto G 4G Android 5.1/4.4.4 AntennaPod: 1.2 23 Podcasts on external SD class 10 After the upgrade to AntennaPod 1.2 loading the different Views like "all episodes" take quite long (20 sec). It only happens if you switch between different views. Switching from App to Home Screen doesn't force it to reload. I didn't have this problem with 1.x. Loading times were way shorter.
Manager.title: Slow loading of views in 1.2

Manager.description: I'm getting errors with gpoddr frequently, "org.json.JSONException: Value {} of type org.json.JSONObject cannot be converted to JSONArray" Specs, Motorola Moto X, Android 4.4.2 Antennapod 1.2 (Google play)
Manager.title: Gpoddr json Errors

Manager.description: Hi I realize AntennaPod is geared towards audio but would not hurt is audio streaming from a video streaming is possible with it. Basicaly it will just play audio from a video stream if possible. The reason I am bringing it up because it might be cheaper from the batter usage perspective maybe?
Manager.title: Audio from video streaming ?

Manager.description: The per podcast new episode count shown in the side menu doesn't go down/ disappear after downloading the new episodes, whereas it does for the all new episodes count on the New Episodes button. Edit: This issue should be labelled as bug, but I can't for the life of me find where to do so. Edit 2: This not-disappearing-of-counts started in I think version 1.2, and it hasn't fixed the existing miscounts in updating to 1.2.1, but I don't know yet if it still miscounts in 1.2.1.
Manager.title: New episode count for each podcasts remains after downloading

Manager.description: In the side menu, there are buttons for the Queue, all the individual podcast subscriptions and the settings, among other things. Through some voodoo witchcraft navigation, it is possible to be in the window of a subscription, and when clicking on the Queue button, not going to the Queue instead staying in that subscription. I don't have a consistent way of arriving at this yet, but these are the approximate steps: Start at Queue Go to a subscription's page ???. Navigate to some pages that have back arrows in the top left Also, use the android back button not the app's one At some point, use the home screen to go to the android home page, and relaunch the app using the app icon Through some combination of the ??? above, you end up at the subscription's page but clicking the Queue button won't take you to the Queue, leaving you stuck at the subscription's page until you go to New Episodes or something like that
Manager.title: Menu navigation Queue button doesn't always open Queue

Manager.description: In previous versions, the podcast icon seemed to always be scaled up to the full width of the phone when in 'playback view' (where you only really see the podcast you're playing and have all the playback controls). Now, some podcasts have really small icons in the middle, which I suppose means they aren't high-res enough to fill the entire screen. If this was a deliberate choice so be it, but I preferred it the old way so here's hoping it's accidental :)
Manager.title: Podcast icon in playback view really small

Manager.description: I like the long pressing on Queue, New Episodes, etc. to add/remove those to the nav drawer. I think the same long press should do something for the subscriptions, like giving you a menu to unsubscribe.
Manager.title: Long press context menu on subscriptions

Manager.description: When you go to a podcast subscription from the navigation drawer, and tap the little 'i' thing you get a page with information about the subscription. Among other things, it has the URL of the feed. This URL if longer than the width of the area for it, won't continue on the next line and instead just disappear off screen.
Manager.title: Podcast URL in info window partially off screen

Manager.description: When the podcast at the bottom of the Queue finishes playing, a message appears at the bottom saying "Item Removed Undo" where pressing the Undo returns the podcast to the Queue. This only happens for the bottom Queue item, perhaps because for the others there is always a bar with play button for the next episode at the bottom. Either this message should be removed entirely, or appear consistently at the end of every podcast, right now it seems like a built-in feature accidentally left on. How to replicate: Add podcast to Queue Play it Go to playback controls and drag time to end of podcast AP goes back to Queue and shows "Item Removed" message.
Manager.title: Item Removed / Undo message at end of last podcast in Queue

Manager.description: If you play a podcast in the Queue and the next item in the Queue is not downloaded, when the playback ends the playback controls view doesn't go away if it was open, instead just showing playback controls that don't do anything and no cover. Furthermore, the bottom Now Playing/Play-pause bar shows the episode that just finished with the pause button. How to replicate: Put downloaded podcast in Queue Put not downloaded podcast in Queue right below the previous one Play first podcast Go to playback controls and drag playback timer to end of file Playback controls are blank (problem part 1) Go back to Queue Bottom bar shows just finished podcast (problem part 2)
Manager.title: Misbehaviour at end of playback when next in Queue is undownloaded

Manager.description: The most recent release of AntennaPod seems to have a bug that has been fixed. Last December I reported incorrect dates on a podcast in issue #545, this was fixed correctly when the issue was closed. With the newest release I am seen the exact same failure mode as was reported in that issue. From that issue: It is the podcast for "Richard Herring's Leicester Square Theatre Podcast". Every time I add the feed it thinks every podcast is today. The next day when I updated the feed it increments the day and shows every podcast as today.
Manager.title: Unable to interpret correct dates on a podcast #3

Manager.description: Often use this app while driving and have my phone mounted on the dash. Play / pause, forward, rewind controls however are small and hard to access use while in this view. Propose that while in the episode player view have a slide up gesture added to the bottom control bar so that it makes that control bar take up 50-60% of the screen and finger swipe down to make back to normal.
Manager.title: Car view

Manager.description: Now that AntennaPod isn't being maintained by @danieloeh any longer and a team of people are working on it, Daniel, mentioned that he felt we should change who the Flattr money goes to. After discussing with Daniel and @mfietz we decided that we should remove the ability to flattr the app. The reason being that since the team is split up, there's no one person who the money should go to. At the moment we have no expenses (apart from time). So there really isn't a great way to deal with the revenue Flattr was providing. We are, of course, very pleased that people like the app enough to donate. We just don't know how to deal with those funds justly, and as a result felt it would be better to remove the ability to Flattr AntennaPod directly. This should resolve #507 and #567 as we just won't support accepting money any longer. If people have a better idea of what to do, please share it here.
Manager.title: Remove button to Flattr AntennaPod

Manager.description: AP keeps resurrecting (downloading and adding to the queue) episodes I have listened to. The resurrected episodes get added as new ones come out in the same feed. At one point the queue was completely empty, the next day I had the new episodes released that day, plus the previous one for each of those feeds. I have auto refresh on every 4th hour, along with autodowload/queue. When long-pressing on the episodes I have the option to mark them as unplayed, so I'm assuming AP remembers I've listened to them, or marked them as played/skipped (difference?) before. Marking then as unplayed gives me the option to play them. All the files exist on the device and I can play them immediately and I don't have the option to stream them. When I notice this, I have to go into each episode, tap to remove the file, wait for the file to be removed, tap to remove it from the queue, back out, wait a while until the episode disappears from the queue (takes several seconds, if it even works), and hope they don't come back again. Sorting the queue while doing this can get really interesting as it randomly ressurrects episodes I just removed too. I have a Samsung S3 GT-I9300 with Cyanogenmod 12.1 and I'm currently in the alpha/beta program.
Manager.title: Episode necromancy

Manager.description: Feed address: http://trip.since1989.org/feed/podcast/ AntennaPod:1.2.1
Manager.title: Feed picture not displayed

Manager.description: I had 5 episodes sitting in "New Episodes" that were not downloaded automatically no matter how often i hit the refresh/download button. Autodownload was activated in settings and for all respective podcasts. Downloading each individual episode manually one after the other worked. This problem started for me with the update to version 1.2.1 yesterday using Google Play store. Samsung S3 Neo (I9301l), Android 4.4.2
Manager.title: Occasionally autodownload does not work in v1.2.1

Manager.description: Using Lollipop (5.1.1) on a Nexus 4. I encounter the following issue: When I change the time settings for rewind and/or forward, the settings aren't saved. If I use another app or even go into another part of AntennaPod and go back the buttons are back to the default setting (30s).
Manager.title: Rewind / Fast forward settings aren't remembered after the first launch

Manager.description: Hi If I wanted to implement continuous playback by default - NOT VIA THE QUEUE. User selects the latest podcast and plays it, when done it moves to the next item what would be the easiest way to do this? We are creating an App with one podcast preloaded and preventing adding further. Adding to the queue does not make sense due to the nature of the audio, where some are 30 seconds and goes to the next item. Forcing the user to put audio into a queue would have to be repeated each time they used the app. So, on playing the latest it should move to the next item downwards. Any ideas?
Manager.title: Question regarding continous playback

Manager.description: Updated from 1.1.1 to 1.2.1 and feeds take ages (minutes or not at all) to update. Logcat is spammed with 'timezone name loaded for en_US in 347Ms ' or similar. I'm using CM7.2 without Gapps and not that locale.
Manager.title: Feed is slow to update

Manager.description: Hi I think that it is very beneficial if we can pause and resume downloads. For instance I sometimes start some downloads and I realize that the downloads and slow and I might be in a hurry etc. At that point my only option is to cancel the downloads. thanks
Manager.title: Pause downloads

Manager.description: Hi This is a feature request for being able to play episodes with external apps that are installed on the system. For example my preferred player is Aimp for offline media. This kind of media passing is pretty common in other apps like file managers, media managers etc. I do not mean to recommend a replacement replacement player, I am merely asking as a way to "share" the location of the media on the disk to another local player when the user wants. thanks
Manager.title: Play with another app

Manager.description: Hi It would be nice if we are able to delete episodes right from the list views intsead of gong into the details of the episodes and do it that way. It is a bit convoluted to do it that way if you will.
Manager.title: Deleting episodes from the queue menu

Manager.description: Hi I explained what happened with #951. Now I reversed back to the original path to get my episode order properly. Well problems do not stop there. I am missing all the icons. I even deleted the images and refreshed APod(which redownloaded all the images), however that does not seem to help with gaining icons back. No shows no episodes have icons.
Manager.title: Icons missing

Manager.description: I just visited https://twit.tv/shows/all-about-android and clicked "Subscribe to Video" which opened a sidebar on the right. Under "choose a provider" I selected "other podcast clients (pcast:// compatible)" and then clicked "subscribe" and Firefox notified me "couldn't find an app to open this link".
Manager.title: support pcast URIs

Manager.description: AntennaPod crashes shortly (less than a second) after starting to play a downloaded file or a stream. I tried various Podcasts with the same result. Please inform me if you need more informations. Phone: Huawei P8 lite Android 5.0 EMUI 3.1 Log: https://gist.github.com/kentrockman/54c81566727b3a6595d2
Manager.title: Apod crashes when start playing a pcast on Huawei P8 lite

Manager.description: Whenever I play video podcasts, AntennaPod rotates video to clockwise landscape only. There should be portrait and anti-clockwise landscape too. AntennaPod doesn't follow system-wide or sensor-based orientation. Currently using a device with stock Lollipop.
Manager.title: AntennaPod rotates video to clockwise landscape only

Manager.description: Since my Moto X (1st Gen) finally got its update to Android 5.1 (first Android 5.x for this device) I do not have the media controls on my wearable Moto360 that I had when my phone was running Kitkat. In fact I see nothing of AntennaPod on my watch. The missing controls on my wearable are Play/Pause and Volume control. This might has something to do with the new MediaSession API.
Manager.title: Wear: No media controls after Lolipop update

Manager.description: I believe this is caused by a race condition. The item is removed from the list before getItem is called. We could solve this by just checking the index in getItem before returning, but that could still cause a race condition. Better would be to see if we should be operating on a copy of the list, synchronizing access to it somehow, or using a better method of identifying downloads. java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Manager.description: The course of events is somewhat complicated, so here is everything in chronological order: My phone is an LG Optimus G (e975), running Cyanogenmod. This device has no sd card slot, external storage is emulated at /storage/emulated/0. It was running Cyanogenmod 11 (Android 4.4 iirc) and AntennaPod 1.1.2. I didn't encounter any of the issues below then. As CM 12 became available I upgraded to that version, upgrading the Google Apps in the process. Soon later I noticed AntennaPod wasn't updating feeds properly, a new episode wasn't shown even after manual refresh, though it was clearly in the feed. Using paged feeds also didn't work, the "v" button was shown, but pressing it yielded no results after loading was done. I noticed AntennaPod's version on F-Droid (1.1.2) was outdated, so I reinstalled 1.2 from Google Play. Starting AntennaPod results in the error: No external storage is available . Please make sure that external storage is mounted so that the app can work proplerly. Rebooting, removing cache and data, reinstalling, disabling PrivacyGuard didn't fix it. Best part: Reinstalling 1.1.2 from F-Droid now also yields the “No external storage is available” message. Despite all this, it's nice to see the latest progress!
Manager.title: "No external storage is available" on Cyanogenmod 12 / Lollipop (LG Optimus G)

Manager.description: We do this same sort of thing elsewhere (calling getActivity() from the callback). So, we should be sure to apply the fix elsewhere as well. Manager.description: Hello, I previously opened #796 requesting the addition of an uplayed count in the Nav bar which was added. However there were some strange UX choices added which I'd like to see if they can be changed. Prior to this feature being added, the podcast list in the navbar was sorted alphabetically, these was optimal as you always knew where a particular podcast was in the list. Once the unplayed count was added to the navbar it appears to have changed the sort order of the podcasts. This looks to be sorted now as 1) most unlistened, then 2) alphabetically. This gives a terrible user experience as you have to pay a lot more attention to the list as there is guarantee a podcast will be listed where you expect it. Can this be changed back to just doing it alphabetically while keeping the unplayed count?
Manager.title: Nav bar unplayed count UX confusion

Manager.description: How to reproduce: Settings -> Add podcast -> Import OPML String "Option 1/2/3 " isn´t localized. PS: How does option 3 work? Option 1/2 have an button with a text but option 3 doesn´t.
Manager.title: Untranslated string "Option"

Manager.description: I subscribed to some podcasts that do have their icons embedded in the episodes (e.g. http://www.wrint.de/feed/podcast/). Since the latest update (version 1.2.1, build 58) those episode images stopped working. :(
Manager.title: Episodes of podcasts with per-episode icons have no icon at all

Manager.description: The "New episodes" window seems redundant, why not just add them to the queue?
Manager.title: New episodes screen is redundant

Manager.description: Not sure if this would be the right place to discuss this, but is it possible that some developers take over the "AntennaPodSP" (https://github.com/danieloeh/AntennaPodSP) and update that version as well? I see that AntennaPod is updated frequently which is very good, but the other is almost one year without any update and there is no response from the original developer who forked the project. thanks
Manager.title: Taking over the AntennaPodSP

Manager.description: As discussed in #441 The feeds were changed from alphabetical to number of unplayed episodes. Is it possible to make it an option? The two ways I use antennapod are affected by this: Listening to podcasts on demand: me or a friend have a specific feed that we want to listen to, so we want to pull up the feed, see if there are any new episodes or old episodes that we haven't listened to. Queuing up a small percentage of subscribed podcasts. I know some other people personally who are the same way. Detail from my previous post: I have a limited amount of time available to listen to podcasts compared to the amount of subjects and podcasts I'm interested in. Most of my feeds have a large amount of unplayed new episodes, but that tag is still useful to me: Subscribe to a large list of podcasts of various subjects (from educational to comedy to career-specific) Select a small amount of feeds to auto-download Add specific episodes to the queue (or for direct streaming) via description Let queue auto-download when on wifi Step 3 is of course what is affected by this: "New Episodes" tab mixes all the topics together low-frequency feeds can get lost amongst higher-frequency feeds. Static alphabetical view of podcast feeds allows quick access by subject or feed tagging may work as well as I saw in another thread, but one feed may be lighthearted or heavy on the same subject, where selecting individual feeds is still useful to me Unplayed tag still useful (in case marking all as read sorts it alphabetically) old unplayed podcasts are useful if I've exhausted my queue for that subject I'm open to suggestions in a better process for the same use case with the update. As the setting depends on your use case (which doesn't usually change), it should not be on the main UI, but rather somewhere in the settings, where I personally don't think it would be considered clutter.
Manager.title: Option to sort feeds alphabetically

Manager.description: Imagine you drive in your car and hear some interesting things in a podcast that you like to google later, because you want to read more background information to a specific part of the episode that were not provided in the podcast itself. I would love to have a button which will create an entry with the playback time and the name of the podcast-episode which was played. This would give me the possibility to hear the minutes around the "bookmarks" again after I arrived at home.
Manager.title: Make it possible to "bookmark" specific parts of a podcast-episode

Manager.description: As you can see from the screenshot, quite a few episodes say "0 B" instead of their actual weight. The screenshot was taken some time ago, but right now I'm using v 1.2.1, Build 58 from F-droid and seeing it on episodes from Freakonomics Radio, TED Radio Hour and Note to self (previously New Tech City). I do not see it on the one episode of Planet Money that I have downloaded right now, even though the episode I had when I took the screenshot was affected. I don't know why there's a difference.
Manager.title: Some downloaded episodes say they weigh "0 B"

Manager.description: When you're looking at the info for an episode and press the Download button, the progress bar pushes the buttons down, as you can see here: It would be a lot better if the progress bar showed up bellow the buttons, so that they're not moved. Two more things: Should the Stream button still be there after you've started the download? The Cancel download icon is missing a piece on the left side.
Manager.title: Please don't move the "(Cancel) download" and "Stream" buttons

Manager.description: In the Add podcast screen, I cannot paste an URL copied from my browser. It'd be nice to to have to retype it.
Manager.title: Paste URL to add new podcast

Manager.description: Whenever I press play, Antennapod raises the media volume by one level. Might be related to #313 Using v1.2.1
Manager.title: Volume incremented on play.

Manager.description: Hi We have around 65 feeds and I was looking at having an android developer fork your code and then pre-load, if so what would be the best way for him/her to do this? The reason I want this is, is so they can keep up to date with your feature set and merge them into our version. I don't want them to make any enhancements or anything. Note, we will NOT be selling the app. Kind Regards
Manager.title: Question - Regarding preloading feeds

Manager.description: Hi! There are problems when a video episode ends. The episode ends and gets deleted (if configured). But the next episode in the playlist is not being played after that. Pressing play for the next episode has no effect. Only killing and restarting the app helps. Playing the playlist should be continuous, no matter if video or audio. It seems there are some problems returning from the video player, as it pauses only when a video episode ends.
Manager.title: Hangup after video episodes

Manager.description: Some hiccups when trying to load the fragment in use before the app was stopped, e.g. pressing the download button in an episode's view often causes erroneous loading. Additionally (the former issue has already been fixed locally), I will try to restore the audio/video player activity.
Manager.title: Incorrect loading of a former session's fragment

Manager.description: With the latest version (1.2.1) I do have some playback problems which result in an error-message. This happens out of thin air when podcasts from opus feed are played. Especially when using chapter-marks or fast-forward to jump to a specific part in the podcast. I observed this with the following podcast: http://feeds.feedburner.com/freakshow/opus http://www.staatsbuergerkunde-podcast.de/feed/opus-rss/ To use AntennaPod again I have to force stop it. I'm using CM12.1 Nightlies on an OnePlus One.
Manager.title: App freezes when playing OPUS

Manager.description: Hi, for the past two episodes, I had to delete the feed and re-subscribe it to get the new episode. http://logbuch-netzpolitik.de/abonnieren
Manager.title: Logbuch Netzpolitik does not update

Manager.description: All items in the "recently listened" view are grey. I guess grey text implies that the episode is not new and the user listened to it. The problem is with the dark theme the contrast of grey text on dark grey background is a bit low. And it does not make any sense to indicated if something was listened in a view that implies that all its elements aren't new.
Manager.title: Grey text in "recently listened"

Manager.description: I geht an error when I add my device to gpodder. I choose an existing device. I choose sync now. All feeds seem to be synced but I get the notification: gpodder.net sync error - An error occurred during syncing: org.json.JSONE... U found this in the log: 07-13 13:11:07.738 W/System.err(30181): de.danoeh.antennapod.core.gpoddernet.GpodnetServiceException: org.json.JSONException: Value {} at update_urls of type org.json.JSONObject cannot be converted to JSONArray
Manager.title: gpodder.net sync error

Manager.description: I would suggest a change: On manual feed update AND episodes are ready to download AND on battery AND "Download when not charging" prefs is NOT set Antennapod should ask the user: New episode could be downloaded, but you are on battery. [download], [download always], [no] I tend to forget the reason why the download is not performed, so a manual update should override the prefs or inform me about this situation.
Manager.title: overide "downloading on battery" for manual updates

Manager.description: Hi The current search results page is in thumbnails views which is fine but most of the time the titles and names etc are cutoff which makes it hard to see what the podcast is about. Sometimes the icons for the podcasts are generic which makes it harder to recognize what is going on. This might not be an issue with searches with couple results but when the search results return tens of results it makes it a tedious job to go into the details one by one to see what the podcast is about. thanks
Manager.title: FR: Detailed list view for Gpodder and Itunes search page

Manager.description: When I miss a word or two it often annoys me that I have to rewind by 30 seconds and listen again to what I've just heard. In other apps I figured that 15 second would the best fit for me (and when I feel like I missed more than a word I can rewind twice.) Can you please add an option to adjust the delta time to skip?
Manager.title: Feature request: Option to set seconds to skip/rewind

Manager.description: From the screen of an individual episode, the Queue button in the drawer no longer works. Pressing the Queue button simply leaves me on the same screen. There appear to be other contexts in which the Queue button also doesn't work, but I can't reproduce them as reliably. Running v1.2.1 on Android 4.4.2 (CM11 on Nexus 5). Episode screen: Pressing Queue here does nothing (leaves me on same screen):
Manager.title: Queue button in drawer doesn't work reliably in v1.2.1

Manager.description: An option to change playback speed to a lower (when listening to foreign language or otherwise difficult podcasts) or higher (easy listening) setting would be very appreciated. This could probably be integrated in the interface by adding a button on the right of the playback controls in the player view, which would trigger a pop-up menu with available speeds, Youtube-style, or a separate pop-up with a slider. However, a brief search reveals that the Android API by default does not include a functionality to change playback speed. See this Android issue and also this SO question. So this FR will probably have to sit here for quite a while, unless someone decides to re-implement variable playback rate, or Google suddenly releases an update. I might have been mistaken though, as I am poorly familiar with the details of Android development, so someone should look into whether this is actually impossible with the current API.
Manager.title: Feature request: an option to change playback speed

Manager.description: (Please advise where you would prefer I post requests for information if this is the wrong place) It seems strange to call it "All Episodes" when it specifically does not show all episodes. What is the reason for this? I want to update the All Episodes fragment to show all the episodes in a feed. It seems relatively simple - just change the value of RECENT_EPISODES_LIMIT to a large number. Are there concerns I should know about when doing this? It must have been set at some point for a reason, but I can't find reference in the code about it.
Manager.title: RFI - AllEpisodesFragment only showing some episodes

Manager.description: When subscribing to a new feed, only the first episode of the feed gets marked as "new". This is apparent with only 1 item on the New episodes list, and only the top item of the All episodes list as well as the feed list showing "NEW". Is there background on this, or another issue already logged? I was unable to find a duplicate. Fixing this is on the backlog for my customer so I should be able to feed that up onto this repo at some point.
Manager.title: New episodes only shows a single item when downloading a feed

Manager.description: For some reason I cannot get AntennaPod to load the second to nth page of the following feeds: http://feeds.feedburner.com/mobile-macs-podcast http://cre.fm/feed/mp3 http://logbuch-netzpolitik.de/feed/mp3 http://newz-of-the-world.com/feed/mp3 When I press on the next page button for the first time after opening a feed list, the UI jumps to the top of the list, when I press the button a second time, the UI just briefly shows the loading circle and then nothing happens. Please have a look at this issue because it is rather annoying not to be able to listen to podcast episodes which were published before a certain date.
Manager.title: Cannot load next page for paged feeds

Manager.description: I cannot change tabs of the AntennaPod UI from a feed's episode list to my queue without first switching to e.g. the all episodes list. Using a Nexus 5 with CyanogenMod 12.1-Nightly
Manager.title: Cannot change to Queue View directly from a Feed's Episode List

Manager.description: I noticed that the folder "files/images" in the directory of AntennaPod was about 1,5 GB with over 2000 files. Is this normal? I have about 100 different podcast feeds and about 70 items (about 1 GB) in my queue at the moment. I deleted the folder because I was running out of space, but after updating the podcast feeds in the last several days only a few podcasts have regained their pictures. Is there a way to reload all pictures? I use Cyanogenmod 7 (I think) with Android 2.3.7 and have the newest version of AntennaPod.
Manager.title: Reload podcast images

Manager.description: When going to a podcast feed and then doing anything from downloading an episode, marking it as unplayed, or simply going out of antennapod with the home button and then going back to it through the view-all-open-apps button, it resets the scroll position to the top. It only does this once for each time you open a feed view. Replication steps: Go to a podcast feed view Scroll down Start downloading an episode Result: feed view seems to reload, and snap back to the top Optional extra steps: Scroll down again Download other episode Result: now feed view doesn't snap back to top anymore Alternates for step 3: "alt-tabbing" out of antennapod and back in, marking episode as unplayed
Manager.title: Scroll position not maintained on first action in feed view

Manager.description: Removing an episode is sometimes not very permanent. For example, explicitly removing an episode that is in the queue, and then hitting refresh on the queue will immediately download the episode again. My gut feeling is that an explicit request to remove an episode should be permanent until an explicit request to reverse that state, which I believe is achieved by automatically marking as no auto download. Version 1.2.1 build 58.
Manager.title: Removing episode probably should also disable auto-download on that episode

Manager.description: A user on Transifex requested Norwegian (no) support. Add support in the codebase for that language.
Manager.title: Add Norwegian Language Support

Manager.description: On previous installed version I had auto download enabled in settings (disabled for three feeds), no WiFi filtering. After installing the alfa I at first didn't change any settings, two days later I hadn't received any new podcasts (at this time I didn't check if any new episodes where available, but given the release schedule of my subscriptions there should have been some) so I went into the settings and checked to see if automatic download was still enabled, it was, I also set a download time (2 am). Today, two days later, I still hadn't gotten any new episodes so I went into each podcast feed (from the sidebar) and refreshed the feeds. It found 12 new episodes and the automatic download started.
Manager.title: Autodownload doesn't refresh feeds automatically (Alpha)

Manager.description: I had added raumzeit podcast from Tim pritlove yesterday while on mobile. Removed the auto download directly after adding. Now (>30h after disabling) Antennapod fetched the newest episode. I don't think I was at wifi before. But why did that happen? Was it in a queue from adding the feed and waiting for wifi? I am not sure if this is related to #1009
Manager.title: episode was downloaded even after disabling auto download

No known way to replicate - it's a one-off so far. Bog-standard concurrency bug. 1.3 Alpha release, but I'm not sure exactly which one, some version before rc4. 08-03 08:08:56.480 W/dalvikvm(26973): threadid=44: thread exiting with uncaught exception (group=0x411202a0) 08-03 08:08:56.480 W/System.err(26973): java.lang.InterruptedException 08-03 08:08:56.480 W/System.err(26973): at java.lang.VMThread.sleep(Native Method) 08-03 08:08:56.480 W/System.err(26973): at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Thread.java:1031) 08-03 08:08:56.480 W/System.err(26973): at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Thread.java:1013) 08-03 08:08:56.480 W/System.err(26973): at de.danoeh.antennapod.core.service.GpodnetSyncService$WaiterThread$1.run(GpodnetSyncService.java:353) 08-03 08:08:56.485 E/AndroidRuntime(26973): FATAL EXCEPTION: Thread-1271 08-03 08:08:56.485 E/AndroidRuntime(26973): java.util.ConcurrentModificationException 08-03 08:08:56.485 E/AndroidRuntime(26973): at java.util.ArrayList$ArrayListIterator.next(ArrayList.java:569) 08-03 08:08:56.485 E/AndroidRuntime(26973): at java.util.Collections$UnmodifiableCollection$1.next(Collections.java:960) 08-03 08:08:56.485 E/AndroidRuntime(26973): at de.danoeh.antennapod.core.gpoddernet.GpodnetService.uploadEpisodeActions(GpodnetService.java:491) 08-03 08:08:56.485 E/AndroidRuntime(26973): at de.danoeh.antennapod.core.service.GpodnetSyncService.syncEpisodeActions(GpodnetSyncService.java:208) 08-03 08:08:56.485 E/AndroidRuntime(26973): at de.danoeh.antennapod.core.service.GpodnetSyncService.sync(GpodnetSyncService.java:120) 08-03 08:08:56.485 E/AndroidRuntime(26973): at de.danoeh.antennapod.core.service.GpodnetSyncService.access$100(GpodnetSyncService.java:45) 08-03 08:08:56.485 E/AndroidRuntime(26973): at de.danoeh.antennapod.core.service.GpodnetSyncService$1.onWaitCompleted(GpodnetSyncService.java:323) 08-03 08:08:56.485 E/AndroidRuntime(26973): at de.danoeh.antennapod.core.service.GpodnetSyncService$WaiterThread$1.run(GpodnetSyncService.java:359)

Manager.description: With v1.2.2 I am noticing that apparently random old episodes, marked as played, are being auto-downloaded and added to the Queue.
Manager.title: Episodes marked as PLAYED are returning?

Manager.description: There's been some confusion recently about when things get auto downloaded and when they get cleaned up. Part of this is from actual bugs and part of it is because the functionality is just plain confusing. The problem is that changing the behavior may break some users' workflows. Some might say that those users' workflows should be broken, but it's probably wiser to find a solution that can make everyone happy. To do that I'd like to propose a new workflow that will likely become the default, but give users the choice to retain the old one. AutoDownload and Queuing AutoDownload will download and add to the queue all items which are 'New' and have auto-download enabled (e.g. it will still support disabling downloads for individual feeds). It currently downloads any unread items. An item is new if it hasn't been acted on in some way. All new items show up in 'New Episodes' currently. This essentially makes New Episodes the list of items that will be downloaded the next time auto download is activated. While we think we have #1009 under control with the auto-download flag, this change would certainly have helped with it too. Cleanup Cleanup will consider any item that isn't currently in the queue as eligible for deletion. Currently an item has to be fully played and not in the queue for it to be deleted. Items won't get deleted immediately, but the next time AntennaPod needs space it will remove items that aren't queued. This will resolve the problem of having new items but them not being downloaded because you simply removed an item you didn't care about from the queue. Currently to make room for an item you have to mark the item as read and remove it from the queue, or go to 'Downloads' and remove it there. Which is more complicated than needs to be. This change to cleanup should resolve #939, #699. Enhancements Some users like to keep episodes after they've already listened to them. We could add (either now or as a future enhancement) a 'Favorites' capability (something that's been requested a number of other times). Items that are 'favorited' won't be deleted by the cleanup algorithm. (#538, wouldn't quite be as full featured as #851, but that would be more complicated to handle from a 'don't delete this' standpoint and take more time to implement) We might want to update what makes an item appear new. With this system an item added to the queue will never be new. A user might want to be able to see what new things have been downloaded and added the queue. Not sure what would be a good way to indicate that. Finally, we might want to add some ability to remove stale items from the queue. User can ask to bulk remove everything older than 7 days or something to that effect. Transition I think the user should be allowed to choose between this and the 'classic' algorithm, but I would like this to be the default in the future since I think it makes far more sense. So there's a question of how to transition without having people that would prefer classic lose all their episodes. I'd propose the following (though I'm not sure it's the best idea). For new installs, we just default to this new algorithm. But, if the user is upgrading, on the first launch of the app we ask the user if they want to switch to the queue centric model that allows for easier management of automatic downloads and easier cleanup of old episodes. If they prefer they can stick with classic which downloads more things and requires more interaction to clean up old episodes. Implementation We'd create a new EpisodeCleanupAlgorithm and a new AutomaticDownloadAlgorithm. Choosing the new mode would use those algorithms instead of APCleanupAlgorithm and APDownloadAlgorithm. Thoughts Any thoughts or opinions? Any other related issues I missed?
Manager.title: Queue centric AutoDownload and Cleanup Algorithms

Manager.description: I have a new podcast with many old episodes (i never heard before). One episode seems interesting after start reading its description so i click the "download" button. This starts downloading but throws me into the feed view (unwanted behaviour 1 as i was reading the description). Even the scroll position is lost, so i have to scroll down again to this old episode. While further reading the description my WiFi failed and so the download stops. But again i was thrown into the feed view (unwanted behaviour 2). Thanks for all your work with this software. I use them every day on my way from and to work. Cycling would be so boring without :-)
Manager.title: Episode view is lost on manual download and download error

Manager.description: I am trying to add a podcast in the "Add podcast" menu inserting the following URL in the "Add Poscast by URL" filed: http://www.farmertofarmerpodcast.com/1/feed but it will not download the episodes to the AntennaPod queue.
Manager.title: Some RSS feeds are not properly processed

Manager.description: From Google Play Store: Search for iTunes not good Japanese characters don't Recognition. (ex.あ, カ, 漢 etc...) This seems to be an issue on our end, since it works fine when I go to the URL manually via Chrome's address bar: https://itunes.apple.com/search?term=あ
Manager.title: iTunes search doesn't work with Japanese Characters?

Manager.description: With the growth of the project, the current license is probably no longer sufficient as it leaves much unclear and not explicit. For example, it asks for the copyright notice to be included, but doesn't say anything about whether forked code should disclose source code or not (relevant comment) It's probably a good idea for the community or maintainers to discuss/decide on a more appropriate and comprehensive license. A good summary of popular licenses is available here. Some of the more popular licenses are listed here (scroll down). An alternative listing of popular licenses is available here.
Manager.title: License

Manager.description: Hi! I think, the download log should only contain errors with episodes, not with the images. This would be less confusing. What do you think?
Manager.title: Image fails in download log

Manager.description: Here's an example feed: http://feeds.soundcloud.com/users/soundcloud:users:82926214/sounds.rss Description gets rendered without any new lines in AnttenaPod and it looks really weird.
Manager.title: Shownotes don't display line breaks

Manager.description: Look at the attached screenshot. Sorry for the lack of details, I'm submitting this from my phone.
Manager.title: "%d seconds"

Manager.description: After I updated the app today it is saturating my downlink. So far it has downloaded over 1 GB. It doesn't download any podcasts as far as I can see. Nothing in the download log either. What kind of stuff is it downloading? Over 1 gig of stuff. I have all updates set to manual since forever. Thanks.
Manager.title: Downloads a lot of data after update

Manager.description: I just updated to 1.3, and I am getting a message stating that I have to have external storage mounted. However, my phone doesn't have support for external storage, this should be an option, as I cannot use Antennapod now My phone is a moto x 1st gen
Manager.title: External Storage Required?

Manager.title: NullPointerException for some Gpodder Actions

Manager.description: As there are quite a few strings that haven't been translated to Dutch I am working on that in Transifex. I have the app open in front of me so that I can check for the right context. In order to determine the the proper translation of 'Set subscription counter' (pref_nav_drawer_feed_counter_title) and the other counter items, I was wonder what the function (Setting the subscription counter) actually does: A) determine the displayed number in the drawer B) determine the numbers for the counter (the "set subscription order" setting 'sort by counter') and thus the order of the feeds if 'sort by counter' is selected C) both I would expect it's C) both, but from the english strings I would read differently, as the description of the "Set subscription counter" currently is: "Change the information displayed by the subscription counter"
Manager.title: Translation question: what does the drawer counter do

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Set Subscription Counter doesn't work

Manager.description: From the play store: Downloads already played episodes For the past week, seeing already played episodes in my queue. (Says so when I press on the episode) e.g. NPR Hourly News from 06-05-2015 and 06-15-2015 Have to delete the file and ep from queue every time. I'm not sure why this would be happening. I've subscribed to that feed so we'll see if I see the same behavior. Sharing this link back to the play store to get more feedback. Device reported as: L-01F (g2)
Manager.title: Downloaded episodes continue to reappear

Manager.description: Hello, Today I did not use my Phone and the battery went from 80% to 10% in a few hours. A look in Wakelock Detector told me that my Phone was active all the time. AntennaPod (more exactly: com.aocate.media.ServiceBackedMediaPlayer) prevented the CPU from sleeping for 93% of the up time (since 1d and a few hours)! During this period I was in flight mode, did not listen to any episode and nothing was paused, either. So AntennaPod should have been (almost) completely inactive. After I forced AntennaPod to exit the battery stayed at 10% for 3 hours :) I use CyanogenMod 12.1 and AntennaPod 1.3.1.
Manager.title: Battery: Persistent CPU wakelocks when inactive

Manager.description: I synced with my gpodder.net account, which included several subscriptions that no longer have active RSS feeds. It seems that since AntennaPod has never successfully downloaded the feed, it doesn't appear in the subscription list, so I can't remove the dead subscription. I have unsubscribed via gpodder.net, but AntennaPod doesn't seem to be syncing the removal of a subscription. As a result, every time I refresh my podcasts, I get errors for four RSS feeds that I don't have listed in my subscriptions. Also, is there a way to get to the download history / error log from inside the app?
Manager.title: Can't remove subscriptions with dead RSS feeds

Manager.description: This has been reported on Google Play in a couple of spots now. I'm not entirely sure why we're seeing this now but weren't before. The simple solution is to check everything for null first, but it would be better to know why it's null in the first place. First example: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to read from field 'android.view.View android.widget.AdapterView$AdapterContextMenuInfo.targetView' on a null object reference at Manager.description: If playback is through a Bluetooth headset, playback will pause if the headset is shutoff, but it won't resume once the headset is reconnected.
Manager.title: Won't resume playback on Bluetooth headset after pause

Manager.description: Hi, I'm subscribed to Radio Berkman: http://feeds.feedburner.com/radioberkman When I resume playing an episode after closing AntennaPod, it resumes playing at a point different than the point it was paused. If I seek within an episode using the slider, it displays one time for a fraction of a second, then displays another time as it starts playing back. If I seek using the Forwards and Backwards buttons, it doesn't seek by 30 seconds. Sometimes seeking using the Backwards button will cause it to seek forwards. When I open the episodes using Totem on my computer, the duration doesn't match the duration shown by AntennaPod. Matt
Manager.title: Trouble playing back Radio Berkman .ogg episodes

Manager.description: In core/src/main/res/values-fr/strings.xml:
Manager.title: Spelling error

Manager.description: Even when I've pre-downloaded all the podcasts in my queue and disabled mobile data updates, AntennaPod still seems to be using plenty of data during my commutes as I listen. I have auto-downloading completely disabled and I manually queue and download each podcast while on WiFi. Just in the last 12 hours since I installed a network monitor, AntennaPod has downloaded 39.05MB on mobile data (63.14MB on WiFi, which would account for one downloaded podcast). During the same timeframe, Prestissimo has used 114.68MB on mobile and 19.55MB on WiFi, which could be another matter, though this is the only app I have that uses Prestissimo. I've already reached my monthly bandwidth cap in the last ten days.
Manager.title: High mobile data usage during playback

Manager.description: This is because we're marking the item as not read anymore, but we really need to mark it as new.
Manager.title: Undo when swiping an item out of 'New Episodes' doesn't work

Manager.description: Some podcasts that I listen to have long titles and there is currently no way to see the full title (at least that I am aware of). Would there be some way of being able to access the full title. For example, having the title scroll when in the episode description. Thanks
Manager.title: Unable to see full title of episodes

Manager.description: Go to the menu, select "Downloads". Then swipe to the "Completed" tab. The size of the downloaded podcast is shown next to the lower right corner of the podcast icon. Usually this is a plausible value. For example: "21 MB". Occasionally it displays "0 B". The download will still play, so this is not a failed download. This happens on AntennaPod 1.3.3.0. It occurs on both phones I use for podcasts: Moto G (XT1031) with Android 4.4.4. Kyocera Hydro Vibe (C6725) with Android 4.4.2 Some podcasts seem more likely to have this problem. But it does not happen consistently. "On The Media", "This American Life", and "Planet Money" seem to have it occur most frequently. This is a really minor issue. The strange download size is just a little confusing as it might indicate a problem with the download.
Manager.title: Completed Downloads page occasionally indicates "0 B" as download size

Manager.description: It seems that adding retrolambda in 3abce4c is breaking my build. Parent commit fd2633e is working fine. when set my HEAD to 3abce4c, and tried to sync gradle in AndroidStudio, I get: Error:Execution failed for task ':core:compileReleaseJavaWithJavac'. When running gradle with java 5, 6 or 7, you must set the path to jdk8, either with property retrolambda.jdk or environment variable JAVA8_HOME What do I need to change in my build environment to get this to work again? Do I need to install the Java8 SDK?
Manager.title: 3abce4c breaks my build

Manager.description: What happens if the user doesn't set an interval or time of day to update feeds? (What's the default refresh rate?)
Manager.title: Effect of not setting update interval/time of day

Manager.description: Proposal: As the title says, move 'Episode Cache' from 'network' to 'other' settings section. I see the option more as a way to limit used disk space, rather than limiting used mobile data.
Manager.title: Move 'Episode Cache' from network to other settings section

Manager.description: Hi I can t be sure when this stream crasher is introduced but I am unable to stream with APod anymore. Every attempt to stream from hundreds of subscriptons crashes for no good. I can download them but cant stream them. I was able to stream somewhat steadily in the past but not so easily nowadays. Bear in mind that I have not upgraded my Android since then, so same Android but crashing Apod. This has started showing signs of crashloving in last couple months if I am guessing right.
Manager.title: What happened to the lovely streamer ?

Manager.description: I use an app called Battery Doctor to conserve power, and frequent it shows AntennaPod in the list of currently running apps even when I'm not using it or haven't used it lately. I have automatic downloads turned off and I can't figure out why it keeps starting up by itself. Is there another setting that I'm missing? Thanks. (Android Kitkat 4.4.2)
Manager.title: AntennaPod keeps starting by itself

Manager.description: This idea results from reading through the sleep timer improvements implemented with #1072 :-) Those could IMHO be supported by a function to dynamically reduce the playback speed (if Prestissimo is installed) from whatever the user has set to 1.0. It could work by simply distributing the Playback Speeds steps along the Sleep Timer's time axis with the 1st "downstep" happening immediately. Example: Speeds 1.0, 1.25, 1.5 and 1.75 are set upBefore starting the timer, playback is at 1.5x. Setting the sleep timer to 20min, the first 10min play at 1.25 (immediate downstep) and the last 10 at 1.0. If 1.75x was used before and 30min are then timed, 10min each would play at 1.5, 1.25 and 1.0.
Manager.title: dial playback speed down to 1.0 during sleep timer

Manager.description: It would be nice to have option to filter episodes in the "All episodes" view. For example only show downloaded episodes for easier manual deletion. Currently this type of filtering is only possible in the postcast view but not in "All episodes"
Manager.title: Add filter and sort options to the "All episodes" view

Manager.description: Currently automatic download is global setting. It would be good to have ability to override that for individual podcasts. (ie. "Force automatic download" or "disable automatic download" in the podcast settings)
Manager.title: Add option to override automatic download setting

Manager.description: Issue Description I have a 2014 Moto X running official 5.1. I have an issue where if I am listening to an episode, and fast forward it with the slider all the way to the end, it will freeze, and if i get it to move it will give me an error message. Additional Info I listen to episodes at 2x speed and am using the prestissimo library for that. I set the option to auto delete when 100% listened. There is another episode in the queue after the one I am fast forwarding through Thank you very much for all your work.
Manager.title: APod freezes on fast forwarding to end of episode
