Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at de.danoeh.antennapod.activity.PreferenceActivity$MainFragment.onCreate(PreferenceActivity.java:105) Reproduce: Open Settings, click Update Interval or Time of Day, rotate
Manager.title: NPE in PreferenceActivity when rotating while dialog is open

Manager.description: Antennapod feature request - "Cog Gears" multiselection for Downloaded Episodes. Hello Antennapodders, Good work and many thanks! Here is a feature request for a workflow: Please enable the enhanced "cog gears and filter" multiselect interface, as it exists for the Podcast Episode listing, for the "Completed Downloads" group. (This button appears in the top row of icons) My particular circumstance (Antennapod 1.3.4.1 dark theme- Samsung S4 mini running AICP custom ROM): I've downloaded LOTS of episedes while I have a good wifi connection. They all enqueue, which is good, but for so many it's hard to sort them properly. So I actually cleared the queue of 145 episodes and now its quite difficult to rebuild it. When I go to the Downloads section via the side bar, I find myself on the blank Running slide-tab. Since any particular user is only actually running the downloads for a short period, it might be better to have "Completed" as the initial display. On the completed slide-tab, I've got the rubbish bin icons on the right to delete individual episodes, but I can't multiselect, filter, group or sort the downloaded episodes. If this Completed Downloads interface had the enhanced filtering and multi-select, we'd be able to 1) rebuild the queue much more efficiently, 2) bulk delete accidentally downloaded, 3) use sort and filter to review the entire collection. This appears to have a similar background to #1209" Add filter and sort options to the "All episodes" view #1209 " Apologies if this has been requested or phrased in a different thread. I just signed onto Github with Antennapod as the catalyst (hooray!)....and while I think I saw something similar in the issues archive, for the life of me I cannot find the thread!
Manager.title: Antennapod feature request - "Cog Gears" + Filters + Sort for Downloaded Episodes.

Manager.description: The fixes in #1202 and #1198 need to be ported to develop.
Manager.title: merge fixes from 1.3.4 in to develop

Manager.description: On last alpha release from yesterday (1.4.0.1) skipping episode delete episode which force you to download it again. I think when you're skipping an episode and set preference to not remove episodes from queue it shouldn't delete episode.
Manager.title: Episode should not be deleted when preference to "not remove items from queue when skipping" is on

Manager.description: Last alpha release from yesterday (1.4.0.1) implemented shake to reset (and vibrate) in sleep timer. When shake to reset is not set antennapod dial down sound but do not stop playing. Beside you end up stuck with a low sound level. The only way to get back normal sound level is to set sleep timer with shake to reset and let it stop playing audio.
Manager.title: Bug in sleep timer when shake to reset is not set

Manager.description: On last alpha release from yesterday (1.4.0.1) there is a new experimental built-in option to use sonic media player as replacement for prestissimo but you still need to have prestissimo installed. If you do not install it you can't set play speed option (It asks to download prestissimo) and you can't change speed in player view which do not have speed switch button.
Manager.title: Prestissimo has to be installed for Playback Speeds preference

Manager.description: Notification background is white, and so is the text, making it impossible to read.
Manager.title: Downloading notification is white when using dark theme

Manager.description: API 23 added the PlaybackParams class that allows for (among other things) setting playback pitch and speed. These params can be attached to a MediaPlayer object. Because of this, Prestissimo should be considered deprecated as of Android 6.0. Use the native API instead.
Manager.title: Use built in APIs in Android 6.0 for variable speed playback

Manager.description: Hi I exported the opml and it looks like one giant single line which makes it hard to edit manually. thanks
Manager.title: Exported OPML is not formatted really

Manager.description: Hi It would be nice if the user can open the podcast window that list all the titles of the podcast within any episode. Right now one has to locate the podcast from the left menu if the user needs to open the podcasts details page.
Manager.title: FR: Open the podcasts window

Manager.description: Please add 0.75, 0.85 and 0.95. I find sound with 0.80 to be too shaky, whether with Prestissimo or Sonic.
Manager.title: Add additional speed steps

Manager.description: Antennapod allows for playing of media files via a file manager. The options available during playback are to configure the auto-pause time and to skip the episode. The latter doesn't make sense in this context. It would be better if the option was to delete the file directly. Not only this, but the setting to automatically delete the file once playback completes isn't observed. It would be very useful to add deletion to Antennapod, since otherwise I have to return to the file manager, find the file I was playing etc.
Manager.title: Delete files played via a file manager

Manager.description: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/antennapod/2XSuuRTBUsM: I have set my play list to sort it by (last publishing) date. It would be nice, if the sidebar could be set to sort it by this date, too. Actually it is only sortable by alphabet or by number of episodes. This option would give me the same order in both lists and it would be easier for me to find podcasts that are "dead" and which I could unsubscribe.
Manager.title: Drawer: Sort feeds by most recent publication date

Manager.description: Phone: Motorola Moto X 2011 Android Version: 5.1 Kernel version: 3.4.42-g756aa87 AntennaPod version: 1.3.4.1 I have my phone synced to my car's Bluetooth, and am able to play audio. When I turn off the car, playback pauses, as expected. But when I then hit "play" on the phone, the progress bar does not activate, and the "play" button does not change to "pause". I need to then open up Android's task manager, kill AntennaPod, then open it again, at which point I see a popup stating that the AntennaPod app had crashed. I click OK, open AntennaPod again, and now playback starts working again. In fact, the same scenario plays out when I go from playing on my phone's speaker, to starting playback over Bluetooth. This bug was first noticed after both upgrading AntennaPod to 1.3.4.1, and upgrading my Android OS from 4.4 to 5.1.
Manager.title: Bug: AntennaPod crashes when resuming on phone after disconnecting bluetooth

Manager.description: Hi! We are 3 university students that are doing a course in software engineering and the goal of the course is to take a application like antennapod which we have choosen to do and to investigate it like software architecture design strategies and so on. We also have to investigate different design patterns which has been implemented in this application where we chose Observer Pattern, Singleton and Adaptor. We would like to double check that these patterns are being used in this application!? Another problem, for our next task we need to do a change/feature request, As this is a pretty large application and we are planning to do a bug fix/ change request. A couple of days ago there was a change request about changing the background color for something in the application. We were planning to take that but we can not find it anymore so we figured that someone did it already. Are there any other easy change requests that the community has that we can do for our project? (At the end of the project, we will have to submit a pull request so that we "give back" to the community) Thanks for Helping us out!! Vikhram - Luleå University of Technology
Manager.title: Need some change requests

Manager.description: If an item is playing or in progress (position > 0) then we can't mark it as 'Played' or 'Read'. That's probably wrong since we don't consider an item read until it's actually finished playing.
Manager.title: Can't mark an in progress item as 'Played'

Manager.description: In the audio player view (probably also in the video player): There might be other places, but this is the only one I found so far. Possible solution: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13266901/dark-text-on-dark-background-on-alertdialog-with-theme-sherlock-light Bonus points: The edittext looks very wide, space for 3 numbers should be enough.
Manager.title: Dialogs: Wrong text color in dark mode

Manager.description: I'm sure I have translated a string before with the warning about the necessity of a plugin for variable speed to work. This translation never made it into the app and has now been removed from Transifex as the source string was replaced. The relatively long string changed only a little, however, and I would prefer to update my previous translation rather than thinking of a new one. Would it be possible to recover this string somehow?
Manager.title: Old translated strings still available?

Manager.description: Recently I tried to listen to the System Mastery podcast. The feed's here: http://feeds.feedburner.com/SystemmasteryPodcasts?format=xml It's hosted on Wordpress. The feed loads fine but I get a PROTOCOL_ERROR in AntennaPod. I get the same error in Pocketcasts. The audio files download just fine with desktop clients, curl, etc. The System Mastery folks are at a loss as they didn't change anything, but were getting reports from their users things didn't work properly. I went looking around and found this issue: square/okhttp#1897 so it's possible that there is some change in Android 5.x that in combination with a server change (HTTP 2 support on part of Wordpress?) triggers this problem. I recently learned another podcast, Heavy Cardboard, also hosted on Wordpress, is experiencing very similar issues with Pocket Casts. According to them Pocket Casts is working on a fix but I figured I'd inform you too. http://feeds.feedburner.com/HeavyCardboardPodcast?format=xml
Manager.title: PROTOCOL_ERROR

Manager.description: installing prestissimo has broken opus playback for me - there is just noise. this happens even before changing the playback speed. btw, maybe the optional features provided by prestissimo could be made more discoverable.
Manager.title: opus broken with prestissimo

Manager.description: When resetting the playback position with the context menu in the queue, the info that is shown for that item doesn't get updated immediately. I.e.: AP doesn't replace the 'current play time' and progress bar with the space (MB) that the episodes takes. Info is updated after screen turns off (inactivity), after scrolling the item off-screen or changing screens (go to feed view, for example). Expected behaviour to give immediate feedback that the playback position was reset. AP v. 1.3.4.1 on Android 4.2.2
Manager.title: Info not updated after reset playback position

Manager.description: I recently flashed my phone to the factory image and now Playback on Antenna Pod is borked. This may be related to issue #1223. Longer podcasts take a few seconds (~2-5 sec) to begin playback, then stop playing after ~3 minutes; if you press play after it stops 3 minutes into playback, it plays again for ~3 minutes -- repeat. Sometimes podcasts will not play at all. this happens especially when I try to play another podcast after pressing play on another one before it has started playing (during that 2-5 second buffer timeframe). Symptoms: Playback only works on occasion. Playback only continues for ~3 to 3:20 minutes. Tested With Episodes Roosterteeth Podcast: 343 Planet Money: 657, 656 Specs: Android 4.4.4 Moto G Generation 1 AntennaPod Version 1.3.1, Commit 2f55256 (From fDroid)
Manager.title: Playback Broken

Manager.description: Please add the skip fwd/back 30s buttons to the notification slider
Manager.title: REQ: Add more playback controls to notification

Manager.description: Skipping episode should not reset play position. When you resume playing antenna should continue at the time you left unless smart toggle to read has been triggered. (In which case skipping episode should remove it from queue even though keep skipped episode preference is on)
Manager.title: Play position should not be lost when skipping episode and keeping it is on

Manager.description: As @TomHennen suggested in #1152 (comment), I've been working on re-writing the app description. Below is my proposal. If you feel like adapting it, it's easiest to go over to this TitanPad. Please do fill in your GitHub username if you make changes; it makes any discussion easier. Please also provide some explanation if you changed things in the chat facility there. I'll only do a PR to change https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/develop/description/en.txt if some consensus has been reached on the change (hence the TitanPad). Proposed description With AntennaPod you get instant access to millions of free and paid podcasts, from independent podcasters to large publishing houses such as the BBC, NPR and CNN. Add, import and export their feeds hassle-free using the iTunes podcast database, OPML files or simple RSS URLs. Save effort, battery power and mobile data usage with powerful automation controls for downloading episodes (specify times, intervals and WiFi networks) and deleting episodes (based your favourites and delay settings). But most importantly: Download, stream or queue episodes and enjoy them the way you like with adjustable playback speeds, chapter support and a sleep timer. And show your podlove to the content creators with our Flattr integration. Made by podcast-enthousiast, AntennaPod is free in all senses of the words: open source, no costs, no ads. All features: Easily add and import feeds via the iTunes and gPodder.net directories, OPML files and RSS or Atom links Manage playback from anywhere: homescreen widget, system notification and earplug and bluetooth controls Enjoy listening your way with adjustable playback speed, chapter support (MP3, VorbisComment and Podlove) and an advanced sleep timer (shake to reset, lower volume and slow down playback) Take control over automated downloading: choose feeds, exclude mobile networks, select specific WiFi networks, require the phone to be charging and set times or intervals Manage storage by setting the amount of cached episodes, smart deletion (based on your favourites and play status) and selecting your preferred location Share episodes and feeds through advanced social media and email options, the gPodder.net services and via OPML export Support content creators with Flattr integration including automatic flattring Keep track of the best of the best by marking episodes as favourites Find back that one episode through the playback history or by searching (titles and shownotes) Access password-protected feeds and episodes Take advantage of paged feeds (www.podlove.org/paged-feeds) Back-up your subscriptions with the gPodder.net integration and OPML export
Manager.title: Updated description

Manager.description: Having AntennaPod from f-droid (1.3.1) I get texts overflowing labels:
Manager.title: Larger Font: Texts don’t fit in labels

Manager.description: Phone: Motorola Moto X 2011 Android Version: 5.1 Kernel version: 3.4.42-g756aa87 AntennaPod version: 1.4.0.2 The home screen widget is a 1-high-by-4-wide widget that lists the podcast's title, includes a track progress time indicator in the form of "current hh:mm:ss / total hh:mm:ss" and a play/pause button. I noticed that they current playback time does not update every second, but instead only ever 5 seconds. So if you stare at it while it's playing, instead of seeing 00:02:43... 00:02:44... 00:02.45..., etc, over the course of 20 seconds, you will only see 00:02:43... 00:02:48... 00:02:53... 00:02:58.. 00:03:03. This may be intentional to reduce battery/resource consumption, or may be a limitation of Android's widget refresh rate, but I figured it was worth mentioning.
Manager.title: Android home screen widget updates progress bar every 5 seconds

Manager.description: Phone: Motorola Moto X 2011 Android Version: 5.1 Kernel version: 3.4.42-g756aa87 AntennaPod version: 1.4.0.2 The home screen widget is a 1-high-by-4-wide widget that lists the podcast's title, includes a track progress time indicator in the form of "current hh:mm:ss / total hh:mm:ss" and a play/pause button. If the AntennaPod app has not recently been opened, is not listed in the recent apps list, or was at some point exited by the Android OS to clear up RAM, the widget does not fully work. In this situation, you see the most recent track's title and the play button, but no progress/total time. Upon hitting the play button, I do see it's on/off-touch actions as the background highlights, but it does not start playing. At this point, I see two options: Option 1: First open the app (using its main icon or clicking elsewhere on widget) and then hit the play button. Now it's registered, and so when you go back to the widget, you now see the current/total time and the widget's play button will function. Option 2: First open the app (using its main icon or clicking elsewhere on widget), but then do not actually hit the play button. Go back to the widget. If you do this, the play button will now function, but the area of the widget which should show the current/total time is still blank. Once this happens, I can't figure out how to get the current/total time to show on the app again. Play/pause it as much as you want, either from the widget or within the app, it looks like the current/total time will not return to the app until the app is cleared from memory (by Android or by you manually) and you execute the steps listed above in Option 1. I know this is really corner case stuff. You have no obligation to address my issues, I'm just happy to provide you information.
Manager.title: Android home screen widget requires first opening main app

Manager.description: Phone: Motorola Moto X 2011 Android Version: 5.1 Kernel version: 3.4.42-g756aa87 AntennaPod version: 1.4.0.2 I use my phone with two different Bluetooth audio devices. These devices both include one "forward" and one "back" button. In the past, these buttons mapped to the in-track Rewind and Fast Forward functions, which would step back/forward some number of seconds. I liked that. It looks like this functionality changed. It seems now that the "back" hardware button on my Bluetooth devices does nothing within AntennaPod, while the "forward" button now skips to the next podcast file instead of fast forwarding in the current track. Unfortunately, I am unable to say with confidence if this change came about because of a recent update to AntennaPod, or with the recent upgrade my phone experienced from Android KitKat to Lollipop. Please feel free to swat this down if you're confident that no such changes were made on the AntennaPod side, or if this working as intended. Thanks for your consideration.
Manager.title: Buttons on bluetooth devices skip track instead of fast forwarding

Manager.description: AntennaPod currently resumes playing from the position where it was paused, but it would be nice to have an option to rewind a predetermined amount of time when resuming playback. The best solution would be to make the amount of time to rewind a function of the amount of time occurred between pause and resume, up to a certain limit, like 30 seconds or so. For example, it would rewind 10 seconds if we paused for 20 seconds or rewind 20 seconds if we paused for 40. If we paused for a minute or more, it would rewind 30 seconds.
Manager.title: Feature request: Option to rewind a bit when resuming playback

Manager.description: This is less of a feature request, and more a question of is it currently possible. If I have to uninstall and reinstall Antennapod without a backup, is there a way to let Antennapod know that I have a bunch of episodes already downloaded sitting on my SD card? Or should I just delete all the previously downloaded episodes and redownload them again? Apologies if this is not the right place for these types of questions. I'm new to Github, but this seemed to be the closest place I found that was discussing the software (which is excellent btw)
Manager.title: Feature Request: Associate feed with previously downloaded episodes?

Manager.description: Hello everyone, I am using the android application. I have synced with gpodder.net. This is how I made selection in a subsribed channel: I navigate to the podcast I'd like to download, the I tap the download icon. That podcast is now downloading, but the display is scrolled back to the first podcast in the list and I have to scroll to find my last viewed podcast. This happens for the first download after I changed to a new channel. Is it possible to disable that auto refreshment? Thank you!
Manager.title: Podcast selection entry auto refresh

Manager.description: On Marshmallow, when the user goes to settings and wants to change the data folder, we should show a dialog (with option to never show again) explaining how to use external sdcards as internal: http://androiding.how/use-sd-card-as-internal-storage-marshmallow/ See #1207
Manager.title: Marshmallow: Show Dialog how to use external sdcard as internal

Manager.description: I have a S5 mini running KitKat 4.4.2. Setting AntennaPod's download folder to the sd creates empty folders for all of my podcasts. My podcasts continue to be stored on the internal storage. @mfietz and I talked about this in #1207. I assumed from @LoopinFool's comment that #1207 covered KitKat as well... but, I guess I was wrong.
Manager.title: Downloading to SD card not working in KitKat

Manager.description: My device went into a continuous loop of attempting to download a new episode and failing with the message "Insufficient Space". This also caused the Antennapod download notification to rapidly expand and collapse. I was able to get it to stop by going into the settings and disabling auto-download. Download log screenshot Solid Explorer is displaying memory usage as: Root: 97% (28.8 MB free) Internal Memory: 84% (1.97 GB free) This is on the 2013 Nexus 5. The feed url is: http://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/The-Defrag-Show/feed/mp3 I also saved a sample of the feed here: https://gist.github.com/dander/2330a550147b835fbebc The latest episode appears to be ~33 MB, however I think there may be a problem with the feed itself. Even after cleaning up some space, I am unable to download that episode, and the file shows up as 1B in the Queue. However, the download failure loop has stopped.
Manager.title: Download retry loop when out of storage space

Manager.description: hey at first, thanks for your awesome work on this app. i really use it every single day! i listen to a lot of sounds on soundcloud.com, though i thought it'd be cool to handle a soundcloud-stream as kinda podcast-channel and download the tunes to play them offline e.g. when traveling. is that idea possible to implement? best regards
Manager.title: FR: handle soundcloud as podcast-channel

Manager.description: The episodes always display their length as HH:MM:SS. There is no way I have found to change this to MMM:SS. Please add this option somewhere.
Manager.title: FR: Allow changing of episode length format

Manager.description: I tried 1.3.4.1 and 1.4.0.2, both crashed, maybe more version also has this bug. Android version: 4.2.1 HM2013022
Manager.title: Crash when copying URL in episode description/shownotes

Manager.description: The best example is when your device is paired with a car stereo. AntennaPod will start playback as soon as the device connects to the car. However, the car stereo may not have the Bluetooth source selected. As a result AntennaPod podcasts will be playing through episodes, but the user will have no idea this is happening. As far as they're concerned they just started their car and are driving somewhere listening to the radio/cd/nothing. One thought for how to resolve this so that it works properly for people with Bluetooth headsets is to have a setting that determines if AntennaPod will start playback on bluetooth reconnect. It has also been suggested that AntennaPod should vibrate some when it starts playback due to a Bluetooth reconnect. This behavior changed in AntennaPod 1.4 alpha, so I think we should try to resolve it before we release 1.4.
Manager.title: Starting Bluetooth playback on reconnect doesn't always work correctly

Manager.description: Long ago I was using Prestissimo but there was often an error stopping playback when ending an episode and switching to next in queue. Due to that I stopped using prestissimo. I have been using sonic media player as default since it has been implemented and got no problem with it. I think it would be nice to promote it as default and set it to on with x1 / x1.25 / x1.5 speed. Variable speed is a nice addition and I'm sure a lot of people do not know this feature. (And never go in parameters)
Manager.title: Promote Sonic Media Player as default for variable speed

Manager.description: @TomHennen D'you also get notifications about Antennapod's website repository? Just checking, 'cause I did a PR for a bunch of minor changes (tagline, broken links, version, etc).
Manager.title: Get notification about PR other repositories?

Manager.description: I added the MP3 Podcast Feed of media.ccc.de: http://media.ccc.de/browse/congress/2014/podcast-mp3.xml (See also https://events.ccc.de/congress/2014/wiki/Static:Documentation#Podcast_Feeds) Importing first seemed to work (I saw the episodes in the list), but then after a while it crashed and then does everytime some seconds after its start. Deleting cache and restarting phone did not help, I had to delete the app data to get the app work again and then reimport all feeds (I luckily had an opml backup from not too long ago).
Manager.title: AntennaPod crashes at startup after adding CCC Podcast

Manager.description: Hey, my AntennaPod has a bug with the ordering of the podcasts. Its basically the same problem as described here: #339 I have version 1.3.1 (2f55256) and the issue still exists for me: #339 (comment) Thank you :)
Manager.title: Case-insensitive ordering of podcast feed list (Reopen issue 339)

Manager.description: I've been pregnant with this idea for a while. Recently @keunes reminded me of it: I think it would make a lot of sense to have some kind of knowledge base with tutorials, workarounds (known issues) and other general information. This knowledge base could be started in the wiki. Once we got some information in it, we can integrate it into the app, either at the bottom of the settings (near about) or in the drawer. For the tutorials, we might even have those in the app itself, through something like https://github.com/amlcurran/ShowcaseView (My ideas go from having just screenshots explaining the steps to guiding the user visually through the app)
Manager.title: Knowledge base

Manager.description: It just happened to me that when using the latest AntennaPod version on MM, the lockscreen notifications were repeated under each other again and gain and in the background there also was the lockscreen again and again just like standing between two mirrors. This does not happen all the time and i don't know how i got there. Even the pin entry dialog was doubled.
Manager.title: Marshmallow: Lockscreen snaps when cover art is a gif

Manager.description: It's not possible to disable the play-button on the lock-screen while a stream is playing. It would be great if there was an option in the settings for this.
Manager.title: Missing option: Disable play-button on lock-screen

Manager.description: I have been a regular subscriber to the "The City Church with Judah Smith", but lately when I download episodes, the audio run time is 3 or 4 times the actual length of audio for the episode and I am also having playback issues. For example, my wife has an iPhone has downloaded the last two episodes, and here is a comparison of the episode length from iTunes and AntennaPod: Friend of Jesus - Part Three (iTunes Run Time: 45:05, AntennaPod Run Time: 2:06:35) Friend of Jesus - Part Two (iTunes Run Time: 40:17, AntennaPod Run Time: 1:51:03) When I let an episode play uninterrupted, it will play until the exact time listed in iTunes and then it will end and the episode will be removed from the queue even though it has not reached the end of the listed run time. If I pause an episode and then resume play, the audio will not begin from the spot where I paused it and will jump back to near the beginning. It seems as though something is getting corrupted with the run times because the audio quality is fine but I'm not sure why the issues are happening. Here are some further details: My Device: Samsung Galaxy S5, Android Version 5.1.1 Podcast URL: http://thecity.org/feeds/audio Any help would be appreciated.
Manager.title: Wrong duration with "The City Church" podcast

Manager.description: For the Last 2 months or so, most of my podcasts will repeat approx the last 5 mins of the episode. So let's say a podcast is reported by AP to be 40 mins, the podcast might only be 38 mins long but will have the last 2 mins repeated. I suspect this may be related to either pausing or skipping forward in episodes as shorter episodes do not do this. I usually skip adverts, and longer episodes i may not listen to in one go. However, I have also had intermittent problems with skipping lately as well, where skipping forward will sometimes take me back to where I started skipping from (eg I skip at the start of an advert, it tkaes me forward to half way so I skip again and I end up at where I started skipping). My current device is HTC M8 running 5.0.1. I am on the beta program and have the latest version.
Manager.title: Podcast episodes repeat last few minutes

Manager.description: It would be useful to add a skip forward button to the notification tray control. This would make it easier to skip the end of podcasts and/or adverts breaks, rather than having to unlock, open AP, navigate to the player and skip.

Manager.description: The developers have indicated the Google Play crash report contains a lot of valuable information. However, some bugs don't lead to crashes and it may be hard to pinpoint what exactly is going wrong (see e.g. my very vague issue #1264). In those cases, it may be handy to be able to easily copy/send a debug log, as is possible with Open Whisper System's Signal. They've put the option in the settings screen under 'advanced'; in AP the option might fit under the 'Other' section.
Manager.title: Add 'submit debug log' function

Manager.description: It makes it easier for AP supporters/backers to promote their favourite feature, for developers to check which features are most popular, and for userbase in general to engage with AP. Registration is really simple Maintaining seems doable, meaning there's not much project maintainers need to do except for closing implemented features. Unfortunately, the system doesn't rely on GitHub data and new feature 'requests' created on the platform don't lead to features created on FeatHub, and vice versa. However, the community (including me) can make sure cross-linking happens between feature requests on GitHub and FeatHub. A list of the most-voted features can be embedded in the AP website and/or the project page here on GitHub. (I found this as I was originally searching something to implement this voting-system in an easy way).
Manager.title: Implement voting system

I'm wondering: What might I be able to do to work around this issue? If this is a bug in the podcast feed, what should I tell to the feed owners to fix this? I couldn't figure out whether this is the same issue as #1086. Sorry if it's a duplicate.

Manager.description: Comparing the list of languages translated to this Transifex import list (if that indeed is what it is), it seems that Norwegian Bokmål (Norway) // 99% // Nov 01, 04:03p.m. // [nb_NO] is fully translated but not imported from Transifex. Bokmål ([ˈbuːkmɔːl], literally "book tongue") is an official written standard for the Norwegian language, alongside Nynorsk. Bokmål is the preferred written standard of Norwegian for 85% to 90%[2] of the population in Norway. (Wikipedia) Given the above, I assume [nb_NO] strings could also be used to cover [no].
Manager.title: Norwegian (Bokmål) not imported from Transifex

Manager.description: Following the discussion in #1369 and earlier thoughts, I would like to propose a translation threshold for including languages in the app. If a language has less than that threshold translated (the 'English' resource, not considering the description or changelog), then we shouldn't provide it in the app. This would create a cleaner interface in the app itself. But it also relates to the question of claiming which languages you support in Google play, maybe later on the website as well: if you have just 50% translated, than it wouldn't be fair to claim that language is supported. Though a bit arbitrarily, I would suggest a threshold of 75%. This would cut off the following languages: Hebrew (Israel) 74% [he_IL] Russian (Russia) 74% [ru_RU] Polish (Poland) 68% [pl_PL] Danish 68% [da] Portuguese (Brazil) 62% [pt_BR] Greek 59% [el] NOTE: Greek is currently not imported from Transifex either Hindi (India) 52% [hi_IN] Italian 49% [it] NOTE: Italian (Italy) // 85% // Nov 01, 04:03p.m. // [it_IT] is available, so it_IT can be used for it Romanian (Romania) 44% [ro_RO] Azerbaijani 38% [az] Spanish (Spain) 35% [es_ES] NOTE: Spanish // 100% // Nov 03, 05:03p.m. // [es] is available, so escan be used for es_ES and other languages with less than 35% of the strings translated I put the languages that will be available on the wiki: Supported languages I would be willing to spend some time activating people to update the languages that are just below the threshold.
Manager.title: Introducing a language threshold

I had to reset my factory smartphone and am now struggling to get AntennaPod back to the previous status, which I had saved by syncing the /data/de.danieloeh.antennapod/files/folder. PS: And in order to prevent the same problem in the future: Is the cache folder required in the backup, or other locations as well? Can the playback queue be backed-up?

I have no problem with sound but : time is not displayed on car's screen, remaining time is not displayed on car's screen ; name is not displayed if i resume from pause (when i start my car from the middle of a podcast) on car's screen ; next/back car's key doesn't work. I haven't this problem with other application (but i prefer yours !). Regards, Lionel

Manager.description: Since the 1.4.0.12 update, reordering episodes in my queue exhibits strange behavior. Suppose I have 5 episodes in order: A B C D E and I want to move 'A' to the end of the queue. I tap the squares on the left, and drag it down. The episodes wiggle back and forth and maybe half the time A ends up at the end. Sometimes it ends up in the middle, sometimes it moved down one spot. Sometimes I get a queue like this: B E A C D That's the actual order I ended up with just now on my phone, trying to drag A to the end. Also, this may be unrelated, but if I turn off the display, sometimes the queue is scrolled back to the top when I turn the screen back on. I'm not sure yet exactly what triggers it, but it'd be nice if it stayed where I was previously. Just now, I tried it 10 times, got bumped back to the top of the queue 7 out of the 10. I love the product, but this feels less polished than the previous release. If any other information would help diagnose the issue, I'm happy to help. I am on a Nexus 4 with android 5.1.1.
Manager.title: Queue: Wrong order, scroll position not restored

Manager.description: Hi there Since the last update (1.4.0.12) I'm experiencing big performance problems. The UI is much slower now. The biggest problem is the feed update. Instead of 1-3 seconds, it now takes about 30 seconds (6 parallel downloads, 26 podcast-feeds). In this time the app is not usable. (freezing, slow) Is there anyone else with the same problem? Is there a fix? I'm using a Moto G LTE with Android 4.4.4 best regards Jürgen
Manager.title: Performance Problem 1.4.0.12

Manager.description: Hi, I would like to get rid of episodes I either have listened or marked as played. When I mark an episode as played is that considered to be played so that Auto Delete kicks in and deletes them? That's the way I would like for it to work. If they are not deleted, what happens to episodes that are marked as played? Does it make any difference when it comes to deleted if they also are removed from the queue?
Manager.title: Deleting after playback vs marked as played.

Manager.description: The latest version from F-Droid, 1.4.0.12 fails to load RSS feeds from KPFA such as: https://kpfa.org/program/flashpoints/feed/ The TLS config looks good: https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/analyze.html?d=kpfa.org The XML is valid but there are some feed validity issues: https://validator.w3.org/feed/check.cgi?url=https%3A%2F%2Fkpfa.org%2Fprogram%2Fflashpoints%2Ffeed%2F This is a screenshot of the error message: https://docs.webarch.net/w/images/Screenshot_2015-11-25-16-50-29.png I note that the MP3 URLs use HTTP and not HTTPS which is a shame, but the KPFA RSS feeds were working with previous versions.
Manager.title: AntennaPod TLS trust anchor error

Manager.description: I ran into some problems when trying to replay an episode that I just finished playing. As soon as the episode finishes playing, its entry in the episode list becomes "grayed out", and there's no way to play it again: the "play" icon is actually stuck in the "pause" state, and the time navigation bar is unresponsive. Please note that the "Auto delete" setting is off (and I can see the downloaded file is still in the media folder). If I close antennapod, open it again and try to play the episode (which is still grayed out): sometimes the app still behaves as described above sometimes the app crashes when I click on the episode ("Unfortunately antennapod has stopped"). sometimes I can replay the episode by long pressing on it and selecting "Reset playback position", but then there is no way to control playback (pause, seek, stop), and playback goes on even if I close or kill the application! I'm using version 1.4.0.12 from the f-droid repository, on android 4.2.2
Manager.title: Problems in episode replay just after playing

Manager.description: Usually podcasts last way longer than songs, 60 and 90 minutes are quite common. And many of them have 'garbage' (ads, uncut overlapping times from other contiguous chapters or programs), that you would like to skip especially at the end of the episode, all while considering current episode as fully played. I guess that this is why a 'smart mark as played' optional time is offered; you can currently choose between No and 15/30/45/60 seconds. I would like to request to expand this to allow to select for several minutes. For example, my typical podcast has usually around 5 minutes of overlapping content at the end I have to skip to go to next episode. I would bet that 5 minutes for something 60/90/120 minutes long is way more frequent than 60 seconds, the longest I can choose. Adding 5 and 10 minutes to the current available options would more or less make it for many people with minimal developer effort. Alternatively, I would rather prefer to let me choose the amount in seconds I want, instead of being only offered a closed set of predefined values. This way developers would not need to guess which options to offer, simply let the user enter what they feel it fits him. That would be slightly more complicated to code, but not much; perhaps only some code to prevent absurdly high or negative values to be accepted would be in order for safety.
Manager.title: More smark options

Manager.description: Since the new release on play store i have the "pause" and "next" icons even on my old Android 4.0.4 notification screen. Hurray! But the icon is always "pause". After clicking it does not change to "play".

Manager.description: I love the app and this is an exceedingly minor gripe, but I imagine it is likely pretty easy to achieve as well. Since 1.4 the podcast art now displays as the background of the lockscreen. I don't really like this. Artwork like this, pretty much by definition doesn't fit a 9:16 ratio screen. I don't want it to be stretched, tiled, centered, letter-boxed, etc. I'd much rather just see my regular background than have artwork that changes every 20-90 minutes anyways. It's not like I don't know what I'm listening to anyways and the notification is already there if I don't. Just hoping that this can be made optional in the settings, even if ON is the default. Thanks.

Manager.description: Galaxy tab 3 8 android 4.4.2 antennapod 1.4.1.4 with french locale from Fdroid With the last update "Number of new and unplayed episodes" and "Number of new episodes" seem to have been inverted. I need to select "new and unplayed episodes" so it can display the numbers of new episodes. Don't know if its a inversion at the translation level or code level. Had to check trough Transiflex to get english text.
Manager.title: inversion in Set Subscription Counter menu

Manager.description: I just upgraded from 1.4.0.12 to 1.4.1.4 (f-droid repository) and antennapod now seems to take a very long time when refreshing feeds: instead of 5-6 seconds per feed, often almost 20-30 seconds: indeed often my screen goes off for power saving (30 seconds) and the refresh icon is still running in circles. Anyway, as soon as I turn on the screen, the feed is always updated. So I tried this: press "update feed" wait 5-6 seconds (the average time it usually took for refresh in previous versions) and turn off the screen (press power button) wait 1 second and turn on the screen And the feed is almost always refreshed! So it seems the refresh process is running at the usual speed, but it's not properly displayed on the screen, it takes some triggering event (screen power off-on) to have the display status updated. I also tried deleting and re-adding feeds, but this doesn't affect the problem.
Manager.title: Refreshing feeds seems to take a long time, apparently

Manager.description: Sometimes loading the completed downloads screen takes unreasonably long (over 1 minute). Other screens such as the page for a podcast also sometimes takes very long, but this might be due to loading content from the internet. The completed downloads screen on the other hand should only need local data and should take at most 1 second to load.
Manager.title: loading completed downloads takes unreasonably long

Manager.description: Current situation: update interval isn't set (ie every feed needs manual updating) Proposal: update interval is set to 24 hours Novice users aren't necessarily going through all settings. Personally I did expect auto-update to be on by default. Other news-ish apps (like email, of our public broadcaster) also do auto-update, at least on opening the app, so I'd say it's not that strange of behaviour (in today's fast-moving world). Considering 'mobile updates' are disabled by default, there is no negative consequences for the user in terms of costs or data usage (we can assume in virtually all cases wifi is means absence of negative outcomes for users such as unexpected costs/speed deprivation).
Manager.title: Proposal: Default update interval of 24 hrs

Manager.description: There currently is no way to find out current interval/time settings. If I set an interval value for updating before, I would expect that specific radio button to be on. (i.e. I set the interval to 12 hours, go again through interval/time introduction and re-open interval setting screen, i expect that one to be 'on') Also, the interval setting screen closes almost immediately after selecting an interval. The only feedback to the user is the highlighted button, but that's probably (at least in my case) below the user's finger and invisible. Maybe the whole row should be highlighted, or the window should close with a bit of a delay.
Manager.title: Update interval setting input feedback

Manager.description: With the current version of AntennaPod (1.4.1.4 from F-Droid), the sleep timer does not appear to work. You can set the timer to any time period, the timer icon appears but when the time is reached, the icon disappears and the podcast keeps playing.
Manager.title: Sleep timer not stopping podcasts

Manager.description: Android version: 5.1 Cyanogenmod Device model: Moto G (2nd Gen) Expected behavior: Refreshing the episode list or opening a subscribtion page shouldn't take more than a second. Current behavior: It takes 5-20 seconds to populate the list. Steps to reproduce: Try to refresh the episode list or try to open a subscription.
Manager.title: Refreshing and opening episode list is too slow.

Manager.description: Actually I had started to write the following: I checked in transifex if it wasnt some translation mistake, but it seems it's not. In 1.4.2.0 it seems filtering of 'downloaded' and 'not downloaded' episodes are reversed. I.e.: when filtering for downloaded episodes Until I realised that actually it does work as expected, technically at least. From a user perspective, filtering is a bit counter-intuitive (to me, and). Rather than 'Hide episodes [that fulfill selected criteria]' I expect(ed) 'Only show [episodes that fulfil selected criteria]. I know I'm stupid not to read the dialog title, but I think it does show current practice may not be so intuitive. Looking at other apps I have installed, positive filtering does seem standard practice. Now, I understand this is yet another issue where 'users may get confused if we change things', but I wanted to share this 'insight' and I'm curious to what the developers think of positive filtering in this case (especially in the imaginary circumstances the filtering was new and unknown yet to users).
Manager.title: Reverse filtering (of episodes)

Manager.description: I re-installed antennapod and tried to import some feeds from a local OPML file but it didn't work. In the "OPML import" screen, I click on "From local filesystem", I get the "Complete action using..." popup dialog, I choose my usual file manager (Ghost Commander), navigate to the file, click on the file and nothing happens, I'm back in the "OPML import" screen again. I'm sure the OPML file is OK, importing podcasts from the very same file used to work in previous versions of antennapod (unfortunately I can't recall the exact version when it worked). Another small bug: if I repeat the import process, I always have to choose the external filemanager, even if I select "Always" in the "Complete action using..." popup dialog; so it seems antennapod is not keeping track of the choice. (BTW Importing from gpodder.net works)
Manager.title: OPML import from local filesystem doesn't work

Manager.description: Antennapod should verify that the data downloaded is the media data. If connected to a hotel or airport Wifi that require further login, the downloaded file is small, around 1-20 kb. It is probably the network login screen, but antennapod assumes that it media file and trys to play it. Which generally hangs the program and it is killed. A connection with blocking, may also have similar problems, where the blocking message is received instead of the media data. I suggest two corrective actions: Verify that the internet connection is available, before attempting to download the episode. Check that the received data is actually a valid media file after it is received. If not, don't let it be played. Workaround: Look for media files that are too small and delete them from the cache manually. I also have problems where antennapod hangs when an audio podcast ends, followed by a video. Again, checking the data, before attempting to play it should allow using the correct codec. The check should be done on the next podcast in background while playing the first podcast or when it approaches the end.
Manager.title: When connected to WiFi that doesn't provide internet connection, download files hang playback

Manager.description: Using AntennaPod in Dutch, some of the tab/button labels are cut off (for buttons) or characters are put on a next line (for tabs) because the strings are too long (due to the way our language works). Would it be possible to build in some mechanism for automatic line ending (for labels)? Shouldn't tab sizes (width) auto-adept to label length?
Manager.title: Button/tab labels cut off (Dutch)

Manager.description: A reoccurring misunderstanding is that auto download doesn't seem to work if the episode cache is full, e.g. see #1518 Thus, we should show an indicator if said cache is full.
Manager.title: Indicate that episode cache is full

Manager.description: Here's a frequent offender: http://www.kqed.org/.pod/forum They add new entries without media content, then add the content to the entry several hours (days?) later. In AP, these new "episodes" show up with a "mark as played" check mark instead of download icon. There seems to be no way of adding these episodes to the queue (so I can remember to download them later, when they become available) If marked as read/played, these don't reappear as new when actual content is added later (even if the updated feed now includes content) A similar (but slightly different) offender: http://www.sciencefriday.com/feed/podcast/podcast-video/ Adds links to the media file, but the media file is not available (HTTP/404) for some days. Possible solutions: implement a "download queue" -- use standard download rules, but don't start the download until the media file is available. If media file unavailable, don't remove from download queue. This is probably the best solution, though most effort to implement... allow adding episodes without media to the queue -- let user download manually later when media file becomes available, episode should be re-added to the "New" episode list
Manager.title: Unavailable episodes (no media file) in "New" list

Manager.description: App version: 1.4.2.2 Android version: 4.4.4 Device model: HTC one M8 Expected behaviour: When opening a podcast feed (the list of total available episodes for an individual podcast) and manually refreshing via the refresh icon, the new episode should show up in this list after the refresh process has finished. Current behaviour: When opening a podcast feed (the list of total available episodes for an individual podcast) and manually refreshing via the refresh icon, the new episode does not show up in this list, initially. Only after some triggering event (such as selecting another podcast, selecting an individual podcast episode, selecting the Queue) and then returning to the podcast feed, does the new episode display in the podcast feed. Note: This issue is just for the podcast feeds. The new episodes in the Episodes list display right away after manually refreshing (they do not need some triggering event to display). First occurred: After the update to Version 1.4.2.2 (I believe this issue was described by Virhub in the closed thread #1483 after the update to 1.4.2.2)
Manager.title: After refreshing the podcast list, the new episode does not show up initially

This would be great but I now have no way of viewing the show notes in landscape mode, since they only have about 4px of the screen, if the player is also visible at the bottom of the screen. App version: 1.5.0rc0 dropbbox Android version: CM11 Device model: Nexus S resolution 800x480 Expected behaviour: Plenty of pixels for show notes like in 1.4.x Current behaviour: Hard to read show notes First occured: 8 days ago
Manager.title: Limited space for show notes in landscape

Manager.description: Currently, almost half (95 of the 201) issues don't have labels. Also, sometimes labels aren't updated according to new comments from the OP. Lastly, I think we need a new label called 'Under discussion' (for larger issues like updated logo, auto download oldest episode first, etc). I don't want to pretend to know what's good/useful for the developers, but I can imagine the project would benefit of more (consequent) use of issue labels. Especially after @mfietz' great work on the 'early spring clean-up' :) I'd like to volunteer to take on the job of applying issue labels. I know that'd (unfortunately) mean I'd also be able to merge PR's and do other technical stuff, but wouldn't wan to and you'd have to trust me not to do so.
Manager.title: More (consequent) use of issue labels

Same result with buttons on bluetooth headphones, even with screen on. Same result if episode skip or fast forward is checked. Deinstalled Prestissimo, same result. I don't know if this is related to the other hardware button issues. This also means I cannot pause the playback because the title will start from the beginning, again. A short pause leaving the app active will work, though. I tried the Sonic Media Player, Prestissimo and the vanilla after reinstalling the App.
Manager.title: Cannot seek time

Manager.description: I'm sure if this is a problem in the settings or wanted behavior, but AntennaPod doesn't pause for an incoming call if the phone is on vibration and i can't find the place where I can set the behavior to pause every time, when a call comes in. Thank you for all your work!
Manager.title: Not pausing/ducking for incoming call when on vibrate

Manager.description: Since yesterday both manual and automatic feed refreshes are failing. I get a while host of errors under the Episodes menu at the different times when I attempted to refresh including - unknown error, IO error: open failed: eaccess etc. The only change I made was to install CM Security and AVAST Antivirus but after the error I uninstalled both. Then after restarting I was able to refresh all feeds successfully one time. Next I installed CM Security again as I need an antivirus and wanted to isolate which one of the 2 I installed previously might have something to do with the AP error. The feeds failed again this morning. I installed CM and restarted the phone. However this time without any antivirus on the phone AP is still unable to refresh the feeds giving an "unknown error".
Manager.title: Download are failing

Manager.description: The title says it already. I have a podcast episode, which has a size of 109444697 bytes. This is 109 MB or 104 MiB in the IEC standard (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mebibyte). In the list overview of episodes, AntennaPod displays 104 MB, but it should rather be 104 MiB or 109 MB.
Manager.title: Episode size is displayed as 'MB', but actually is in Mebibytes('MiB')

Manager.description: Android version: 5.0.2 Device model: MEDION X5004 Expected behaviour: Seeking in any podcast episode should just work. Current behaviour: With one particular podcast, I have this problem that seeking beyond a certain position does not work correctly. The Podcast is Linux Voice, Season 3 Episode 22. When the podcast starts, I seek to a position beyond 35 minutes (e.g. 00:36:54). Then one of the following two things happen: Either the podcast stops as if it was hitting the end of the mp3-file. The next episode starts playing automatically. Or, and this is quite strange, the (visual) seeking succeeds, the new display time is 00:36:54 and continues to increase in every second (00:36:55, 00:36:56, ...), but the audio track is wrong. The audio that is played is from the start of the podcast episode (00:00:01, 00:00:02, ...). First occured: Version 1.4.2.2 / occurred sometime around 2015-12-23 Steps to reproduce: Subscribe to Linux Voice Podcast via iTunes. Download Season 3 Episode 22 Start playing the episode. Seek to position 00:35:00 or beyond. Repeat step 4 several times, until you see the above behavior. Environment (Settings you have changed, e.g. Auto Download. "Unusual" devices you use, e.g. Bluetooth headphones. Do you still use Prestissimo?): I have changed some setting, but can't remember what. I do not use any headphones or other devices with the phone. I do not have Prestissimo or any other related app (to my knowledge) installed.
Manager.title: Problem with seeking in a particular podcast.

Manager.description: In 1.5.0.2 alpha we got a nice audio player redesign but I feel there is a problem with play controls. In #1561 screenshot it looks like play control bar is still the same size as previous design but it's not actually true : Play controls are too close to time bar making it more difficult not clicking by error on time bar. Besides if you compare with screenshots in #1561 you can also notice there is more space above podcast name and below episode name. (Maybe it's normal since podcast image is smaller in my screenshot)
Manager.title: Size problem with play controls in new audio player design

Manager.description: In new audio player redesign coming in next version we got almost all actions in top toolbar. Menu has only action to share episode. We should consider to remove menu button and replace it with a share button.
Manager.title: Make share button in new audio player to replace menu button

Manager.description: In new audio player for next version we can swipe left to see episode description and chapter view. It would be nice to have endless swipe so : swiping to left in chapter view would go to cover view and swiping to right in cover view would go to chapter view
Manager.title: Audio player: Endless navigational swipe

Manager.description: When in the playback view, changing the playback speed unpauses playback. Reproduction steps: Staat playback Pause it in playback view Tap playback speed, a few times -> playback unpauses, play button doesn't change There are a few other oddities I noticed related to this. By my knowledge I only had 1x playback selected before the last few updates. After, I could change between 0.5 up to 2.0. I went into the menu, afterwards only between 1.0 and 2.0. Curious, I went to look at the specific setting and found a range of 1.1 to 2.0 enabled, all these ranges in steps of 0.1. Going back to the playback view it no longer went to 1.0, keeping to the range in the setting. I suppose something in the update did something strange, or that one time when I enabled sonic for a second. It's so strange a collection of bugs I doubt it'll be easily reproduceable. V. 1.5.0.2 Nexus 5 Android 6.0.1 Not using Sonic
Manager.title: Changing playback speed unpauses playback

Manager.description: The grey background colour in the playback view (on which podcast name, image and episode title are displayed) is the same for both the light and dark theme and fits neither as it doesn't appear anywhere else. Could that change to something more thematically consistent?
Manager.title: Audio Player: Themed background colour

Manager.description: I don't use different playback speeds so I have all but 1.00x disabled in the settings. Despite that, it still appears in the lower left corner, which isn't too bad but unnecessary. It however also still appears as a slider in the audio controls, where i can set it to anything still, though it gets ignored upon exit. I understand where this all comes from, but I feel like between the settings and the UI controls there is some excess of options. I can't think of a perfect solution, so I hope you will.
Manager.title: Playback speed option confusion

Manager.description: When you do an OPML export, it gets saved in the antennapod folder, which gets deleted if you uninstall it. This is rather unfortunate, as keeping the data even though you're uninstalling the app is rather the point of the OPML export. Could this be changed so it either saves it in someplace which doesn't get deleted, or doesn't delete that specific file when uninstalling? As a secondary concern, doing two exports results in only one file. Does it get overwritten? I suggest saving it with timestamps in the name or just numbering them. Thirdly, maybe you should by default leave some settings and subscription data behind when uninstalling? You make it far too easy to lose all settings and subscriptions. Sincerely, A quite grumpy settingless and subscriptionless user Nexus 5 | AP v.1.5.0.2 | Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: OPML export saves in folder that gets removed on uninstall

Manager.description: On AntennaPod 1.5.0.2 when an episode is skipped from player view info for current episode is not updated : episode image, podcast name and episode name do not change and info from previous episode is still displayed.
Manager.title: Skipping episode does not update player view

Manager.description: I would love to be able to make multiple playlists. For example one for news and another one for documentaries. An example of usage would be the history podcasts by Dan Carlin. They're long and should be heard in the correct order. I would make a playlist of one period of history (as Dan does in his naming structure of podcasts). Then I could listen to topical podcasts of news and current affairs for a while, and when I have more time I can listen to another one is a series of history podcasts. Maybe a solution could be an ability to add tags to podcasts, manually and automatically, and then create, sort and play queues based on tags? Related topic: sorting the order of podcasts is not very 'discoverable'...
Manager.title: RFE: Multiple playlists /queues

Manager.description: I have searched on iTunes for the podcast "Blue Ocean World". I subscribed to it (and I don't need to emphasize, right?, that I am very grateful that AntennaPod allows me to search subscriptions on iTunes). When downloading the subscription correctly propagated to my gpodder.net account as well, and it has correct name and issues in the AntennaPod. However, when I look on the subscription on gpodder.net, I see it named as "Unnamed Podcast". That is not good. It's true RSS stream turns out to be http://www.hellohoratio.com/podcast.xml (and if subscribe to it on gpodder.net via this URL then it gets name, issues, correctly). Is there something wrong with propagating metadata obtained from iTunes?
Manager.title: When subscribing via iTunes search I get on gpodder.net podcast named "Unnamed Podcast"

Manager.description: With the latest update (1.5.0.2) I'm getting a regression of and old issue I posted a while back (on phone so couldn't find it, will check when I'm on my computer again). Episodes that I've already listened to, in October and November, are downloaded and added to my queue with automatic download enabled.
Manager.title: Old episodes re-downloaded

Manager.description: Sometimes when downloading a file the download cannot complete for one reason or another. When the download is re-attempted / resumed, it eventually can succeed. The interesting bit is that when the file is finally played, it sometimes has a section of audio repeated around where the download failed and was restarted. That is, the audio plays, then at some point the last few seconds repeat. However, the issue is not the playback, as once the file is downloaded the repeating bit can always be reproduced. It is also possible that when the download is continued from being interrupted the resulting audio file may contain a section which is invalid and sounds like static when played for a brief moment around the section where the re-download occurred. This can be observed on AntennaPod 1.4.2.2 from F-Droid.
Manager.title: Resuming incomplete downloads sometimes results in duplicated content

Manager.description: Currently, the only customization option for download location is the ability to choose the storage device AntennaPod uses. There should be some way, perhaps a field in the settings menu, to set a custom directory as the location for completed podcasts, i.e. sdcard1/Podcast.
Manager.title: Custom media location

Manager.description: I have an Xperia M4 Aqua running Android 5.0 and AntennaPod 1.4.2.2. I chose sdcard1 as the data folder (full path: /storage/sdcard1/Android/data/de/danoeh.antennapod/files). I then tried to download a podcast episode, but the message "Failed to access external storage" pops up. Also, if the path stated above is selected, OPML Import doesn't work, either. Internal storage must be selected for it to import subscriptions successfully.
Manager.title: AntennaPod won't write to external sd card

Manager.description: This has happened to me recently when upgrading my galaxy s4 (i9505) from stock 4.3 to cyangen 12, then more recently to cyangen 13. Basically after the update antennapod loads and says 'external storage not mounted' I can't do anything in antennapod. I managed to fix it both times by flushing the app data, which meant I had to manually subscribe again to every pod cast and download them all again. From what I've seen online it seems to be where the previous path to the data (which I keep on an external sd card so my internal card doesn't get bloated) is invalid. Would it be possible to add an option when the expected storage path isn't found to redefine it?
Manager.title: Breaks when updating android versions

Manager.description: When using the phone on small screen in landscape, the audio controls can't be scrolled i.e. it's only possible to set the playback speed and left channel audio volume. Version 1.5.0rc5 Android 4.4 Custom ROM
Manager.title: Can't see all audio controls

Manager.description: Currently, when importing an OPML file, 'deselect all' is hidden behind a menu button, and both 'select all' and 'deselect all' are still visible when it makes no sense to apply them. Proposal: when none or a few (up to all but one) are selected) display 'select all', otherwise (in case everything is selected) display 'deselect all'. This unclutters the UI, and (at least to me when migrating to a new phone) the only most logical thing to do is to select a few feeds manually, or everything via the button. The rare case when 'deselect all' is wanted, is (I guess) when a person changes their mind: A) first thought 'I want all' then thought 'I want just a few', or B) first thinking 'I want feeds A-G' then thinking 'I want feeds Q-Z' (e.g. in case selecting many feeds manually and wanting to switch to another set. In these cases users will likely figure out to press 'select all' and then 'deselect all'.
Manager.title: OPML Import: Select all/none toggle

Manager.description: Currently, the default cache number is 20. But that's not one of the options (anymore). No real problem of course, but a bit weird.
Manager.title: Default episode cache size should be one of the options

Manager.title: Can't find playback speed controls

Manager.description: Hi! I do not have apps from the play store set to automatically update, so when I switched to a new phone Antennapod was an older version (1.3.4.1). On the new phone the newest version of Antennapod was installed (1.4.2.2). I backup the application data for Antennapod using Helium then restored it on the new phone. When I tried to fetch the feeds they all produced an Unknown Error. I then tried upgrading the old phone to the newest version (1.4.2.2) of Antennapod and started Antennapod fresh and fetched feeds. This worked. I then backup Antennapod on the old phone and restored on the new phone. I started Antennapod fresh and tried to fetch feeds. I got an Unknown Error for each feed it tried to fetch. I then tried uninstalling Antennapod on the new phone. Then reinstalling Antennapod and restoring the data with Helium. I got an Unknown Error for each feed it tried to fetch. I am not sure how to proceed other than I would need to start fresh and export then import via OPML or via gpodder.net. This means I will lose all my downloaded episodes and their status. Correct? Any other ideas on moving Antennapod to a new phone? Thanks again for all your hard work on Antennapod! Frederick App version: (from Google Play) 1st time 1.3.4.1 ==> 1.4.2.2 2nd and 3rd time 1.4.2.2 ==> 1.4.2.2 Android version: 4.1.2 ==> 4.4.2 Device model: Samsung S3 mini ==> Samsung S5 mini Expected behaviour: Moving the data should allow feeds to be fetched Current behaviour: Fetching feeds on the new device produces and Unknown Error for all feeds it attempts to fetch First occured: Version 1.4.2.2 / yesterday Steps to reproduce: Move Antennapod data from one Android phone to another using Helium. Stacktrace/Logcat: [if available] aLogcat.txt
Manager.title: Moving to new phone with newer version produced error in fetching feeds

Manager.title: Unable to parse rss feed

Manager.description: I suggest a change to the on-screen video controls. It would be nice if the controls do not disappear while using them. Currently, if I am playing a video podcast and hit the 30sec FF button (on the screen) several times, the controls will eventually disappear, no matter how frequently I am hitting the FF button. I can be rapidly hitting that button, and all of a sudden they on-screen controls disappear. Obviously they come right back after touching the screen again, but it may be nice to prevent them from going away. It is good to have the on-screen controls disappear eventually, however, I suggest to keep the controls on-screen for a minimum number of seconds after touching a playback control button. Maybe 5 seconds. Then the controls should disappear after that. Hopefully I am clear in my description.
Manager.title: Prevent video controls from disappearing while using them

Manager.description: When set episode cache to unlimited, the icon indicating that the episode cache is full is shown in the sidebar on the Downloads line. Happens even when there is plenty of disk space available on device. App version: 1.5.0.8 Fdroid Android version: 5.1.1 (CyanogenMod 12.1) Expected behaviour: Episode cache should never be full if set to unlimited Current behaviour: Icon showing episode cache as full when set to unlimited in settings First occurred: Update to 1.5.0.8 (from 1.4.2.2 Fdroid) Steps to reproduce: In Automatic download, set episode cache to unlimited. Look at sidebar to see that downloads shows "episode cache full" icon You can toggle between a number and unlimited in the automatic download setting to see the icon disappear/reappear.
Manager.title: Unlimited episode cache shown as full with icon

Manager.description: I currently have my episode cache set to unlimited. Antennapod is bringing up an alert saying this cache is full. It is not because my phone has limited space. There are several gigabytes free. Changing this setting to 100 makes the alert disappear. Reverting back to unlimited brings back the alert. Odds are this is just a broken if statement. App version: 1.5.0.8 (from F-Droid) Android version: 6.0.0 Devide model: Nexus 6P Expected behaviour: Episode cache is unlimited Current behaviour: Episode cache is marked as full, but I can still download First occured: Version 1.5.0.8

Manager.description: Great app. Thanks first. I usually start a refresh when in wifi and do something else (like checking email). While refresh is in progress, it constantly displays toast. If possible remove toast or allow user to disable them.
Manager.title: Allow user to disable toast notifications

Manager.description: When setting my development environment following the wiki instructions I noticed that the link to flattr4j which points to http://www.shredzone.org/attachments/download/250/flattr4j-core-2.7.jar is now broken, as you get redirected to https://shredzone.org/index.html There doesn't seem to be a place where to download the "compiled" jar file. Also, the following is mentioned on the Github page of the project at https://github.com/shred/flattr4j : Important Note Flattr is currently changing its API. Because of that, some of the flattr4j calls are failing or not delivering the expected results. It is unclear to me what a future API may look like, and to what extend flattr4j is going to support it. For the time being, I recommend not to use flattr4j in new projects. So to create PR #1722 I didn't include this jarfile. The app runs fine, but as I have not been using Flattr since ~2013, I can't test the Flattr-specific bits. Question: Is the Flattr integration from AntennaPod still working, or is it affected by the API changes mentioned above? In any case, the wiki should probably be changed. The reason I didn't do it myself directly, is that I don't know what it should be changed to: either, if the code is broken, remove this .jar dependency (and thus also probably remove all Flattr code from the app?) or, if the code is still working, try to find another place where the jarfile can be downloaded from. (I suppose we don't want to ask new contributors to compile that jarfile, I for one have no clue what needs to be done for that, and am not interested in a git clone of that project's source code.
Manager.title: flattr4j jarfile not available anymore (from wiki instructions on how to Set up the Android SDK)

Manager.description: App version: 1.5.0.9 from F-Droid Android version: 4.4.4 Current behaviour: Play/pause button can stop working after the screen has turned off (after the screen is turned back on of course). First occured: Version 1.5 (worked on 1.4) Steps to reproduce: With the current episode in focus: Play something Turn off the screen Turn on the screen Pause (this works) Play/resume doesn't work AND Stop/pause playback Turn off the screen Turn on the screen Press play (this works) Pause doesn't work As a workaround, if you press back you get the currently playing episode at the bottom and the play/pause button there works. If you focus a different app before turning the screen off, turn the screen on and then focus AntennaPod again it works fine. So the problem occurs only when the app has focus (on the current episode). Environment: Do you still use Prestissimo? No, and I have tried Sonic on and off.
Manager.title: Play/pause button can stop working

Manager.description: App version: 1.5.0.9 (Google Play) Android version: 5.1.1 [Cyanogenmod 12.1] Devide model: XT1524 (Moto E 2015 LTE aka Surnia) Expected behaviour: Don't show old Episodes at top in Episodes View. Current behaviour: Random old Episodes are shown at top of feed since last update. (They're marked as played and not being downloaded) First occured: Version 1.5.0.9 / about 7 days ago? Steps to reproduce: Refresh Episodes I can't reproduce the issue with a Nexus 7 (2013) Running CM 12.1.
Manager.title: Issue: Old Episodes show up in Episodes view

Manager.description: App version: 1.5.0.9 (commit a97788a - from Google Play) Issue: Usually in the New Episodes or All Episodes list, the podcast an episode belongs to is identified by the thumbnail. If the episode has an episode specific thumbnail though, its difficult to tell which podcast its from. Currently I copy the URL and paste it in another app, rather than go through the episodes list and find the match. Requested change: In the episode view, display the podcast name in a smaller text size below or above the episode title. I think the size and style of the date and length would work well.
Manager.title: Display podcast name for each episode

Manager.description: I'm running AntennaPod 1.5.0.9 on Android 6.01. Since the latest update I keep getting download report notifications that are stuck. The only way to get rid of them is to kill the app. I was expecting to be able to swipe them away. The notification in the screenshot was stuck for hours.
Manager.title: Stuck download report notifications
