Manager.description: Seriously, I think I just closed the 4th issue. If F-Droid messes up the build, go and complain to them!
Manager.title: STOP COMPLAINING ABOUT F-DROID BUILD CRASHES

Manager.description: It would be nice to have a statistics tab that shows how many hours of podcasts you have already listened to. Looks like this is quite easy to implement because the info is already in the app's database.
Manager.title: Statistics

Manager.description: App version: 1.5.0.9 from F-Droid Android version: 4.4.4, latest Cyanogenmod Snapshot Device model: Galaxy Nexus Refreshing and opening episode lists, queue takes minutes see #1494 -Install antennapod from F-Droid -Import my usual feed-list (15 podcast feeds) (I also enabled Auto Delete, Pause for Interruptions, Auto Download) -Open or switch between new episodes, all episodes, single feeds, queue, etc -stare at the loading circle for a long time #1494 (comment) 1.5.0.rc5_debug did not have the problem. Sometimes rotating the screen 90° makes the app show the episode list. Thanks for helping me with the issue
Manager.title: Refreshing and opening episode list is too slow

Manager.description: When dragging episodes up or down in the queue, I often get crashes. If there is no crash, the queue frequently ends up out of order. Sometimes merely dragging an episode up or down one slot causes a crash. I have found at least one reproduction case. Suppose you start with episodes A, B, C, and D in order: -A -B -C -D Tap on A and start to drag down, so you should end up with B A C D When A's row gets to where you would expect it to swap with B, the app does one of two things: crashes immediately (I haven't figured out why this happens yet), or the remaining episodes all slide down another row (D pushing into a previously nonexistent row): -A -B -C -D If you continue to hold and drag A down, when it gets to B's new row, the app crashes. This reproduces for me 100%. I also am experiencing some bugginess moving an episode up, but haven't found a watertight repro case yet. Usually it manifests itself by moving the episode an extra space or two. Sometimes the app crashes. I noticed this in the last few days. I don't remember the exact first time, but I would guess no earlier than a week ago. AntennaPod version: I signed up for the beta some time ago, but am not sure if I'm actually getting beta builds. My App info says I have version 1.5.1.3 Android 5.1.1, Nexus 4
Manager.title: Reordering episodes in queue causes mis-ordering, crashes

Manager.description: When clicking on a .opml file in a mail the schema does not seem to work. I am only offered to open the file with Chrome or HTML-Display. By looking at the manifest it seems that AntennaPod should pick the extension up.
Manager.title: OPML Scheme not working on Marshmallow

Manager.description: Hi! When trying to play episodes from the NSFW podcast, Antennapod crashes. I did not have that problem in the past, I think since version 1.5.x. The crash does only appear with sonic mediaplayer checked. Without sonic mediaplayer, the episode plays as it should. The device runs with CM12.1 nightly. Here is the link to the podcast: http://not-safe-for-work.de/feed/m4a and here the crashlog: [ Environment ] Android version: 5.1.1 OS version: 3.4.0-cm-g28a6663 AntennaPod version: 1.5.0.9 Model: Xperia Z1 Device: honami Product: C6903 [ StackTrace ] java.lang.IllegalStateException: play() called on uninitialized AudioTrack. at android.media.AudioTrack.play(AudioTrack.java:1141) at org.antennapod.audio.SonicAudioPlayer$2.run(SonicAudioPlayer.java:733) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:818)
Manager.title: Crash with NSFW episodes

Manager.description: Seems to be caused by the shownotes WebView. E/StrictMode: class de.danoeh.antennapod.activity.AudioplayerActivity; instances=3; limit=1 android.os.StrictMode$InstanceCountViolation: class de.danoeh.antennapod.activity.AudioplayerActivity; instances=3; limit=1 at android.os.StrictMode.setClassInstanceLimit(StrictMode.java:1)
Manager.title: AudioplayerActivity: InstanceCountViolation (Memory leak)

Manager.description: While I am listening to a podcast, I unlock my phone to pause it. I cannot play the podcast again since the button becomes unresponsive. Details below. App version: 1.5.0.9 from Google Play Store Android version: 6.0.1 Devide model: Nexus 5 Expected behaviour: Press play button. Podcast plays. Play button icon changes to pause button icon. Current behaviour: Press play button. Button is unresponsive. The podcast doesn't play. Play button icon remains. First occured: about a week ago Steps to reproduce: Open a podcast and be on the main podcast screen with the audio controls and podcast picture/description. Make sure the podcast is playing. Press power button to lock phone. Unlock phone. You should be back on the main podcast screen. Press pause button. The podcast will pause. Press play button. The button will be unresponsive. This can also be recreated with the podcast not initially playing, in which case the pause button will be unresponsive. If you press the back button and then click on the bottom tab to get back to the main podcast screen, the play/pause button will once again be responsive.
Manager.title: Play/pause button unresponsive after unlocking phone

Manager.description: -App version: 1.5.0.9, from Google Play Android version: 4.2.2 Devide model: Fairphone FP1U Expected behaviour: Playback with normal speed Current behaviour: Some podcasts, including BBC Documentaries play uncontrollably fast, adjusting the speed doesn't fix it First occured: I noticed it yesterday Steps to reproduce: Subscribe to one of the podcasts I noticed the misbehaviour with Listen what happens. One RSS is: http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p002vsnk/episodes/downloads.rss
Manager.title: Some files play uncontrollably fast

Manager.description: When playing Opus files in AntennaPod there is a loud noise (similar to random noise). The actual audio can faintly be heard, which means there might be not that much going wrong. Tested files: some episodes in http://feeds.metaebene.me/newz/opus https://people.xiph.org/~giles/2012/opus/ehren-paper_lights-96.opus The files play back fine on the same device both in Firefox and in VLC with full hardware acceleration enabled. Other formats play just fine. App version: 1.5.1.4 (Google Play, commit f197f0e) Android version: 5.1.1 (Cyanogenmod 12.1-20151213-NIGHTLY-e975) Devide model: LG Optimus G (LG-E975) Expected behaviour: Proper audio output. Current behaviour: The actual audio content is played, but overlaid with loud noise. Environment: Sonic mediaplayer is enabled and Prestissimo not installed. Would be marvelous if that was fixed as I'm currently working on a proxy which recodes podcasts to bandwidth saving opus.
Manager.title: Loud noise when playing back Opus files. (sonic mediaplayer)

Manager.description: App version: 1.5.0.8 and later (now 1.5.1.0), F-Droid build Android version: 5.1 - Using CyanogenMod 12.1 Device model: Samsung S4 Mini Expected behaviour: Works as expected without crashes Current behaviour: Crashes either on open, or sometimes after reinstall works for a short while. After initial crash however it never works again (unless reinstalled). First occurred: 2- 3 weeks ago. In a bit to save some RAM, I force closed services for a number of apps, stupidly ignoring the warnings Cyanogen gave me that this might cause apps to fail. Following this Antennapod crashed every time I tried to open it. Steps to reproduce: Go into android task manager and force stop the Antennapod service (in Cyanogen this means going to running apps, clicking into antennapod, forcing stop service, ignoring the warning). Try to open Antennapod. App fails ('the app has stopped' or similar message). Sometimes after reinstalling Antennapod it works again for a short while but afterwards fails to start. - Hi, I've posted about this in the Cyanogen forums as well and it seems like the only fix might be factory reset. I don't really understand why this is happening even when I use various forms of uninstall, reboot, reinstall, clear data for the app, but none of this seems to fix the problem I have caused! I'm not at all sure this is a problem with AntennaPod, but I'm including this bug report here for your information. Thanks, Nick
Manager.title: After forcing stop AntennaPod service, AntennaPod fails to open.

Manager.description: Please add pod.care support. This allows to sync the current status of your listened podcasts to pod.care. With that it's also possible to sync between different devices.
Manager.title: Add pod.care support

Manager.description: App version: 1.5.1.4 (from Google Play) Android version: 6.0.1 Current behaviour: Adding http://www.planetary.org/multimedia/podcasts/planetary-radio-podcast-rss.xml raises: An error occurred:Parser Exception (Attempt to invoke virtual method 'java.lang.String java.lang.StringBuffer.toString()' on a null object reference) If the XML provided by the podcaster is causing this: Is there a tool that checks if the XML is wrong, so that I can file the issue directly with the podcaster next time?
Manager.title: Parser Exception when adding specific podcast

Manager.description: App version: 1.x (from Google Play/F-Store/Custom build) (Google Play, joined beta channel) 1.5.2.0 Android version: 5.x (Please mention if you are using a custom rom!) (Not custom rom, stock android for nexus 5X) 6.0.1 Devide model: LG Nexus 5X Expected behaviour: When moving to next episode after finishing current episode, the progress bar should be at the beginning. Current behaviour: Progress bar stays at the end First occured: Version 1.x / about x days/weeks ago 1.5.0.9 Steps to reproduce: Listen to episode to the end App automatically switches to next episode in queue, but doesn't auto-play it, as configured Playback progress bar stay at the end instead of moving to the beginning Press play button, episode actually starts at beginning, and progress bar moves to beginning
Manager.title: Playback progress bar stays at end after episode is done

Manager.description: App version: 1.5.2.0 (from Google Play?) (Yes, joined beta channel) Android version: 6.0.1 (Custom rom?) (No, just up-to-date Nexus 5X) Devide model: LG Nexus 5X Expected behaviour: When in queue list, sliding an episode to the side should mark it as played, and remove it from queue. Current behavior: in Queue, slide episode to right to mark as played the little message at bottom correctly says the episode has been marked as played, and there is an undo button but the episode gets back in the list to really mark as played, i need to slide the episode again, or navigate away from the Queue and back to it the "undo" button doesn't work as well First occurred: Version 1.5.0.9 Steps to reproduce: Choose Queue Make sure queue is "unlocked" Slide from left to right on any Episode It displays the little message indicating that the episode has been marked as played. Episode re-appears back in the list To really remove the episode from the list, do one of 2 things: Slide the Episode again OR Go to different view (another list or open an episode), then go back to the Queue view If this is not clear yet let me know and i'll shoot a video, i also answered the questions above about the version and rom.
Manager.title: Mark as played gesture doesn't remove episode from queue at once

Manager.description: I changed from an other podcast app to AntennaPod and I missed one feature. I can setup the maximum number of downloads unter the general settings. But it would be a great feature, if I could setup the maximum number of stored episodes for each subscription separately. I think this option could placed in the context menu of each subscription. And if the maximum is reached, the oldest, not played episode will be deleted. Episodes I've started, but not finished shouldn't count. Example for unplayed episodes: I will have 2 Episodes for Podcast X. I download Episode 001 and after a week 002. One week later Episode 003 is released. AntennaPod should remove Episode 001 and than download 003. Example for played episodes: I will have 2 Episodes for Podcast X. I download Episode 001 and after a week 002. I started (but not finished) Episode 001. One week later Episode 003 is released and should downloaded (becourse Episode 001 is not counting). An other week later Episode 004 is released and AntennaPod should delete Episode 002 and than download 004.
Manager.title: Setting to choose maximum stored episode per subscription

Manager.description: So if I play this podcast it sound like mickey mouse. I updated to the latest version and if I play the podcast on the website or download the mp3 manually to my phone, it sounds as expected. App version: 1.5.1.4 commit 88a7515 Android version: 4.2.2 Current behaviour: Plays podcast from http://aufwachen-podcast.de/ in a tuned up version (like playing to fast. First occured: 3 days ago Steps to reproduce: Add the podcast from http://aufwachen-podcast.de/ Play the podcast Either it sound like a german mickey mouse or it does not
Manager.title: Podcast plays in mickey mouse voice

Manager.description: Hi, since a few weeks I can not play episodes from Resonator Podcast any more. This started with Episode 80. At the moment I have no problems with any other podcast. Greetings Florian App version: 1.5.2.0 (from Google Play) Android version: 5.1.1 (Cyanogen 12.1.1) Devide model: Wileyfox Swift Expected behaviour: Play podcast Current behaviour: Crashes :-( First occured: few weeks ago Steps to reproduce: Subscribe to http://resonator-podcast.de/ Download Episode 80 or 81 Try playing it Environment: If I use sonic the software crashed. The default player just plays static noise. I tried the mp3 and opus version of the podcast with same results. Stacktrace/Logcat: No stacktrace found
Manager.title: Crashes when playing specific Podcast

Manager.description: App version: 1.5.0.9 (from Google Play) Commit: a97788a Android version: 4.4.2 Device model: Samsung S5 mini (SM-G800F) Position in audio does not change when dragging slider and slider disappears when paused Expected behaviour: When I drag the slider on the lock screen controls the audio will jump to the position I release it at. Current behaviour: Slider moves but the audio continues to play and the playback position in the audio track does not change. First occured: Current version after switching from a Samsung S3 mini to the S5 mini Steps to reproduce: Start playing a podcast then let the screen lock Press power button to view lock screen Drag the slider, notice that the playback position in the audio track does not change, even though you can move the position of the slider. Press power button to turn screen off. Press power button to turn screen on, notice that the slider has now jumped to the real position of playback in the audio track. Slider disappears when paused Expected behaviour: Lock screen slider always stays visible or at least reappears when play is re-started. Current behaviour: Lock screen slider disappears when the audio is paused. It does not reappear when play is restarted. It does reappear when the display is turned off and then back on. First occured: Current version after switching from a Samsung S3 mini to the S5 mini Steps to reproduce: Press power button to view lock screen Touch the pause button, notice the slider disappears. Touch the play button, notice that the slider does not reappear. Press power button to turn screen off. Press power button to turn screen on, notice that the slider has now reappeared. Environment: I am not sure if I was using Prestissimo. It was installed but the Use built-in sonic media player . . . was checked in the settings. I uninstalled Prestissimo, restarted and retested, results were the same.
Manager.title: Lockscreen Controls - Position in audio does not change when dragging slider and slider disappears when paused

Manager.description: Feature request: It would be great if we could rename feeds - sometimes they have long names which do not fit into the sidebar.
Manager.title: Allow renaming feeds

Manager.description: App version: 1.5.2.0 (from Google Play) Android version: Cyanogenmod 11 (unofficial) Devide model: Samsung Grand Duos i9082 Expected behaviour: should sync subscriptions, cancellations of subscriptions and downloaded / played episodes Current behaviour: initial subscriptions sync works, however subsequent new subscriptions/cancellations as well as downloads/plays don't seem to be propagated across devices. While the gpodder.net websites lists a certain podcast as subscribed on a particular device, antenna pod shows no such subscription, I have marked most episodes as listened to but an other device also with antenna pod, synced with it through gpodder shows hundreds of unlistened episodes. First occured: Version 1.x / about x days/weeks ago Since I first tried, which was some days ago.
Manager.title: gpodder sync not working correctly

Manager.description: App version: 1.5.2.0 (from Google Play), already had the issue in 1.4.2.2 Android version: 6.1 Device model: LG Nexus 5X Expected behaviour: On the "Episodes" Screen I click on the refresh button to check whether new episodes of my podcasts are available. In the status bar Antenna Pod shows a shrinking number of how many feeds still must be updated. After all feeds are updated it shows the message "processing downloads" and after this is closed all new episodes are shown in the "Episodes" Screen. Current behaviour: My feeds are not updated with this refresh function. Nevertheless an update on each feed still works. The message "processing downloads" persists. It seems to do something in the background all the time, because my battery is drained. The only chance to get rid of this is to kill Antenna Pod. First occured: Version 1.4.2.2 / about 4-6 weeks ago/ I'm using Antenna Pod since beginning of year 2016. I already had the same problem in the end of January. I reinstalled Antenna Pod (which fixed the problem). About 4 weeks later, it appeared again. A week later I had no problem anymore, now it appears again. Steps to reproduce: It happens every time I update my feeds. Before it happened the first time, this issue did not occure. I didn't change settings in-between. Environment: I'm using Prestissimo. No Auto-download, Auto-update feeds once a day. Stacktrace/Logcat: The way it described in this wiki, I couldn't get it to work on my phone.
Manager.title: Feed refresh not working properly

Manager.description: edit: 04-Apr-2016 @keunes proposed to start a new issue thread in #1795. So this is what I did. App version: 1.5.2.0 (Google Play) Android version 6.0.1 | Cyanogenmod 13 Devide model Samsung Galaxy S4 | GT-I9505 General information Syncing of podcasts feeds and the current (play/pause) state of one or more episode(s) when pressing the update button in episodes and inside the tab "all". All devices devices, the cell phone mentioned above, and a tablet (Sony Xperia Z4 tablet same AP version from GooglePlay and Stock Rom Android 6.0 (not sure about the version, can't check right know) are registered in gpodder as cell phone. The devices have also the same subscriptions (small icons of a cell phone on the right of each row for each podcast feed listed in the gpodder website). Expected behaviour 1) After starting to stream an episode on the smart phone I pressed play/pause. The expectation is, that AntennaPod is starting the synchronization to gpodder. 2) After that I expected to make an update of all feeds (as described above) on the tablet to get the latest feeds updates and the updates from gpodder regarding the play/pause on the same episode. 3) If I'm marking an episodes manually as played, or if I'm using the gear wheels symbol inside of a podcast feed, I expected that this state of listened/played episodes will be synced to all devices as well Current behaviour Syncing to gpodder is very unstable at all. Sometimes the update is working for new subscriptions. If any new subscription has been added with the podlove plugin on a website, this is mostly working as well. Any edit (e.g. delete of an podcast feed on a Android device) it's not syncing with gpodder. So the change is not present on the website of gpodder or any device. to 1) After starting to stream an episode on e.g. the smart phone (e.g. pressing play/pause), in the status line appears very often the following failure message. German (original message) 1st row | gpodder.net Synchronisierungsfehler 2nd row | Ein Fehler ist beim Synchronisieren aufgetreten: jav.. -> There is nothing else to read English (translated message) 1st row | gpodder.net Synchronization failure 2nd row | A failure occurred during syncing: jav.. -> There is nothing else to read to 2) Same behaviour for the second point as described here in section to 1). to 3) It's not working at all First occured I don't know. It never worked at all. Steps to reproduce See above Environment Tests within wireless LAN connection. Bluetooth off Did the gpodder integration ever worked? Is there a possibility to see more of the failure instead this short message? For that reason I also asked for the pod.care support #1776.
Manager.title: gpodder sync failure

Manager.description: In the 'PodDBAdapter.java', I see we have listed all the table field names as constants grouped together. It is very hard to understand the DB structure in this way. Wouldn't it be great if we group these so that by reading the code itself, I can imagine the database? To implement this, we could create a static final class which we call PodDBContracts.java. In this file, corresponding to each table, we can create a static inner class which will have that table's field as constant strings. It would make the code more readable and maintainable. Please let me know if this is a welcome contribution right now. I would be happy to send a PR! Thanks, Harshita
Manager.title: Optimizations in PodDBAdapter.java

Manager.description: Note: I report this because the timing leads me to believe my issue may be related to AntennaPod, but that’s just a hypothesis and I’not blaming AntennaPod in any way :-) App version: 1.5.2 (from F-Store) Android version: 4.4.2 Devide model: Samsung Galaxy S5 mini Expected behaviour: Current behaviour: First occured: Version 5.1.2 (I think) / about 3 weeks ago This happened to me manually downloading a couple of podcasts. The first two succeeded ; the third one failed with (if memory serves me right) the downloading log mentioning « Wrong EOF » or something. After that, my SD card cannot be mounted by Android as it is « blank or unrecognized filesystem ». (I’ll be okay ; once I get hold of a SD adapter I will try to mount it on a laptop and run fschk or something. :) I’m afraid I cannot give more details on the AntennaPod side as I am now experiencing #1865. Then again, this might just be unrelated timing, or the AntennaPod download failure might have been the consequence rather than the cause of the unreadable filesystem. Thanks :)

Manager.title: Swipe gestures in episode details - description not updated

Manager.description: Dear developers of AntennaPod, I am a student majoring in Computer Science. We are trying to collect existing bug reports and fixes of bugs caused by specific devices to help detect and fix similar bugs of other active applications. We have detected that in your app, method setSupportActionBar of android support library v7 is used in many activities. However, we have observed that invoking this method on some Samsung devices running 4.2 system will crash your app. We have found discussions in in the bug tracking system of Android: here. as well as a stack overflow question: appcompat-v7 v21.0.0 causing crash on Samsung devices with Android v4.2.2 A suggested fix for it is to add -keep class !android.support.v7.internal.view.menu.**,** {*;} to the proguard rules. I have seen the opposite rule to keep all the classes in android.support.v7 in your proguard file. Thank you vey much. Hope this information is useful for you.
Manager.title: Threats of Crash on some Samsung devices

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: All episodes: Indicate that an episode is played

Manager.description: Developers of AntennaPod, Hi, I have found that AsyncTask.execute has been used in many places, like 3 times in GpodnetAuthenticationActivity, one time in AudioplayerActivity, etc. However, this API slows down if multiple tasks are being executed on devices with system version higher than 3.0 because AsyncTasks started by this API are executed serially on a single background thread for systems newer than 3.0. (This is found in the API guide) It will help to improve the performance by changing execute to executeOnExecutor to enable real multi-thread execution. Thanks a lot.
Manager.title: Performance Issue of AsyncTask.execute

Manager.description:
Dear AntennaPod Developers, I am implementing a hang-bug detection tool and I am analyzing AntennaPod with it (master version downloaded yesterday). I tested the app with a Nexus 4 (Android 5.1) and Huawei P8 Lite (Android 4.4). I found that the main thread of Antennapod calls: android.database.sqlite.SQLiteCursor.getCount and android.app.SharedPreferencesImpl$EditorImpl.commit frequently when subscribing and opening podcasts. In particular, the above APIs are called as consequence of the two following calls: 1) de.danoeh.antennapod.activity.MainActivity.saveLastNavFragment -> android.app.SharedPreferencesImpl$EditorImpl.commit
2) de.danoeh.antennapod.core.storage.DBReader.getQueueIDList -> android.database.sqlite.SQLiteCursor.getCount In my experiments, the execution of those functions on the main thread may be the main cause of the eye-detectable delays (i.e., hang-bug) experienced with AntennaPod. As the developers guide of Android suggests, moving work off the main thread leads to higher responsiveness of the app. It is actually possible to move those two operations off the main thread using background threads. Therefore, do you think that the smoothness of the app would improve by executing those functions off the main thread? Thanks for any information, I hope I can help improve AntennaPod. 👍 2
Manager.title: Possible causes of Hang-Bugs Found

Manager.description: App version: 1.5.2.0 (from Google Play) Android version: 6.0.1 (Stock unrooted) Devide model: Nexus 6 Expected behaviour: Request refresh all feeds --> notification appears indicating synchronization status: downloading podcast data, processing downloads, complete --> notification disappears Current behaviour: Request refresh all feeds --> notification appears indicating synchronization status: downloading podcast data, processing downloads --> notification does not progress past "Downloading podcast data: processing downloads", i.e. remains there indefinitely Notification only disappears if the app is Force Stopped through the settings menu (or if the device is powered off) Notification does not persist if only a single feed is refreshed (i.e. navigate to a single feed --> press refresh feed --> notification appears and disappears normally) First occured: Version 1.5.1.4 (maybe??? either 1.5.1.4 or 1.5.2.0) Steps to reproduce: Open AntennaPod Navigate to "Episodes" section using menu Press Refresh Grab some popcorn and watch Notification remains for minutes/hours/days Environment: Nothing unusual. Happens regardless of devices connected, etc. Of note, gpodder.net sync has not worked for me at all. However, logging out of gpodder.net/disabling does not resolve the problem. Stacktrace/Logcat: Nada. Sorry :/
Manager.title: Podcast download notification persists indefinitely

Manager.title: Chromecast: playing a video episode when casting crashes AP

Manager.description: Swiping episodes out of the New Episodes list removes them and claims to mark them as played, but doesn't actually mark them as played in the list for the podcast they are part of. App version: 1.5.2.0 (from F-Droid) Android version: 6.0 Device model: Sony Xperia Z5 Compact, US model Expected behaviour: Swiping the episodes should mark them as played in the full list for the podcast instead of just removing them from the "New Episodes" list and they should not add to the count in the sidebar menu Current behaviour: Swiping the episode removes it from the New Episode list and posts a notice saying it has been marked as played, but it still shows up in the count of unplayed episodes and as unplayed in the list for the podcast. First occured: Not certain. I only recently noticed swiping was an option to mark as played. Steps to reproduce: Swipe an episode (left or right) from the New Episodes list This removes it from the New Episodes lists and notifies me that it is marked as played with an option to undo. If I open the left sidebar the removed episode still shows up in the unplayed count for the podcast (regardless of which feed) If I click on the feed from which I swiped the episode away, the swiped episode still shows up as unplayed (not greyed out) in that list.
Manager.title: New Episodes swiped from list to mark as played still show as unplayed in full list by podcast

Manager.description: App version: 1.5.2.0 from F-Store (issue was noticed in earlier versions too) Android version: 6.0.1 cyanodenmod (issue was noticed on earlier versions too) Devide model: moto g 2015 (and other devices) Expected behaviour: As a user i selected a podcast and click "stream" to hear (and stream) a full episode without interruption. Current behaviour: Podcast will start to stream but interrupts after 10-25minutes. The player does not show any infos about the current podcast. Podcast is marked as read and any information about last position is lost. First occured: +12month ago Steps to reproduce: Just select a podcast and click stream. If its a longer podcast it will stop streaming after some time. Stacktrace/Logcat: nothing displayed. do i have to enable something beside running aLogcat in background? Is there anything more i can deliver to localize the putative bug?
Manager.title: Stream on longer podcast interrupts after some time (and looses play history)

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.0.6 (from Google Play/F-Store/Custom build) Android version: CyanogenMod 13 Devide model: T999L Expected behaviour: audio clip is downloaded Current behaviour: download is refused First occured: noticed about 3-5 days ago Steps to reproduce: Try downloading any recent episode from https://feeds.feedburner.com/TEDTalks_audio Download fails with "File Type Error"
Manager.title: Can't download TEDTalks

Manager.description: App version: 1.5.2.0 (from F-Droid) Android version: 4.x Expected behaviour: I've set automatic update of feeds every 1 hour (shortest interval). Since I usually have wifi turned off, I would expect that antennapod updates feeds when I turn on the wifi, if at least 1 hour has passed since last update. Current behaviour: antennapod doesn't update when I turn on the wifi network; I have to update feeds manually. Is there a way to have automatic update as soon as a network connection is available? Or have I misunderstood this feature?
Manager.title: Automatic update when network available

Manager.description: App version: 1.5.2 from F-Droid Android version: 6.0.1, Cyanogenmod Device model: Wileyfox Swift Expected behaviour: When returning to AntennaPod, the detail view and the chapters list should be at the same scroll position as it was when I switched away to another app. Current behaviour: Detail view and chapters list scroll back to the top when returning to AntennaPod Steps to reproduce: Open details view (2nd/middle view) of a podcast Scroll down Click on a link; the browser opens Go back to AntennaPod Scroll position is the beginning of details Same for the chapters (3rd/righ view) of a podcast: Open chapter list of a podcast Scroll down Switch to another app Switch back to AntennaPod List is scrolled to beginning Also happens when rotating screen: Open chapter list of a podcast Rotate phone from vertical to horizontal List is scrolled to beginning Related to #1409 and #551.
Manager.title: Scroll position in detail and chapters view not persisted

Manager.description: With atom feeds AntennaPod currently loads the image from the logo element. However the atom RFC states logo should be a 2:1 image and icon a 1:1. I think the easiest thing to do would be try to load the image from icon first and then fall back to logo when in the atom NS. Somewhere in this file. However it might be better to allow multiple images in a feed. Then the two images in feeditemlist_header/ItemlistFragment could be different and not just a blurry stretched version of the same image. 👍 1
Manager.title: Atom image

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.0.7 (from Google Play) Android version: 6.0.1 [CyanogenMod 13.0] Devide model: OnePlus One - bacon Expected behaviour: When using my Headphones pressing the Play/Pause Button should pause/resume playback in the CyanogeMods default Music App Current behaviour: As soon as I install AntennaPod the Media Buttons do not work in the MusicPlayer. Steps to reproduce: I think the problem lies in this part of the AndroidManifest.xml file: https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/develop/core/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml#L31 android:exported="true"> As soon as I start AntennaPod this line gets added to data/system/users/0/settings_secure.xml
Manager.title: AntennaPod disables Media Buttons for CyanogenMod's MusicPlayer

Manager.description: Hi! Please provide a version, which does not depend on non-free components like google-play services or flattr. Otherwise f-droid cannot build recent versions. Maybe cou could add a f-droid branch.
Manager.title: Provide free version for f-droid builts

Manager.description: My statistics are pretty low numbers so I checked a few feeds. Now I notice that a podcast which I played yesterday for about ten minutes has "0,0" as played hour time (while according to my search engine 10 minutes = 0,16 hours). Also another podcast which I played for a couple of hours only has 0,7 hours as a statistic. I'll keep an eye on it to see if I can find a pattern. App version: 1.6.0.7 (Google Play alpha channel) Android version: FPOS 1.3.6 // 5.1 Devide model: FP2
Manager.title: Statistics doesn't record

Manager.description: I already found the problem, PR incoming.
Manager.title: Filtered feed lists take forever to load

Manager.description: See https://f-droid.org/posts/get-it-on-f-droid-badges/. 👍 2
Manager.title: Use new F-Droid badge

Manager.description: This always confuses me until I figure out the the entry is currently playing but paused. Have one entry in the queue Start playing it, then pause Go to the queue and try to remove the entry by long pressing on the list item Excepted: I can remove the entry from the queue Happening: The remove from queue menu item is missing
Manager.title: Allow removing an entry from the queue that is currently playing

Manager.description: A small suggestion: When looking at a track that is downloaded there are two buttons on top "Play" and "Remove". I'd suggest to renamed "Remove" to "Delete File" as it's not clear if the action will remove the whole entry or when coming from the queue it it removes it from the queue etc. 👍 1
Manager.title: "Remove" button in track view ambiguous

Current behaviour: 3-4 pushes of the button are needed to get to turn the screen on again while Antennapod is open and a podcast is playing. Moto Display is also not working. First occured: Like 2-3 weeks ago. Steps to reproduce: Play podcast Lock screen and let it play for a bit Push the power button to wake the phone. Environment: I thought it had to do with persistent playback controls so I turned them off, also turned off the lockscreen background. The issue persist. Every other setting is still the default.
Manager.title: Screenlock wake up failing

Manager.description: Hi Can we please get regular builds or regular nightly builds for those who do not have Gplay? thanks 👍 1
Manager.title: FR: Regular Builds

Manager.description: I would like for episodes that are "Marked as Played" to be easily visible when looking at the Completed Downloads list. I think the best way of doing this is for the played episodes to be grayed out, just like they are when looking at the podcast feed list. I would appreciate the chance to work on this feature. When choosing which episode to listen to, I primarily choose episodes to listen to from the Completed Downloads list. This allows me to access all the episodes I have currently downloaded, from various podcasts, all on one screen. I also use this screen to delete episodes I have already listened to. Being able to quickly see what is "Marked as Played" will allow me to avoid accidentally replaying episodes that I already listened and to quickly delete the ones I've already heard. I recognize that there is probably a better way for me to do this using the queue and the auto delete function, but this is just how I've been doing it and I think this feature would be useful for people like me.
Manager.title: Indicate "Marked as Played" episodes in Completed Downloads list

Manager.description: Some audio files are not playable with the default player. So it would awesome if there an option to select podcast file and append to the queue of an alternative audio player (playlist) instead of play it with the default player (at the moment "sonic player" or "Prestissimo"). Maybe as an another entry in list like the "set as favorite", "visit webpage", "flattrn", ... "send to VLC playlist queue" or some thing. App version: 1..5.2.0 (from F-Store) Android version: 5.1.1 Devide model: Tablet Expected behaviour: Podcast file sent to an alternative player playlist queue. Current behaviour: Open another player and search manual on SD-Card (.../data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files/). Steps to reproduce: Menue -> Episodes -> (hold an entry) -> view the options of selected file (there would be a nice place for a "send to player..." or "play with ..."
Manager.title: Feature Request: Add audio files to the queue of an alternative audio player (playlist)

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.0.9 (from Google Play) Expected behaviour: Download episode Current behaviour: Download says "File Type Error" Steps to reproduce: Add podcast "El Mundo del Spectrum" from http://feeds.feedburner.com/ElMundoDelSpectrumPodcast. Download any of the first episodes (at least from first season, 1x01, for example). It will fail. However, download of last episodes (4x*) work ok. Hi, I've tried many things to see why I can't download some episodes from this podcast before posting this issue to make it more constructive, but I'm not sure which url uses AntennaPod to download them, so I'm afraid I can't help too much. The only difference I could see between a working episode and the others are that the content of the problematic ones uses ISO-8859-1 charset, not UTF8, but shouldn't Android internally take care about the encoding? To verify if the episodes were really available I've tried another closed sourced podcast client and it could download those episodes without problems, so maybe we can find a workaround. I've read some of the issues around here and maybe the PR at #1938 is related. Should I try the nightly apk? Thanks for your help.
Manager.title: Can't download some episodes from specific podcast

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.0.9 Android version: 6.0.1 Devide model: Nexus 5 Expected behaviour: When downloading, a notification should appear in the notifications area saying that the download is in progress, then either say downloading is complete or disappear (I don't know which because it doesn't get there - see below) Current behaviour: The notification appears for about 0.5 seconds, saying "0 downloads" (or similar - it disappears too fast to read), then disappears, then reappears immediately and continues indefinitely until I go into Settings > Apps > AntennaPod and force stop. First occurred: About 6 months ago Steps to reproduce: Connect to WiFi Wait for AntennaPod to sync Environment: Update interval set to 07:00 each morning Automatic download enabled, including when not charging, no WiFi filter Stacktrace/Logcat: Not available
Manager.title: Download notification repeatedly flashing

Manager.description: Instead of removing subscriptions one by one, it would be convenient to remove all the subscriptions all at once (if you have many subscriptions). Feature request: Add a menu option to remove all subscriptions. Menu option could be located in the top-right corner of the "Subscriptions" view. Note that "Subscriptions" might be hidden from the navigation drawer. Add a dialog, asking the user if he/she is sure to delete all episodes (and the feeds for this device from gpodder).
Manager.title: Option to remove all subscriptions

Manager.description: App version: 1.x (from Google Play/F-Store/Custom build) F-droid Android version: 5.x [Please mention if you are using a custom rom!] 5.1.1 Devide model: Samsung Note Expected behaviour: Working proxy I put my working Privoxy proxy in the setting and pres test and all I am getting is "test failed:null". When I watch the logcat for activity, I see no activity when I press the test button. Nothing is printed afterwards as if Apod is not doing anything except "D/WifiWatchdogStateMachine(20590): isPackageRunning - top:de.danoeh.antennapod.activity.PreferenceActivity ". I am not sure if there is a way to debug the proxy here. My proxy works in my browsers. Maybe there should also another buttong that just says "save" so the user can save regardless of what this testing is trying to do. I suspect that it is trying to connect to some google ip to do some testing. thanks
Manager.title: Test failed:null with proxy

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.1.2 (from Google Play) Android version: 6.0.1 Expected behaviour: AntennaPod should show the name of the podcast along with the episode title in the playlist. Current behaviour: AntennaPod only shows the episode title. Many podcasts don't have their name included in the episode titles. When these podcasts have episode-specific thumbnails (or very similar thumbs), it is hard to see what podcast the episode belongs to. It would help, if the name of the podcast would also be displayed.
Manager.title: Show podcasts name in playlist

Manager.description: I just noticed that it is now possible to participate in Beta testing directly from within the Play Store app. These apps will then show up in a 3rd "beta" tab. But it seems these feature must be enabled by the developer. Do you consider to do so?
Manager.title: Beta Tester in Play Store

Manager.description: When in the Episodes pane, it is difficult to discern which feed some episodes come from if the feed tends to use different images for each epispde. For example, Planet Money's episode image illustrates the episode topic. Expected behaviour is to put the feed name for each episode somewhere in the Episodes list. Downside would then be duplicate/superfluous information when an episode name already incorporates the feed name.
Manager.title: Feed name should be visible in Episodes pane

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.1.2 from Google Play Android version: 5.1 Devide model: Ulefone Power but does not matter because most devices will never see an update to Android 6 where this problem does not exist. Expected behaviour: play opus files Current behaviour: Does not play opus files. Currently nobody cares for Android 6 or later because most devices will never see an update to Android 6. First occured: unknown but already mentioned in #392 and #267 Steps to reproduce: use https://alternativlos.org/opus.rss to get opus feed try to play one of the podcasts Environment: Works neither with Prestissimo nor with integrated Sonic Mediaplayer Stacktrace/Logcat: none
Manager.title: Opus suppport for Android 5 and earlier

Manager.description: Dear all, I just discovered Antenna Pod and just love its clean interface, thank you! However, I encountered one problem on my Fairphone FP1 with Android 4.2.2. Sometimes, the last playback position at which I stopped the playback, is not correctly being remembered. This means that upon resume, the playback cursor jumps back to an older position. Can someone confirm this behaviour? Thankfully, ~Robert
Manager.title: Playback position not always being remembered

Manager.description: If I set the sleep timer to 5 minutes, if I keep it awake by shaking, the next timer expires 15 minutes later, not 5 minutes as I'd expect. Android 6.0.1 on Nexus5X. 👍 1
Manager.title: Sleep timer is 15 minutes after first resume

Manager.description: Hi everybody, I installed AntennaPod on my Nvidia Shield TV (newest updates) two days ago and love everything about it except for the fact that I can't get the auto downloads to work. The feeds work, I have a couple of episodes that got the new label and are part of the episodes menu, I have activated auto downloads and everything but nothing get's ever added to the download queue. The only error I can see is that I am using an external hard drive as my internal storage and AntennaPod is showing "/storage/emulated/0 [Error free]" when I want to select the main download folder. However, I can manually download episodes with AntennaPod so this seems kind of working anyway and other podcatchers are auto downloading just fine (just don't want to use them because they work with weird filenames). I would be very happy if anyone could give me a hint on how to fix that or if this is something I have to live with. Best regards, Theo.
Manager.title: Auto Download not working (on Ethernet connection)

Manager.description: App version: 9d5d350 (custom build) Devices: Galaxy S5 (G900P), Android 6.0.1 (CyanogenMod) AVD Nexus 5X, Android 6.0.1 Current behaviour: MediaplayerActivity launches, but the screen stays completely blank (no content is displayed) First occured: [bfe7cad] Add preliminary support for Android Auto by changing PlaybackService to extend MediaBrowserServiceCompat. Allows playback from queue and basic control using Android Auto. Steps to reproduce: Try to stream an episode of any podcast Environment: Issue persists on clean installation in virtual machine Stacktrace/Logcat: https://gist.github.com/mateoeh/1a0912433105afeb44a3ba027e799306
Manager.title: MediaplayerActivity fails to load

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.1.2 (from F-Store) Android version: 6.0.1 (CM13) Devide model: Sony Xperia M Some podcasts, e.g. 'Naked Security - Sophos' contain both audio pieces as well as pieces that are just links to articles on their blog. In this particular one the ratio is easily 1:10 and it clutters the Episodes list quite a lot. I can dismiss them by hitting the check-mark on the right hand side of the item, but it's getting tiresome. It'd be great to have a way to only show/allow the audio/video pieces in the Episodes list. Personally I'd prefer to have this on by default as I only use AntennaPod for audio/video content, but perhaps someone finds these new blog entry announcements useful(?). Koen suggests addition of 'Has media' to the filter options: https://groups.google.com/d/msg/antennapod/YUMvVzxm-RE/LRtNQDagBAAJ
Manager.title: Need a way to see only media content of a podcast

Manager.description: An enhancement request after reading #2080: now the refresh spinner (animation) in the episodes app bar restarts upon every feed that is being updated, meaning that it flashes every three seconds or so. Would be nice if it would keep running continuously until all feeds have been updated.
Manager.title: Start update animation once

Manager.description: Streaming causes the playback buttons, including the notification player, to act sporadically and unreliably when the playback speed isn't 1x. The conclusion I drew from this is that the app itself must be buggy, so for a while I switched. I lated realized that other podcast apps do not even allow the user to have playback control during streaming, probably for this very reason. I understand that fixing the streaming issue might not be a priority, but adding this warning, at least the first time the user attempts this, will probably get more users to stick with the app instead of concluding it must be all around buggy.
Manager.title: Add warning before streaming

Manager.description: Feature request: I think it might be useful for some people (including me) to have a setting for a sleep timer which is active always when you start playback of an episode because at least I often forget to enable a sleep timer in the evening and when I wake up in the morning my half queue has been played. This could be set in the global settings. I don't think it would be too annoying to press play again when I want to listen for a longer time, for example in a train.
Manager.title: optionally enable the sleep timer always when playing episodes

Manager.description: I think there are a lot of configuration options that could be added to the download logic, and a lot of them would be useful per-podcast. per feed limit. per feed order (for story like podcasts I want the oldest unplayed) Global limit.
Manager.title: Per podcast download settings

Manager.description: Hello, I don't want some podcasts to be automatically downloaded. I prefer cherry pick some episodes. So it will be great if we could disable auto downloading at a podcast level. An implementation could be, long press on a podcast, in the menu that appear tap on "disable auto downloading". Thanks !
Manager.title: Feature Request: Disable auto downloading at a podcast level

Manager.description: Hello, Sometimes you want to listen your podcasts in a particular order but right now it's now easy. Indeed you only can move an episode at the top or the bottom of the list. So it will be great if we could manually choose the order of the playback list. An implementation could be, long press on an episode, move it wherever you want in the list, release it. Thanks !
Manager.title: Feature Request: Manually sort episodes

Manager.description: I am trying to change the theme of the app but it is kind of not working tried changing the colors of the theme in styles file and it still shows the same white actionbar and nothing has changed 😟
Manager.title: Changing theme

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.1.2 (from Google Play/F-Store) Current behaviour: "New" view is cleared instantly Expected behaviour: app should ask for confirmation before making this change Steps to reproduce: Load any number of items in Episodes/New Press "Mark all as seen" in the overflow/hamburger menu
Manager.title: "Mark all as seen" should ask for confirmation

Manager.description: Hi It looks like the side panel subscription listing is sorted based on the number of episodes and there is no way to change that behavior. It would be greta if we could set things based on alphabetical order, connection problems etc. I am using the F-droid version. thanks
Manager.title: FR: Setting for changing the sorting for the side panel listing

Manager.description: Using Android 6.0 here. I noticed that the MediaStyle notification is not actually triggered. This has two effects on the user experience: The large album art in notifications, which looks like this, is not triggered. The podcast's album art doesn't become my wallpaper when I'm listening to a podcast. I found the reason that this was not triggering: MediaStyle notification only supports up to 3 actions in standard-size view aka contentView (and up to 5 in bigContentView). (See MediaStyle documentation.) The app is currently attempting to display 4 actions in contentView: rewind, pause, fast-forward, and skip. I verified, by testing, that reducing the number of actions to 3 does indeed trigger both large album art and album art as wallpaper. Should we change the behavior of the app so that MediaStyle is triggered properly? If so, we should reduce the number of action buttons. Which action buttons should we remove?
Manager.title: Large MediaStyle notification (with large album on left) is not triggered

Manager.description: Every Episode from Logbuch:Netzpolitik lets AntannoPod crash. I added the podcast via the Itunes search but I can confirm the behaviour when getting it via Gpodder. Both playing a downloaded episode and the streaming option let AntennaPod die on me. I tried it out with the latest 3 episodes, I guess it's the same for all of them. App version: 1.6.1.2 (F-Droid) Android version: 5.1.1 (Cyanogenmod: 12.1-20160314-NIGHTLY-osprey) Devide model: Motorola Moto G3
Manager.title: Antennapod dies when trying to play an episode of "Logbuch:Netzpolitik"

Manager.description: Version 1.6.1.2 from Google Play Store Android 6.0.1 Samsung Galaxy S5 Neo Expected behaviour: Downloads should continue when I switch to another app or lock the screen. Current behaviour: Downloads stop when doing either of these action. Have to restart the download to continue from last download state. Happens for me with the current version since I used it. Steps to reproduce: Start Download of podcast Lock screen Changed no settings and didn't find any to configure that behaviour. Thanks for that app!
Manager.title: Download stops when switching to other app

Manager.description: I tried to use "Set Lockscreen Buttons" setting (provided by #1843 I believe) to show rewind and fast-forward buttons on Lockscreen, but it had no effect: the lock screen still shows the "default" pause and skip buttons. I also tried restarting the phone (in case settings are cached), but it has no effect either. App version: 1.6.1.2 Android version: 4.1.2 Devide model: Samsung Galaxy Exhibit SGH-T599N Environment: Default Stacktrace/Logcat:
Manager.title: Set Lockscreen buttons setting does not work

Manager.description: This feature request is somewhat related to #1077 (Option to auto download oldest episode first). The use case is this: A podcast that is "low-priority" that I do not want to download it until I have time to listen. Furthermore, the podcast is serial in nature, so it does not make much sense to listen to the latest episode without first catching up on the older ones. If I can disable auto download on the specific podcast, I can then go to podcast screen and download specific episodes (the oldest unplayed ones) when I have time to listen. Thoughts? How to implement: On the podcast screen, add there is an additional menu item for settings (for the podcast) a new settings "pop-in" screen can allow the users to disable auto download.
Manager.title: Option to disable auto download on specific podcast

Manager.description: I subscribe to a daily podcast that has each episode of about 140 MB. I had previously requested to have an option to keep only one episode as minimum but it was rejected and the minimum number of episodes to keep is 5. I have enabled the option to delete an episode when it has finished but quite often I don't have the time to watch the podcast on a daily basis. Consequently I see the exclamation mark next to Download every few days and the automatic download stops. I have to manually delete the last 3-4 episodes before the automatic download process restores. The only "cache" option i see in settings is for image setting which I have set to max, 500 MB. Can you please propose a solution to the frequent overloading of the cache? Thank you for a great app! Edit: Sorry, should have added this earlier - Can a per subscription cache option can be included for future, as solution to my issue? thanks.
Manager.title: Per subscription cache option

Manager.description: I subscribe to a daily podcast that has each episode of about 140 MB. I had previously requested to have an option to keep only one episode as minimum but it was rejected and the minimum number of episodes to keep is 5. I have enabled the option to delete an episode when it has finished but quite often I don't have the time to watch the podcast on a daily basis. Consequently I see the exclamation mark next to Download every few days and the automatic download stops. Can you please propose a solution to the frequent overloading of the cache? Thank you for a great app!
Manager.title: Frequently running out of cache

Manager.title: about.html contains wrong year

Manager.description: If I listen to an episode and it ends, AntennaPod stops playing. Looking at the "Recently played" list, there is the episode that just ended, PLUS the episode that was below it in the queue, even though that one was obviously not played. Expected behavior: Just add episodes that have actually been started (by manually tapping the play icon or by the auto-play feature) Use-case: I delete played episodes after some time (when I'm sure I don't need them anymore). When doing this, I just scroll through the "Recently played" list. It is quite confusing that nearly every second episode appearing there has never been played.
Manager.title: Unplayed episodes appear in "Recently played" list

Manager.description: Sometime happens that one device have a delayed upload of episode action, but the others is already synced, then will be this event never synced, except i delete all date of the app and start from Scratch it is like the http://gpoddernet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/reference/events.html#get-episode-actions "since" parameter is set to a newer timestamp so older event from a delayed upload will be ignored. possible solution in gpodder menu additional to the sync now button, a new one for full sync (ignoring the since parameter) or maybe as long press... App version: 1.6.1.2 Android version: 6 .01 /6 .0.1cm13 ZNH5YA Devide model:nexus 9 /one plus one
Manager.title: gpodder force full sync

Manager.description: Since some weeks, after i press the button for seek new podcast updates, the app shows still the update icon and does not go away. I have to start the "App-Info" and then "ENFORCE FINISH" (Sorry for my bad english :/ ) App version: 1.6.1.2 (from F-Droid) Android version: 6.0.1 [Cyanogenmod 13.0-20160910-NIGHTLY-condor] Devide model: Motorola Moto E Expected behaviour: Updating icon should go away after update podcasts Current behaviour: updating icon does not go away after loading podcasts First occured: ca some weeks ago Steps to reproduce: press in Antennapod the update button PS: it also occur with newest cm-13.0-20160914-NIGHTLY-condor.zip 👍 1
Manager.title: update icon does not go away after loading podcasts

Manager.description: With RSS the feed description tag only allows plain text, but the equivalent in Atom is subtitle and that does allow HTML. In AntennaPod it gets parsed correctly, but when being viewed on either FeedInfo or OnlineFeedView activities it is just displayed in a textview. The best solution would be to render it in both places, I tried to do that but I don't understand the system in AntennaPod for displaying shownotes. If I could have, I would have done another pull request. The easier but more disappointing thing to do would be to trim the HTML like you do in the OnlineFeedViewActivity for shownotes.
Manager.title: HTML not rendered

Manager.description: A radio show I listen updates the podcast rss before the airing adding an item with info about the upcoming episode but, obviously, without an url of the show. the link, enclosure, guid tags looks like this:
Manager.title: Auto-download loop on download error

Manager.description: See https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/antennapod/oIucXvdjruE
Manager.title: Show downloaded episodes in subscription counter

Manager.description: This enhancement adds two preference settings to the application preferences to control the delta when clicking fast forward of rewind. Currently these values can be changed by long pressing on the fast forward/rewind button, but this is somewhat hard to discover. This enhancement adds these preferences to the "Settings" view. 👍 1
Manager.title: [Proposed Enhancement] Preference settings to customize fastforward and rewind delta

Manager.description: Quite a few pull requests fail: I believe the build failures are specific to CircleCI, rather than the files changed. What could be done about it? Thanks. The affected pull requests include (at least): #2119, #2117, #2130, #2096 ... CircleCI errors: Your build has exceeded the memory limit of 4G on 1 container. The results of this build are likely invalid. We have taken a snapshot of the memory usage at the time, which you can find in a build artifact named memory-usage.txt. The RSS column in this file shows the amount of memory used by each process, measured in kilobytes.
Manager.title: CircleCI builds fail intermittently

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.1.2 (from Google Play) Android version: 6.0 Expected behaviour: Only one feed file per subscription in the files/cache directory. Current behaviour: If you have two subscriptions that share the same name, then every time the feeds are downloaded, the file "feed-${PODCASTNAME}" is updated and a file named "feed-${PODCASTNAME}-${I++}." is added to files/cache wasting many megabytes after a while. If you have three subscriptions with the same name, two additional files are created. If you have four, three ... TIA for fixing!

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.1.2 (from F-Droid) Android version: 6.0.1 Device model: Nexus 6 Expected behaviour: Pause, Jump Forward (30 s), Playback Speed buttons in the 'Now Playing' window and notification window do their intended function Current behaviour: The jump forward button work from one to a dozen times and then stops working, additionally the pause button stops working. This means if the audio is playing I need to Force Stop the app. The buttons do give the animation effect that they are being pressed when I tap them even though they do not work. First occured: At least 3 months ago, I believe even longer. Steps to reproduce: Open app Press play beside an item in the queue Press the jump forward button 1-12 times None of these buttons (jump forward, pause) work anymore Note that it seems I can pause and play the podcast many times and that it is only the jump forward button that causes this problem. I have tried multiple podcasts that all have this effect. I am not sure if it is related, but the playback speed should change when I tap it but it does not. When I long press it, I can see I have selected the speeds I want but tapping it does not cycle through them. Environment: Nothing special Thanks!

Manager.description:
App version: 1.6.2.2 (from F-Droid) Android version: 4.2.2 Device model: Samsung Phone Expected behaviour: antennapod should not crash :) Current behaviour: as soon as I upgraded from 1.6.2.1 to 1.6.2.2, antennapod started crashing very often, with the popup message "Unfortunately antennapod has stopped". Sometimes it happens right after starting the app. Sometimes it happens right after pressing play on a podcast episode: the episode keeps playing in the background, but it stops as soon as I click "OK" to dismiss the popup message "Unfortunately... etc". Sometimes I can listen to a podcast, but it crashes right after I try to listen to a different episode. I never experienced this behaviour in any previous release; they all worked OK up to (and including) 1.6.2.1. I didn't make any changes to my configuration. (BTW, unfortunately it's not possible to downgrade directly from 1.6.2.2 to 1.6.2.1, the install procedure in F-Droid exits with an error; so one has to uninstall the app, and re-install it) Stacktrace/Logcat: Here's the content of crash-report.log I'm sorry I can't remember which kind of situation triggered this particular crash (at startup, or after pressing play); let me know if you need more details or examples and I'll try to get a crash log for each situation. Manager.description: I have been noticing this with several podcasts since the statistics feature was introduced, but was waiting for a very good example to be sure − got one now :) I have just started a new podcast − I listened to the trailer and two episodes − one of 44min and the other of 36min − and started a few seconds of another one. I only ever listen at 1.0 speed. The statistics tab, for that podcast, indicate 3.5 hours. Tapping the podcast indicates « 4 out of 10 episodes started. Played 3.5 hours out of 2.1 hours. ». I really do not see where these numbers would come from. When listening to podcasts, I very very often rewind 15s or so and was thinking this may me confusing the counters, but for this particular podcast, I listened to both episodes in one go. Found another example : a podcast where I only listened to the trailer (1.30min) and to the first 15 minutes of the first episode (of 39min). The statistics indicate « 2 out of 5 episodes started. Played 1.2 hours out of 0.7 hours. ». Same, only 1.0 speed, no rewinds, no re-listens. Since I use gpodder I can probably extract from the API my exact listening patterns of these two examples if that helps. Let me know if I can provide more information! App version: 1.6.2.2 (from F-Store) Android version: 5.1.1 Devide model: Samsung Galaxy S5 mini (SM-G800F)
Manager.title: Statistics are not accurate

I would love to see if users could enable or disable this yellow-marked section - as it is really eating up a lot of space from the notification area. App version: 1.x (current from Google Play) Android version: 6.x [Resurrection Remix] Devide model: Moto G 2015 Expected behaviour: Make playlist preview optional Current behaviour: playlist preview is not optional First occured: unsure
Manager.title: Add option/preference to enable/disable the playlist-preview in android notification area

Manager.title: Icons For Lock/Unlock Playlist Editing Backwards

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.2.3 (from Google Play) Android version: 4.1.2 Device model: Samsung Galaxy Ace 2 GT-I8160 (UK) Expected behaviour: When a new episode is published, AntennaPod checks a configuration element to see whether it should be added to the play "Queue". Only add to the play queue if this option is enabled, otherwise perform other configured actions, e.g. download but do not add to play queue. Current behaviour: All new (downloaded?) episodes are added to the play queue. Justification for feature request: I have a wide range of podcasts that are configured to automatically download new episodes as they are published. When I decide to listen to podcasts, I want to chose the episodes that I want to listen to which may not necessarily be all the podcasts downloaded, e.g. I may want to listen to some comedy on my walk to the station in the morning but a drama on the train journey home in the evening. I want to define the play list for my listening manually. Proposed implementation: I suggest a global Boolean configuration element, "Automatically add to play queue". This could be asserted by default to retain current behaviour, i.e. not change default behaviour of application. It may be advantageous to add a per-subscription option to override the global setting but I think the global setting is required. (My preferred workflow is to have no podcasts added to the play queue by default.) This setting may best be placed in the "QUEUE" section of the settings menu. (The settings menu is rather long so it may prove advantageous to add a sub-menu for queue management but that is not the subject of the feature request.)
Manager.title: Feature to NOT add new episodes to play queue

Manager.description: Intermittently but regularly when selecting the subscriptions view, many subscriptions are not shown and a thick blue bar, the width of a subscription tile appears. Touching the screen where a subscription tile should be sores open the subscription so it seems to be a display issue. App version: 1.6.2.3 (from Google Play) Android version: 4.1.2 Devide model: Samsung Galaxy Ace 2 GT-I8160 Expected behaviour: Selecting "Subscription" view shows a tile for each subscribed podcast. Current behaviour: Selecting "Subscription" view shows only some subscribed podcasts and other disruption to screen. First occured: Since I first used the App which was with this version. Steps to reproduce: Click on menu then "Queue". Click on menu then "Subscriptions". Repeat until occurs.
Manager.title: Screen corruption in subscription view

Thank you so much. :-) I use it on the following device: Huawei U8666E Android 4.0.3 Baseband version 2030 Kernel version 3.0.8-perf-00271 I experience the following problem: I start to play an episode I open the dropdown menu (swipe down from the top) I click on the "pause" button to pause the episode I close the dropdown menu I open the dropdown menu again I don't see a play button but still the pause button. Thank you for any help you can offer me! Yours, -Robert

Manager.description: Hi AntennaPod team, Problem: Bluetooth crashes as soon as I press play. "Unfortunately, Bluetooth has stopped." Behavior still occurs when Bluetooth is just on and not connected to any other device. If I close the app and restart, the problem occurs again. If I restart the phone, the problem still occurs again. I have (multiple times) cleared cache and data for the Bluetooth app and tried again, and the behavior still occurs. This behavior is limited to AntennaPod. Bluetooth does not crash during operation of other audio player apps such as Poweramp or stock music app. Expected: Bluetooth does not crash when I press play. (The occasional Bluetooth crash is expected, but I do not expect it to crash every time I press play in AntennaPod.) First occured: About 3 months ago. Has occurred since, every time I enable Bluetooth and press play. Steps to reproduce: Turn on Bluetooth Open up AntennaPod Select a podcast and press play Bluetooth crashes "Unfortunately, Bluetooth has stopped." Also occurs if AntennaPod is opened before Bluetooth is turned on, or if Bluetooth is turned on while podcast is playing. App version: 1.6.2.3 (from Google Play) Android version: 4.4.2 Device model: LG G3 D855 Environment: Sonic media player enabled, no Presstissimo. Stacktrace/Logcat: I send the latest crash report to myself via email and here it is: [ Environment ] Android version: 4.4.2 OS version: 3.4.0-perf-g4a750c6 AntennaPod version: 1.6.2.3 Model: LG-D855 Device: g3 Product: g3_global_com [ StackTrace ] java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to retrieve AudioTrack pointer for pause() at android.os.Parcel.readException(Parcel.java:1480) at android.os.Parcel.readException(Parcel.java:1426) at com.aocate.presto.service.IPlayMedia_0_8$Stub$Proxy.pause(IPlayMedia_0_8.java:778) at org.antennapod.audio.ServiceBackedAudioPlayer.pause(ServiceBackedAudioPlayer.java:501) at org.antennapod.audio.MediaPlayer.switchMediaPlayerImpl(MediaPlayer.java:588) at org.antennapod.audio.MediaPlayer.access$100(MediaPlayer.java:35) at org.antennapod.audio.MediaPlayer$4$1.run(MediaPlayer.java:403) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:841) Thanks in advance for your help and please let me know if you need any more information.
Manager.title: Bluetooth crashes as soon as I press play

Manager.description: Orbot provides an API to start the TOR service and send data through it. You can find examples of it being used in F-Droid, SyncThing, and the Duck Duck Go app, among others.
