Manager.description: Would you please add the ability to brows and subscribe to audio works on https://librivox.org? LibriVox already has a few feeds and a podcast page, but it would be nice if I could browse any work on the site and download chapters from it.
Manager.title: Add audio from LibriVox.org

Manager.description: Before removing the file's reference from the database when deleting an episode, check if the file was actually deleted.
Manager.title: Check successful file deletion

Manager.description: If the download service is killed by Android or a taskmanager, restarting the download creates a second file. The old one stays in the media folder without any reference in the database. As suggested by mfietz, the downloaded field in the DB should be expanded to allow persisting the state of started downloads. ❤️ 1
Manager.title: Resume downloads if service was killed

Manager.description: For this bug to happen you have to stop playback somewhere in the middle, then stop the app. When you reopen the app the progress bar is completely filled, like if you stopped right at the end of the episode, although the progress should be somewhere in the middle. App version: 1.6.2.3 (from F-Droid) Android version: 7.1.2 (LineageOS April Build) Devide model: Samsung Galaxy S4 i9505 Expected behaviour: Progress bar should show the current playback position after reopening the app Current behaviour: Playback progress bar is completely filled First occured: Version 1.6.2.3 (first time I observed this) Steps to reproduce: Start playback of an episode Kill the app (it must be completely stopped) Open the app -> Progress bar is completely filled When you tap on the progress bar and then go back the playback position is set properly Environment: only difference to default is night theme Stacktrace/Logcat: n/a
Manager.title: Playback progress bar is falsely filled after reopening the app

Manager.description: Hi, i am using AntennaPod on my phone since several month. While running vanialla (moto-version) Android 6.x it was stable and worked as expected - as a result i really love this application as it covers whatever i need from a podcast app. Since upgrading to Android 7.x (Lineage) i got the impression that AntennaPod is running pretty unstable for me. I found similar problem reports in the Google Play comments concerning Antennapod stability issues on Android 7. Some crash examples: App is crashing while downloading new episodes App is crashing while playing Crashes might happen in different styles: App is silently closed (usually when display is off) App is crashing showing an Android dialog that antennapod was closed offering option to reopen it or ignore until next boot (usually when display is on/active while crash happens) App is crashing as part of a soft-reboot of the device (usually when playing and display is off) To get a better impression about the run-times between crashes i'll add an example/excerpt of my today crashes Example crash history 16:58 - App closed silenty while playing with display off 16:59 - App closed silenty while playing with display off 17:00 - App closed silenty while playing with display off I was wondering if it changes if i do have the display running/on - so i kept using the phone for the following minutes 17:07 - App closed with OS crash dialog while display was on 17:12 - App closed with OS crash dialog while display was on Back to having display off 17:18 - App closed silenty while playing with display off 17:19 - App closed silenty while playing with display off 17:20 - App closed silenty while playing with display off App version: 1.6.2.3 (from Google Play) Android version: 7.1.2 [Lineage] Devide model: Moto G 2015 - Osprey Expected behaviour: Antennapod should play episodes without crashing Current behaviour: Antennapod is crashing First occured: According to my impression it started since Android 7.x Steps to reproduce: Hard to tell, usually i am really just listening to something having the display off. Environment: Episodes are stored on external sd card (tried 2 different cards so far) Stacktrace/Logcat: I do have a logcat output of this crashes mentioned above, please tell me if you want the full, or just :W, :E or :F to reduce the logcat clutter. I would love to offer any additional information needed and help as far as i can. Please let me know whatelse might help you.
Manager.title: Repeating app crashes on Android 7.x

Manager.description: --- Error:(188, 1) Execution failed for task ':app:filterAbout'. Cannot run program "git": CreateProcess error=2, El sistema no puede encontrar el archivo especificado
Manager.title: I want to open the app on Android Studio and appears the next error:

Manager.description: I'm not sure if this is possible, but I'd love to be able to play podcasts at the faster speed when Casting to my Google Home.
Manager.title: Play podcasts at faster speed over Cast

Manager.description: Expected behaviour: In the sleep menu, it would be nice to have a "sleep until end of episode" option. Even better, an "end of N episodes" option.
Manager.title: Sleep at end of episode

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.2.3 F-Droid Android version: 4.4.4 CyanogenMod Device model: Samsung Galaxy S4 Expected behaviour: Podcasts should download. They worked yesterday and have for years. Current behaviour: Downloads fail with this error: IO Error: java.security.cert.CertPathValidatorException: Trust anchor for certification path not found First occured: Today, same version. Haven't changed anything on my phone. I found this issue, but unlike that issue, I can't find any SSL/TLS/HTTPS certificate trust path errors on SSL Labs: https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/analyze.html?d=streamer1.afa.net I see that their cert expires in 9 days, but that shouldn't cause this. Note: I am able to download these podcasts with Firefox on Android without any problems. e.g. this URL works fine in Firefox but not in AntennaPod: https://streamer1.afa.net/tracking/streamer1.afa.net/afr-aod/sandyrios/sr_20170508.mp3 Thanks for your help.
Manager.title: Trust path error prevents downloads from streamer1.afa.net

Manager.description: The list of podcasts goes under the hamburger menu. I am suggesting moving it to a page of its own so the back button works. Current behavior Open menu click on a particular podcast such as Podcastle in the list of podcasts. menu closes Download an episode, or whatever. Click Back button Actual: I'm back at the home screen and the app is closed Expected: I'm returned to the list of podcasts.
Manager.title: UX: List of podcasts should be a page, not a menu so the back button works

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.2.3 Android version: 7.1.1 -- Lineage OS (latest) Devide model: Moto E 2015 Surnia Expected behaviour: The number next to "Episodes" in the side bar should match the number of new episodes in the scroll area. Current behaviour: The number next to "Episodes" is always one more than the number that are visible. When no episodes are available, it still shows "1". Steps to reproduce: I just upgraded from CyanogenMod to Lineage by reflashing the device (not an inplace upgrade). After installing AntennaPod, I restored its files from a backup with adb and set the permissions/SELinux context. Everything works fine other than this episode count is wrong. Is there any way to get AntennaPod to reset this count? Or does this number indicate something else is wrong? When I store the podcast files on an external SD card. When I first started AntennaPod after restoring its files, it started to download new episodes before it had permission to write to the SD card. I deleted those episodes (in the app) and then downloaded them again after granting permission. I don't know if this could somehow be related -- maybe it thinks there is an episode in internal storage still?
Manager.title: Episode count is wrong

Manager.description: I had some issues with my phone and settings where lost. Now I have a 'New' Playback History and I hope I have another Playback History in my backup. How can I merge these two to keep the history going forward. App version: 1.6.2.3 (from Google Play) Android version: 6.0 HTC stock rom Devide model: HTC one m8 Expected behaviour: Playback History is saved in file/SQL database. Old history can be appended/merged with newer Current behaviour: It is unknown to me where and in which format the playback history is stored.
Manager.title: How to merge 'Playback History' of two devised

Manager.description: Pausing AntennaPod via notification controls stops the program. The sane behavior would be for it to pause and not kill the program, so you don't have to launch the program via the application launcher.
Manager.title: Pausing AntennaPod via notification controls stops the program

Manager.description: Currently the following playback speeds are supported: 1,00X 1,25X 1,50X 1,75X 2,00X Reduced playback speed is missing though. In some podcast episodes speakers talk annoyingly fast, so reducing the playback speed could improve listening experience.
Manager.title: Reduced playback speed is missing

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.2.3 (from Google Play) Android version: 7.1.2 [LineageOS 14.1, 20170522, N2G47O] Device model: LG Nexus 5X Expected behaviour: Expanded notification should contain: the currently playing podcast control buttons (all four) queue section with upcoming podcasts (up to 3). If only two more episodes are playing after the current podcast, expanded notfication should show currently playing podcast but only two items. If no podcast is in the queue, expanded notification should look like normal notification (but with additional control buttons) with no separate queue section. Etc. Etc. Etc. The ability to turn off or change the number of queue items displayed in the the queue section of the expanded notification would be nice also. This section takes up half of the screen, and even if functioning, it would be nice to be able to reduce the size of it. Maybe I am unclear as to the purpose of this section, because there are no options that deal with this queue section of the notification. Current behaviour: Expanded notification queue does not update in real time, and first three items will display until queue is empty. First occured: I have only been using AntennaPod for a week. Steps to reproduce: At the end of the day, I have listened to all podcasts, so queue is empty. Overnight, podcasts autodownload and are added to queue (more than 3 podcasts). When I start playing podcasts in the morning, The expanded notification shows the currently playing podcast and the queue section shows the currently playing podcast (again) and the next two queue items. These queue items will stay the same until queue is empty again.
Manager.title: Queue section of expanded notification does not update until queue is empty

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.2.3 (from Google Play) Android version: 7.1.2 [LineageOS 14.1, 20170522, N2G47O] Device model: LG Nexus 5X Expected behaviour: Setting "Set Lockscreen Background: Set the lockscreen background to the current episode's image. As a side effect, this will also show the image in third party apps." should display the episode art on lockscreen. Current behaviour: No episode art shows on lockscreen. Toggling this setting does nothing. Podcast art and episode art downloads and displays correctly within the app. First occured: I have been using AntennaPod for a week.
Manager.title: Episode art does not display on lockscreen

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.2.3 from Google Play Android version: 7.1.2 lineage is rom Devide model: Samsung galaxy S5 klte Expected behaviour: sync Current behaviour: sync failed with timeout error First occured: always Steps to reproduce: just use app, automatic sync will fail. Manager.description: Hi, thank you for this APP! A bug I just encountered is, that a Feed I deleted from my abos that was still playing is only stopable by killing the app. Opening another one starts a second playback 2 podcasts at the same time. Try to play the leftover feed Expected: Deleted feeds Stream stops if something else is started / is controllable via buttons. Regards, Thomas

Manager.description: I have noticed that some of my feeds are over HTTP, even when there can be HTTPS. Probably that is an error with the person who edited the iTunes page. Removing the podcast and re entering it by hand would break the play history. Thus there should be a way to edit it. Even nicer it would be a way to make Antennapod check if there is a HTTPS version available and updated and automatically switch to the more secure version.
Manager.title: [request] An option to edit the Feed URL

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.2.3 Android version: 6.0.1 Device model: ZTE Z798BL Expected behaviour:new podcasts download each day Current behaviour: new download (just one episode) will not download b/c (I assume) there is an odd character in the filename First occured: 1 day ago Error message: Unknown Error: Unexpected char 0x2019 at 58 in header value: attachment; filename= "filename" Let me know if you need the actual filename. I assume it just doesn't like the character.
Manager.title: Unexpected char 0x2019

Manager.description: gpodder.net is currently down (their homepage has a maintenance message). When I searched for a podcast, I got an error about getting a bad response code 503. I happen to know that's an HTTP error code, but it would be super nice if AntennaPod could display a better message - something like, "gpodder is unavailable. Try again later?" (I'm happy to provide version info, etc., but I figured it wasn't necessary since this is an enhancement request, not an actual bug.)
Manager.title: Show a nice message for 5xx gpodder responses

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.2.3 (from F-Droid) Android version: 4.1 Device model: Wiko Cink PEAX 2 Expected behaviour: When there is network issue, the partial download should be deleted. Current behaviour: Once during a download there was a network issue. The download failed and a partial file was left. (e.g. foo.ogg) When the download was retried the partial download file wasn't removed. And the new file was foo-1.ogg The in app player still played the complete file (foo-1.ogg) When the episode was deleted it was the complete file (foo-1.ogg) But the partial file was foo.ogg was still there. So not a big deal but in case that might help, the info is here :-) It might be useful if more people get files that stay in the app directory. (feel free to close as won't fix if the ratio time/value*fun isn't there) First occured: 2017-07-01 This is the only occurrence Steps to reproduce: I didn't had the time to try to reproduce. Environment: I disabled "Update Interval or Time of Day" (I'm not sure if it was by default enabled)
Manager.title: Partially downloaded files aren't always deleted when there is a network issue

Manager.description: App version: 1.x (from Google Play/F-Droid/Custom build) latest git (c83659f) built with ./gradlew assembleDebug apk installed: ./app/build/outputs/apk/app-free-debug.apk Android version: 5.x [Please mention if you are using a custom rom!] 7.1.2 Device model: nexus 5x Expected behaviour: antenna pod is recognized by android auto Current behaviour: only spotify and google play music are recognized in the car Environment: [Settings you have changed, e.g. Auto Download. "Unusual" devices you use, e.g. Bluetooth headphones. Do you still use Prestissimo?] my car is a citroen grand c4 picasso
Manager.title: App not recognized in android auto

Manager.description: iVoox is a huge plataform for podcasts, I think it would be very nice to have some kind of implementation on AntenaPod in this aspect. I thought about: Adding a searcher (https://www.ivoox.com/{insert}_sb.html) Adding some kind of easier way to suscribe to a feed just introducing the website. Eg: https://www.ivoox.com/podcast-magonia_sq_f15884_1.html → https://www.ivoox.com/magonia_fg_f15884_filtro_1.xml (note: podcast-, sq fg, 1.html filtro_1.xml) Thank you so much for this excellent app!! 👍 1
Manager.title: ivoox: Searching and Subscribing

Manager.description: AntennaPod is my go-to app for listening in the car. Unfortunately it doesn't integrate well with Android's automobile technology. Instructions for supporting discovery and playback from Android Auto are found Here. Requirements Some labels in the Manifest file A conditional in alarm management to only trigger if not in Car mode Harder Stuff Implement the Queue as a MediaBrowserService Enable playback through a MediaSession Allow voice commands to control playback
Manager.title: Allow Audio Playback from Android Audio

Manager.description: Feature request: When connected to android auto, is it possible to just display what's been played last? Or display queue list. Right now, it requires multiple clicks do go to queue and find what was played last. I realize that this functionality is a work in progress.
Manager.title: Android auto layout

Manager.description: Could we have a checkbox under "settings" on individual podcasts' info pages to ensure they play at 1x speed? Would be useful for podcasts to do with music - I regularly have to manually revert a specific few of my subscribed casts for this reason.
Manager.title: [Feature request] flag individual podcasts as exempt from speed alteration

Manager.description: I have six podcasts already subscribed without problems. When attempting to subscribe to The Guardian's Brexit Means..., I got a message in Antennapod's download log saying "IO Error: open failed: EINVAL (Invalid argument)". The message did not specify which file name it complained about. The only bug looking vaguely relevant I found was #268, but that's supposed to be solved, and the podcast's name doesn't contain a colon. However, it does contain an apostrophe, which may or may not be legal in FAT32. Sure enough, if I change Antennapod's storage to internal I can subscribe to the podcast. App version: 1.6.2.3 (from F-Droid) Android version: 6.0.1 (Fairphone Open 17.07.6, not rooted, without Google services) Device model: Fairphone 2 Expected behaviour: The podcast should be subscribed, no matter the storage back-end Antennapod uses. Current behaviour: If storage is a FAT32 external SD card, the podcast is not subscribed, and a message saying "IO Error: open failed: EINVAL (Invalid argument)" appears in the download log. First occured: Version 1.6.2.3 was already installed the first time I tried, on August 5, 2017. Steps to reproduce: Go to Settings -> Choose Data Folder. Select your external SD card, formatted with FAT32 (e.g. /storage/1234-ABCD/). Go to Subscriptions -> Add Podcast. Enter https://www.theguardian.com/politics/series/brexit-means/podcast.xml in "Add Podcast by URL" 4.1. Alternatively, click "Search FYYD", enter guardian brexit and click the first result. Click "Subscribe". Environment: Auto Download is enabled on WiFi. When Antennapod is configured to use the external FAT32 SD card, the download fails. When Antennapod is configured to use internal storage, it succeeds. Stacktrace/Logcat (with timestamps and UID:s stripped to save you from scrolling to the right): 08-07 21:07:49.758 32371 15358 W System.err: java.io.IOException: open failed: EINVAL (Invalid argument) W System.err: at java.io.File.createNewFile(File.java:939) W System.err: at de.danoeh.antennapod.core.service.download.HttpDownloader.download(HttpDownloader.java:186) W System.err: at de.danoeh.antennapod.core.service.download.Downloader.call(Downloader.java:43) W System.err: at de.danoeh.antennapod.core.service.download.Downloader.call(Downloader.java:14) W System.err: at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:237) W System.err: at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:423) W System.err: at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:237) W System.err: at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1113) W System.err: at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:588) W System.err: at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:818) W System.err: Caused by: android.system.ErrnoException: open failed: EINVAL (Invalid argument) W System.err: at libcore.io.Posix.open(Native Method) W System.err: at libcore.io.BlockGuardOs.open(BlockGuardOs.java:186) W System.err: at java.io.File.createNewFile(File.java:932) W System.err: ... 9 more
Manager.title: Cannot subcribe to specific podcast when storage is on FAT32 external SD card: open failed: EINVAL

Manager.description: Using AntennaPod 1.6.2.3 -- trying to download any episodes from a soundcloud podcast feed fails. The log shows Unknown host: Unable to resolve host "feeds-tmp.soundcloud.com": No address associated with hostname. However, if I look at the the contents from a feed URL (http://feeds.soundcloud.com/users/soundcloud:users:264034133/sounds.rss) in a web-browser, there is no feeds-tmp host, but only URLs with feeds.soundcloud.com, which when pasted into a browser redirect properly and download an episode mp3 file.
Manager.title: Soundcloud feeds failing

Manager.description: From at least v1.6.2.3 you can no longer reorder the queue. I used to use that a lot. Galaxy S8 Android 7.0 I can't see anything in the changelog as to why or when it was removed. Can we get it back, if even as an option that has to be switched on?). Thanks!
Manager.title: Feature request: Bring back drag queue reordering (even if as an option)

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.3.0 (from Google Play) Commit: b1bb29d Android version: 7.1.1 Device model: Lenovo Moto Z Expected behaviour: Chapter Marks should be diplayed once in the chapter marks panel. Current behaviour: With some podcasts the chapter marks are displayed twice. Steps to reproduce: Import podcast from url http://freakshow.fm/feed/mp3 Play podcast, e.g. FS202 Dauerregensendung Switch to chapter mark panel. The chapter marks repeat a second time. Environment: Sonic Media Player

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.3.0 (from Google Play) Commit: b1bb29d Android version: 7.1.1 Device model: Lenovo Moto Z Expected behaviour: Continuous audio output when playing several items from playback list. Current behaviour: When using a Jaybird Freedom headset, most of the time when AntennaPod skips to the next podcast in the playback list, the audio output is silenced though the podcast is played. You have to pause and restart playback in the app to unsilence the audio output. Pausing and restarting with the buttons of the bluetooth headset doesn't solve the problem. Using a MPow Bluetooth receiver does not show this behaviour. Steps to reproduce: Connect the Jaybird Freedom Headset Play podcast When AntennaPod skips to the next item most of the time it silences the output. Pausing and unpausing in the app resolves the issue. Environment: Jaybird Freedom Headset various playback speeds (1.75 up to 3.0) Sonic Media Player Headset disconnection/reconnection enabled Bluetooth reconnection enabled pause on interruption restart after call
Manager.title: no audio output when auto switching to next item in playback list when using jaybird freedom bluetooth headset

Manager.description: If try to download sounds from a feed of ximalaya, such as the following, http://www.ximalaya.com/album/242836.xml, it fails. If try to play one sound from the feed, it fails too, and the app just hangs there and will not play sounds from the normal feeds. In fact, the play interface won't react to any operation, so i think feeds from ximalaya is something like poison. If I want to make the app wake up and play sounds from the normal feeds, such as the following, http://feeds.podtrac.com/zKq6WZZLTlbM, I must clear the data of it from the app manager.
Manager.title: ximalaya feed causes play problem

Manager.description: Some podcasts have a "Subscribe on Android" link that automatically adds them to some Android podcasts app (e.g. Podcast Addict). Those links don't currently work for AntennaPod. Should be simple to add -- I might give it a try if nobody beats me to it. http://subscribeonandroid.com/developers/
Manager.title: [Feature request] Support automatic subscribe links

Manager.description: Some internet radio stations offer podcasts while at the same time offering a live feed to the show currently playing on the radio -- would be nice to be able to handle both in the same app (e.g. Podcast Addict allows this)
Manager.title: [Feature request] Support live streaming radio stations

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.3.0 (from Google Play) Commit: b1bb29d Android version: 7.1.1 Device model: Lenovo Moto Z Expected behaviour: Navigation notifications should pause playback, play and unpause afterwards when using bluetooth headsets. Current behaviour: When using a Jaybird Freedom headset (a2dp-profile) listening to podcasts with AntennaPod and using Google Maps or e.g. Komoot as navigation app does not work as expected. Whem there is a navigation announcement the playback pauses, then there is silence for some time and then the playback unpauses. BikeCitizionGuide works like expected. I don't know if this is a issue with AntennaPod, Android or the way the navigation apps work. Steps to reproduce: Connect the Jaybird Freedom Headset Play podcast Start navigating with Google Maps. Navigation announcements remain silent. Environment: Jaybird Freedom Headset various playback speeds (1.75 up to 3.0) Sonic Media Player (doesn't matter) Headset disconnection/reconnection enabled Bluetooth reconnection enabled pause on interruption restart after call
Manager.title: Audio mixing problems with other apps when using bluetooth headset with a2dp-profile

Manager.description: App version: Commit: b1bb29d Android version: 8.0 official Device model: Nexus 5x playback starts on its own when phone is laying on the table, idle. Tonight, it started at 0:33 am and than again at 04:20 am. my family hates me now.
Manager.title: playback starts randomly

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.2.3 (F-Droid) Android version: 7.1.2 (CopperheadOS) Device model: Nexus 6P Desired behaviour: I'd like to be able to easily switch the 'Continuous Playback' setting option on and off without having to go into the 'Settings' every time. As I use the queue to organise my playlists it would be good to have this option here. Maybe an icon switch in the top menu, similar to the way the lock icon works. Current behaviour: You have to go into the 'Settings' and scroll down to find the option and then come back out again.

Manager.description: The app plays a podcast without any effort. My Device was in my pocket or was laying on the table. Nexus 5X with Android O 8.0.0. AntennaPod Version: 1.6.2.3

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.2.3 from F-Droid Android version: 7.1.2 Device model: Google Pixel Expected behaviour: Episodes of Secret Feminist Agenda to play when the Play button is pressed. What's needed is a download button on this screen next to each episode. The episode would appear in the downloads list and the usual queue. App version: 1.6.2.3 Android version: 8.0
Manager.title: RFE: Download single episode without subscribing

This should not block all the other presumably valid feeds from displaying. App version: 1.x (from Google Play/F-Droid/Custom build) Android version: 8.0 Device model: Pixel Expected behaviour: shows

Manager.description: Ever since the Android 8 update I've had podcasts suddenly start playing for no reason. On one occasion it started in the middle of the night. On another I went back to the room where I left my phone and found it merrily playing away. I think it might have been on charge on both occasions, but not just put on. Twice it's happened while I've been reading a book in the Kindle app. My sleeping wife was not amused! Strangely, it seems to start at the beginning of a podcast, not where I last left off. The resume on headphones/Bluetooth feature still gets that right.
Manager.title: Playback starts randomly

Manager.description: I have AntennaPod set up to skip forward in time not tracks, but after the upgrade of Android OS to the latest 8.0.0, the behaviour changed. "Forward button skips" is turned off. App version: 1.6.2.3 Android version: 8.0.0 Device model: Nexus 5x Expected behaviour: Car "Forward" button should skip 30 seconds forward Current behaviour: Skipping to next track First occured: When I upgraded OS. Steps to reproduce: Press button on my steering wheel :) with bluetooth connected. This Than that Then Environment: [Settings you have changed, e.g. Auto Download. "Unusual" devices you use, e.g. Bluetooth headphones. Do you still use Prestissimo?] Stacktrace/Logcat: [if available]
Manager.title: Oreo - Car Forward / Back buttons now skipping tracks not seconds

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.2.3 from Google Play Android version: 6.0.1 Device model: Sony Xperia Z3 Compact Expected behaviour: When gpodder sync fails, I'd like to be able to see some information why (e.g. if there were a log viewer inside antennapod, it could say "connection timed out" or at least some http status codes like 503 or 418 or whatever). Current behaviour: Just says "Last sync attempt: Failed (2 minutes ago)" First occured: Version 1.x / about x days/weeks ago 3 minutes ago Steps to reproduce: Try to sync with gpodder when I guess gpodder is down but I can't tell because there's no log info Be unable to tell what is wrong Environment: [Settings you have changed, e.g. Auto Download. "Unusual" devices you use, e.g. Bluetooth headphones. Do you still use Prestissimo?] Just subscribed to a podcast and logged in with gpodder (successfully logged in it seems, since gpodder.net shows my device) Stacktrace/Logcat: Can I do this from inside the app?
Manager.title: More info on gpodder sync fail

Manager.description: Is there any way to disable the functionality where holding down the volume button skips and marks done an entire track? This is a really frustrating feature. Several times, I've gone to raise or lower the volume, only for AntennaPod to skip the entire track, mark it played, and delete the downloaded file. It's really subtle and difficult to avoid, because doing a single volume press doesn't usually cause this, but accidentally holding the volume it down for even one whole second does cause it. I can't see any option under the settings to change this. Is this a feature in AntennaPod or is it built-in to Android?
Manager.title: Disable track skip functionality

Manager.description: When/how is a new release for AntennaPod decided? I ask because I am encountering a lot of issues with adding podcasts from iTunes due to feedUrl json exceptions. This seems to have been resolved in this commit: 99588bb Unfortunately, the nightly builds are quite old and not include this commit. Is my only recourse to clone the repo and build the .apk myself? Thanks for the help. 👍 5
Manager.title: Next release?

Current behaviour: When searching for podcasts that contain the letters h, i, m, q, w, x, y, or z I get the following error message: "org.json.JSONException: No value for feedUrl" and no responses are listed. First occured: October 12, 2017
Manager.title: Error when adding podcasts

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.2.3 (from F-Droid) Android version: 7.1.2 [LineageOS] Device model: SGH-M919 Expected behaviour: On a failed podcast search returning to search again should not display an error. Current behaviour: Searched for a podcast on iTunes. Attempted the text "on the media". Received an error: After seeing this, I attempted to go back to search for a shorter string in hopes of finding the "On the Media" podcast. In going back, I find that the error is still shown along with a list of podcasts: First occured: Do not know the earliest version this occurs on, only observed it today. Steps to reproduce: See Current Behavior section. Environment: Nothing out of the ordinary Stacktrace/Logcat: No logs were emitted at the time which were from AntennaPod.

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Screenshots on F-Droid

Manager.description: Currently, only all media files are deleted. The (empty) feed folder stays on the SD card.
Manager.title: Delete media folder when deleting feed

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.2.3 from Google Play Android version: 8.0.0 Device model: Pixel Expected behaviour: AntennaPod only plays when I ask it to :-) Current behaviour: AntennaPod will start playing some episode I've listened and finished recently. Usually one I've finished listening to. The only way to prevent this is to delete played episodes. Events that seem to trigger this include connecting to a car via Bluetooth Audio, and certain Play Store updates (I don't know if the Antenna Pod pod itself or some services, like the Web View or Google Services). Because of this bug AntennaPod has started playing in inappropriate situations, such as in the middle of the night and while my phone was charging on my office desk. This seems to be related to issue #2425, as the episode plays in the same hidden mode that requires killing the app. First occured: 4-8 weeks ago Environment: [Settings you have changed, e.g. Auto Download. "Unusual" devices you use, e.g. Bluetooth headphones. Do you still use Prestissimo?] Headphones Reconnect and Bluetooth Reconnect options are disabled. So is Keep Skipped Episodes. This happened many times both with Bluetooth Audio and without headphones. I don't discard that it could happen with headphones, I just never experienced it, because the I don't normally do the things that have triggered this problem while the headphones are connected.
Manager.title: Starts playing unexpectedly

Manager.description: Hi, I found API AlarmManager.set() is used in UserPreferences.java to schedule the alarm to update the feeds automatically at some time. For your information, from API 19, the alarm scheduled by this API may not be triggered at the exact time you set. It may be delayed due to the system scheduling. So, the update may be delayed. To have on time alarm scheduling, you may use setExact or setWindow instead. Thx.
Manager.title: Using AlarmManager.set() to set the alarm and update feeds may be delayed

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.2.3 from Google Play Android version: 6.0.1 Device model: Nexus 5 Expected behaviour: MP3 with non-ASCII character in filename will be downloaded Current behaviour: MP3 with ø in filename fails to download First occurred: This is the first time I noticed it. Steps to reproduce: Find a feed that has an MP3 file with ø in the filename. Attempt to download the MP3. Observe that it fails. Consider trying with other non-ASCII characters and repeat. Environment: No special environment Screenshot: Notes: The podcaster has renamed the file as a workaround: I have hopefully resolved the issue, as if AntennaPod had an issue other players may have the same issue. If it still doesn’t work for you after a couple of hours from now, please let me know and I will continue to try and troubleshoot it. From your screenshot it looked like it had the issue with the ø character in Stian Veum Møllersen’s name that I had in the name of the mp3 file. I renamed that file and replaced and the ø with a o, and told the cache to expire, so if it doesn’t refresh for you as well, please let me know. As far as opening a issue, it may be worth it just to let them know that it doesn’t like the encoded ø in the URL.
Manager.title: Download fails on an MP3 with a ø in the filename showing "Unknown Error: Unexpected char 0xf8"

Manager.description: Dear team, when I take a look in the play store the current version is 1.6.4.1, in tbe F-Droid store the current version is 1.6.2.3. What's the reason for this gap? Is there a bug in thr build process? Please fix this. Kind Regards, Krawei
Manager.title: Current Version not available in F-Droid store

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.4.1 Android version: 7.1.2 LineageOS build 14.1-20171023-NIGHTLY-d801 Nova Launcher for home screen Bug also exists using the default Trebuchet launcher Device model: LG G2 Expected behaviour: Text color is easy to read on the grey widget background The podcast name is shown. In the attached screenshot, you can also see a weather widget and another podcast player widget. Both provide transparency, have white text and are easier to read. Ideally provide the user with a way to customize the widget colors / transparency as other widgets do Current behaviour: Details text is in black which is hard to read against the grey background. There is less contrast on the actual screen than in the screenshot. The widget background and text stay the same regardless of wallpaper. The name of the podcast isn't shown. First occurred: Immediately on installation of AntennaPod today Steps to reproduce: Install AntennaPod Long press the screen to add a widget and select the AntennaPod widget
Manager.title: Bug: Text on widget is hard to read

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.4.1 Android version: 7.1.1 Device model: Moto Z Play (2016) Expected behaviour: Notification dissapears, when process finishes. Or at least I can swipe the notification away. My real expectation is: I'm not even interested in this notification, since it only shows useless information about some background processing. I don't want to see that. Current behaviour: The following notification remains for hours and hours and can't be swiped away. Only killing the application hard removes the notification. In German: "Lade Podcast-Daten Verarbeite Downloads" My english translation: "Loading Podcast-Data Processing Downloads" First occured: Steps to reproduce: I have automatic update with download active to download during the night. The next morning, I see the stuck notification. Environment: [Settings you have changed, e.g. Auto Download. "Unusual" devices you use, e.g. Bluetooth headphones. Do you still use Prestissimo?] Auto Download is active, also when on battery. Only in Wifi. No Wifi filter. Auto Download happens at 3:00am same time every day.
Manager.title: Bug: Stuck Notification "Loading Podcast-Data"

Manager.description: Hi, I try to make a PR for support Android O and this sucks Why do you have a 'core' module with same flavors ? In our company we merged the modules (and if you want you can separate it with packages) and the result was a easier build script and faster build times. If you like a merge of modules, I can make a PR and add support Android O too. Please let me know ! PS: I just ask to save my time, because a lot of open source projects are not very open to new ideas.
Manager.title: Android O

Manager.description: I bought a new device and after transfer data from old to new device by Google setup, AntennaPod is installed on new device -great- but all data are lost -bad- Is there a way to export/import (or other transfer) from old device to new device ? I ask because it's probably more efficient to ask here instead of searching in the code. Thank you !
Manager.title: new device and transfer AntennaPod content

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.4.1 (from Google Play) Android version: 8.0.0 Device model: Nexus 5X Expected behaviour: Current play time should persist in the following cases: I pause the current podcast and come back to it later. I close AntennaPod and reopen it. I pause a currently playing podcast, play another and come back to the first podcast. Current behaviour: The podcast restarts (starts playing at 0:00). First occured: About a month ago. Potentially when I upgraded to Android 8.0.
Manager.title: Current Play Time Does Not Persist

Manager.description: I started a large number of downloads and then had to leave, resulting in wifi disconnecting. I then turned off wifi. I later discovered that the downloads were still running on cell only. I could find no `stop downloads' and had to stop them one at a time. Moble updates were disabled. App version: 1.6.4.1 Android version: 7.0 Device model: LG-G5 Expected behaviour: Downloads stops when disconnected from wifi. Current behaviour: downloads continue to run. Steps to reproduce:
Manager.title: Downloads do not stop when wifi is disconnected

Manager.description: I have the Nexus 5X running Android 8.0 and antennaPod 1.6.4.1 . Did a factory reset and only have a couple other non factory apps installed. First let me say I tried all the podcast players out there and this was by far the best. I really loved this program until recent and wish I hadn't updated to android 8. Today it just got so bad I couldn't take it anymore thats why I'm opening a bug report. So many problems I don't know where to start. 1 Randomly just starts playing when plugging into the charger Randomly starts playing if I let call go unanswered while plugged in to charger Randomly starts playing after using the camera and then turning screen off and putting in pocket. 2 Sometimes starts up playing multiple pod casts at the same time including the last podcast I listened to thats marked as played and shows download only. Update - Today when it began to play on its own I discovered that it was playing the same episode over top of itself. The episode began simultaneously playing from where I left off and also from the very beginning. How can that even happen? 3 Today it just started playing when I turned the display off and I couldn't shut it off. None of the playback control buttons would respond and it continued to play even after I closed all programs. I had to open up android settings, all apps, and manually stop antenna pod to get it to shut down. 4 Sometimes when restarting an paused episode the playback will start completely over at the very beginning instead of where I left off. 5 This problem has me even more confused because I'm not sure whats to blame. The same podcasts I been getting from Itunes using the same unchanged home network take much longer to download. A podcast that use to take 2 min now takes 30 minutes. Very frustrating. 👍 2
Manager.title: So many problems since Andriod 8 update on Nexus 5X

Manager.description: It is not reading my episode list, playback history, subscriptions, or queue. Near as I can tell these are all still on the device. Or at least something is taking up that space. Force stop and clear cache did not fix. Attempting reboot now, but I fear I've lost my subscription list.
Manager.title: Stopped considering all local data

Manager.description: It would be nice to have an option to Archive Podcasts. Archiving a podcast would mean there won't be any more updates and the podcast would be moved to a different section than the Subscriptions. This way, a dead podcast or a podcast that is uninteresting at the moment would be both stopped and the user will not lose the read status, the place where a certain episode was stopped, the list of favorites, and so on.
Manager.title: An Option to Archive Podcasts

First occured: 1.6.4.2 Steps to reproduce: Play any podcast episode Environment: Tried with headphones, with internal speaker and bluetooth. Tried with Sonic Media Player and without. Tried with different speeds. All changes had no effect. Last system update for the Huawei was done about a week ago. I can not verify if the system update or the app update caused the problem. Stacktrace/Logcat: No stacktrace available Please let me know how to help you with this. AntennaPod worked fine a week ago on that device.

Manager.title: Possibility to group podcasts

Manager.description: App version: 1.6.4.2 Android version: 8 Device model: One Plus 3T Expected behaviour: It should start playing where it stopped last time Current behaviour: Sometimes it remembers the previous played podcast or reproduction time, and starts from there First occured: a few weeks ago Steps to reproduce: play some podcast, then remove the headphones. Playing stops at certain time A. Wait Add headphones again and play up to time B. Remove headphones. Wait. Add headphones again It starts at point A, not at point B, where it was supposed to do it. Environment: [Settings you have changed, e.g. Auto Download. "Unusual" devices you use, e.g. Bluetooth headphones. Do you still use Prestissimo?] Stacktrace/Logcat: [if available]
Manager.title: Sometimes it does jump back to the reproduction time of the before last reproduction

Manager.description: Hello, I've got a recurring problem I can't seem to find anything about, though I might not know what I'm looking for. The app runs fine and I love it, but I keep getting a failed download error and I have no idea where it's coming from. The error is 'unsupported Feed Type: Invalid type' and the podcast listed is http://rmc.fr I have no idea what that is or how to get rid of it. From a Google search it looks like a sport talk radio show or some such. I just want it to stop trying to download whatever this is but can't figure out where or what it is. Could be a virus for all I know. If I'm missing any information, please just ask. Be aware I'm only moderately technically proficient so I might have to ask a lot of questions. Any help in fixing this issue would be great appreciated or even an idea about what is going on. Thank you for your time and consideration. App version: 1.6.4.2 Android version: 6.0.1 Device model: Honor 5x running EMUI 4.0 Expected behaviour: Current behaviour: First occurred: It's been happening for months and I'm just now getting around to trying to fix it. It's been a busy year and this is a very minor annoyance. Steps to reproduce: It does this on it's own when it updates my podcasts which I have set for every 8 hours. Environment: It's set to only download podcasts on WiFi. All my podcasts are set to auto download the newest episodes.
Manager.title: Error: failed download unsupported Feed Type: Invalid type

Manager.description: On larger screen it is kind of hard to reach top right to tap refresh button. Pull to refresh would be ideal.
Manager.title: FR: Pull to refresh feed list
